TaxAuthority: General Tax Administration (Administração Geral Tributária - AGT)
TPLaw: Presidential Decree 147/13, Industrial Tax Code (Law 19/14, Law 26/20), and BNA Circular No. 002/DCC/2020
TPSection: Article 11 of Chapter IV of Presidential Decree 147/13 of 1 October 2013
BEPS13Overview: No
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: Turnover of more than AOA7 billion, or listed on large taxpayers list (large government-owned companies, financial banking institutions, insurance and reinsurance companies, pension fund management companies and pension funds, payment system operators and providers, microcredit companies, oil and gas companies, diamond companies, telecommunications companies, and companies operating in a monopoly regime). No materiality limit for economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Portuguese) required- Individual testing of transactions preferred.
OtherRequiredDocs: Detailed form describing TP policy, identifying related parties, transactions, methods, interquartile range (min, Q1, median, Q3, max), number of comparables, and adjustments. Special section for intra-group financing. Additional burden of proof for contracts with foreign related entities for services.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 May (Group A)/30 April (Group B)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: 30 June
LocalComparables: Very limited local comparable data available. If local comparables cannot be found, comparability adjustments can be performed on regional comparables.
SingleYearAnalysis: No reference to preferences in local legislation. Practical approach- test taxpayer's single-year results against multiple-year interquartile ranges.
InterquartileRange: In recent tax audits, the tax authorities have used the interquartile range as a reference.
AnnualBenchmarking: Although not specified in the legislation, doing a fresh benchmarking study is followed in practice.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Local independence threshold or criteria should be used. If local comparables cannot be found, comparability adjustments can be performed on regional comparables.
CompliancePenals: Failure to comply with documentation requirements may shift burden of proof. Penalty from AOA10,000 to AOA50,000 (maximum applied in practice). Reputational risk. May be forbidden from performing capital operations, current invisible transactions, or trading operations requiring National Bank of Angola intervention.
PenaltiesPostAudit: If a transfer pricing adjustment is made, a penalty equivalent to 25% of the additional tax will be applied, plus late interest at 1% per month (12% per year). No interest on penalties. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years from the last day of the tax year-end or 10 years in cases of tax infringement.
AdjustmentRegulations: Not applicable
AuditLikelihood: Large taxpayers. Currently, food wholesale and retail players.
APAAvailable: No
MAPAvailable: Only if available in the specific context of a convention to avoid double taxation, namely with Portugal.
ThinCapRegulations: Angola does not have thin capitalization rules. Shareholder loan interest expenses are tax-deductible as of 18 April 2019 (No. 1 of Article 16 of the Industrial Tax Code), provided the portion exceeding the average annual interest rate established by the National Bank of Angola is added to taxable income.

TaxAuthority: Collection Agency and Customs Control (Agencia de Recaudación y Control Aduanera - ARCA) (formerly Agencia Federal de Ingresos Públicos - AFIP)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings, Administrative Orders, and AFIP General Resolutions
TPSection: Section 14 of the Administrative Order as amended by Decree 1170/2018 and by Decree 862/2019
BEPS13Overview: Covers Local File, Master File, and CbCR, effective 2017/2018. CbCR and Master File must be filed in Spanish and include additional information beyond OECD template.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation needs to be submitted contemporaneously depending on thresholds. Local branch of foreign company must comply. Documentation must be prepared annually. Stand-alone reports required for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: ARS3 million/ARS300,000 (general) or ARS30 million (if Master File/CbCR not required). CbCR: EUR750 million annual global income. Master File: ARS4 billion consolidated annual income AND ARS3 million/ARS300,000 international related-party transactions. Local File: ARS3 million/ARS300,000 (general) or ARS30 million (if Master File/CbCR not required).
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Spanish) required. No safe harbor. Individual testing preferred. Additional disclosures for import/export intermediaries, commodities, services (benefit test), and financial transactions (debt capacity).
TaxReturnDeadline: 15 May (fifth month after fiscal year-end)
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Last week of March (third month after fiscal year-end for first notification)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: 15 May (by the time of lodging the tax return)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Fiscal year-end plus six months (for Form 4501 and report); 10 working days upon tax authority request.
TPMethodPreference: Yes, strong preference for internal comparables. Best method rule applies. Tested party must be local entity. CUP preferred for commodities. Interquartile range mandatory.
LocalComparables: No specific requirement, but ARCA requests publicly available information (Forms 10-K, 20-F, ARS or similar and audited financial statements in Spanish or English).
SingleYearAnalysis: Single-year analysis required for tested party; multiyear for comparables must be justified.
InterquartileRange: Yes, mandatory for prices, consideration, or profit margins when two or more comparable transactions are determined. Median and interquartile range are used.
AnnualBenchmarking: Recommended every year, but reasonable update of financials is accepted.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Preference for internal comparables, when available.
CompliancePenals: Late/incomplete documentation: ARS20,000 fine, tax rating downgrade. Failure to furnish CbCR: ARS600,000-ARS900,000. Failure to furnish Master File: ARS20,000 fine, tax rating downgrade. Other penalties for late filing (ARS20,000), noncompliance with formal duties (up to ARS45,000, higher for large income), unpaid taxes (200%-300% of unpaid tax), fraud (2-6x unpaid tax). CbCR notification penalties: ARS15,000-ARS200,000 depending on specific failure.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No (if tax is paid). Interest accrues on unpaid tax balances. Penalty relief available for voluntary amendments or acceptance of adjustments.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years for registered taxpayers, 10 years for unregistered. Begins 1 January following tax return due year. Extended by moratorium regimes. Documentation must be kept for up to five years after statute of limitations period.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, if outside interquartile range, adjustment to median value.
AuditLikelihood: Pharmacy, automotive, export of commodities. Financial transactions and foreign intermediaries.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral and bilateral, but implementation regulations are pending.
MAPAvailable: Yes, but process is not simple.
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization rules limit interest/FX loss deductibility to 30% of taxable income (before interest, FX losses, depreciation) for related-party debts. Excess carried forward for 5 years, un-utilized capacity for 3 years. Exceptions apply. Debt capacity and business reasons for loans must be documented. Follows OECD family approach for financial transactions.

TaxAuthority: State Revenue Committee (SRC)
TPLaw: Tax Code of the Republic of Armenia, Chapter 73
TPSection: Tax Code of the Republic of Armenia, Chapter 73, Article 362
DomesticTPObligations: Yes, with documentation obligation for specific controlled domestic transactions (mineral royalty payer or income-royalty tax privileges).
OECDGuidelines: Unreliant; no reference in Tax Code, no practice yet.
BEPS13Overview: Jurisdiction has adopted CbCR, Master File, and Local File requirements, effective 1 January 2024, with specific thresholds. No material differences from OECD templates.
DocRequirements: Yes, prepared annually, stand-alone for each entity, submitted upon request (30 working days). Local branches must comply.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: AMD200 million (sum of all controlled transactions). CbCR: > EUR750 million annual global income. Master File: < EUR750 million annual global income. Local File: > AMD200 million (controlled transactions). No materiality limit for economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement, but translation to Armenian within 10 working days upon request. Safe harbor unspecified. Aggregation-individual testing unspecified.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: No, but a separate notification form on controlled transactions must be filed by 20 April.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, according to Accounting Standard 24 of Armenia.
TaxReturnDeadline: 20 April
MasterFileDeadline: Thirty working days after a request from tax authorities
CbCRDeadline: Twelve months after reporting period end
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Twelve months after reporting period end
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Thirty working days after a request from tax authorities
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline, but within 30 working days upon tax authority request.
TPMethodPreference: Yes, CUP is the priority method.
LocalComparables: Foreign comparables acceptable if local information is lacking, with comparability adjustments.
SingleYearAnalysis: A multiyear analysis (three years) is preferred.
InterquartileRange: Yes, specific formulas provided for lower and upper quartiles based on integer-fraction results of (quantity * 0.25) or (quantity * 0.75).
AnnualBenchmarking: No specific guidelines, but best practice is fresh benchmarking every year.
CompliancePenals: AMD500,000 for incomplete notification; AMD1-5 million for late notification (based on turnover); 10% of controlled transactions for late TP documentation submission.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No penalty for incomplete-non-contemporaneous documentation. Interest charged at 0.075% per day. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years.
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes. Audit frequency depends on taxpayer risk (high: once in 3 years; medium: once in 4 years; low: once in 5 years).
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes. Self-adjustment: at least to lower quartile. Tax authority adjustment: to median value.
AuditLikelihood: None specified.
APAAvailable: Yes
APATenure: Up to three years with possibility of prolongation for additional two years
ThinCapRegulations: Interest expenses on loans from non-banks-credit organizations not deductible in excess of two times net assets. For banks-credit organizations, nine times net assets.
PCbCRCriminalRisk: No / Not applicable / No / Not applicable

TaxAuthority: Australian Taxation Office (ATO)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Assessment Acts, Tax Administration Act, and double tax agreements. Specific subdivisions 815-B, C, D, E, 177G-R, and 284-255. Diverted profits tax.
TPSection: Various Taxation Rulings (TR), Practice Statements Law Administration (PS LA), Practical Compliance Guidelines (PCG), Taxpayer Alerts, and specific guidance documents. Key case law also exists.
OECDGuidelines: Largely, referring directly to 2022 OECD Guidelines for years starting on or after 1 January 2022, and earlier versions for prior years.
BEPS13Overview: Adopted OECD's three-tiered approach (Master File, Local File, CbCR). Local File interpretation deviates significantly from global norm. Requirements met via LCMSF (Local File, CbC report notification, Master File, Short-form local file, Financials) in XML format.
BEPS13PenaltyProtection: No, specific documentation requirements under Subdivision 284-E TAA 1953 must be met for penalty protection (RAP). Australian Local File is a separate requirement.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation is not compulsory but required contemporaneously (before income tax return lodgment) to establish a Reasonably Arguable Position (RAP) for penalty mitigation. Annual preparation is required. Applies to local branches of foreign companies.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: No threshold. CbCR, Master File, Local File: AUD1 billion annual global income. Local File has a short-form option for entities with less than AUD2 million in international related-party transactions (and no exclusions). Economic analysis: No threshold.
SpecificRequirements: Documentation in English or readily convertible to English. No formal safe harbors, but PCG 2017-2 offers simplified record-keeping options for specific transactions and thresholds. No preference for aggregation or individual testing- depends on facts and circumstances.
TPReturn: Yes, including CbCR, Reportable Tax Position (RTP) schedule, and International Dealings Schedule (IDS).
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: Yes, an International Dealings Schedule (IDS) is required with the tax return, with detailed disclosures for international related-party dealings exceeding AUD2 million. Parts of IDS can be waived if Part A of Local File (LCMSF) is lodged.
CbCRinTaxReturn: No, disclosed in tax return, but CbCR notification is separate via LCMSF form.
OtherRequiredDocs: Reportable Tax Position (RTP) schedule and International Dealings Schedule (IDS) are required.
TaxReturnDeadline: Varies, typically six months and 15 days after year-end for most companies.
TPReturnDeadline: At the same time as lodging the corporate tax return (i.e., six months and 15 days after year-end for IDS and RTP schedule).
LocalFilePrepDeadline: TP documentation: By the corporate tax return lodgment date. Local File: 12 months after year-end.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: TP documentation: No statutory filing deadline, but must be submitted within 28 days upon ATO request. Local File: 12 months after year-end.
TPMethodPreference: Yes, the "most appropriate" method is required, referring to OECD Guidelines. Traditional transaction methods (CUP, resale price, cost-plus) and profits-based methods (profit-split, TNMM) are accepted. Other methods are acceptable only if traditional methods cannot be reliably applied.
LocalComparables: Yes, strong preference for local comparables. Foreign comparables accepted only if reliable local ones are unavailable.
SingleYearAnalysis: No, multi-year (five-year) analysis is generally acceptable, but ATO may challenge profiles with combined low/loss years.
InterquartileRange: No formal guidelines, but interquartile ranges using spreadsheet formulas are generally acceptable. Results outside the range must be disclosed as Category A RTP if material.
AnnualBenchmarking: No specific requirement. Benchmarking can be rolled forward for one or two years with financial updates, provided no significant industry or functional profile changes.
BenchmarkingType: Generally weighted averages are used; pooled results are rare.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance/incomplete documentation: No RAP, leading to higher penalties. Failure to furnish CbCR, Master File, or Local File: Maximum 2,500 penalty units (AUD825,000). Incorrect disclosures may lead to increased penalties.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation (no RAP, higher penalties). Interest charged on tax shortfall, not penalties. Shortfall penalties (10%-50% of shortfall, doubled for SGEs, depending on purpose and documentation), failure-to-lodge penalties (up to AUD825,000 for SGEs), false/misleading disclosure penalties. Penalty relief possible with RAP, voluntary disclosure (20%-80% reduction), or APA. Commissioner has discretion to remit.
TPLimitationPeriod: Seven years for Subdivisions 815-B, C, D (from assessment date). No limitation for years before 1 July 2013 (Division 13) and for Subdivision 815-A (1 July 2004 - 30 June 2013). Some DTAs specify time limits.
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes, common, especially for top companies and those with material international related-party transactions.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, consequences include an adjustment. ATO may challenge the method itself (e.g., rejecting cost-plus for sales-based, or seeking profit-split). Chance of adjustment is medium to high.
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific regulations, but ATO typically adjusts to the median.
AuditLikelihood: Yes. Centralized business models in low-tax jurisdictions, low profitability/losses, financing arrangements, business restructuring, transactions with low-tax jurisdictions, intangible property payments (royalties, licensing), and management service fees. Pharmaceutical and technology industries are also targeted.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral, bilateral, and multilateral APAs are available.
APARollback: Historically available, still included in PS LA, but ATO may use other mechanisms such as a -letter of comfort- or a -settlement deed-.
ThinCapRegulations: Debt Deduction Creation Rules (denying interest on certain financing). TP regulations require assessment of arm's-length debt level and interest rate (excess interest permanently denied). Thin capitalization rules (temporary denial) with three tests: Default fixed ratio test (30% of tax EBITDA), Group ratio test, and Third-party debt test.
PCbCRRegulations: Section 3D of the Taxation Administration Act 1953
PCbCRStartDate: Years starting on or after 1 July 2024
PCbCRSection: Section 3D of the Taxation Administration Act 1953
PCbCRMaterialityExemptions: Yes, if Australian revenue of the global group is less than AUD10 million.
PCbCR_BEPS13Alignment: No, partial alignment but requires additional documents, prescriptive data source, and differing related-party revenue requirements.
PCbCRAggregationAllowed: Yes, for all countries except Australia and 40 specified countries (which include Switzerland, Singapore and Hong Kong).
PCbCRDataSources: Pending, guidance not yet finalized and released.
PCbCRLodgmentPossible: Yes, submission through ATO is required- self-publication not allowed.
PCbCRLodgmentFormat: Yes, format being finalized, likely XML.
PCbCRMaxPenalties: Maximum 2,500 penalty units (AUD825,000) for failure to lodge for SGEs. Other penalty regimes may apply.

TaxAuthority: Ministry of Finance
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts, Corporate Income Tax Acts, Federal Tax Code, Criminal Tax Law, Transfer Pricing Documentation Law, Austrian Transfer Pricing Guidelines, CbCR Publication Act, and Ministry of Finance rulings
TPSection: Section 6 ( 6) of the Income Tax Act and Income Tax Guidelines 2515
BEPS13Overview: Austria adopted BEPS Action 13, implementing it in the Austrian Transfer Pricing Documentation Law. It requires CbCR, Master File, and Local File, applicable for FYs beginning on or after 1 January 2016. No material differences from OECD report template or format are specified, though more detailed documentation for intangibles and services is likely.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and need to be prepared contemporaneously (at the time of transaction or no later than tax return filing). Local branches of foreign companies must comply. Documentation is required annually. Stand-alone reports for each entity in an MNE are not required.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Yes, turnover (EUR50 million in each of the previous two fiscal years for Master File and Local File). Entities below this threshold still need to prepare documentation. No specific materiality thresholds for individual transactions. CbCR: EUR750 million annual global income. Master File: EUR50 million turnover in each of the previous two fiscal years. Local File: EUR50 million turnover in each of the previous two fiscal years. Economic analysis: No.
SpecificRequirements: Local language: Yes, German or English (German translation may be requested). Appendix 3 of CbCR must be in English. Safe harbor: Unspecified. Aggregation: Individual testing.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, for medium and large corporations, Section 238 of the Austrian Commercial Code requires disclosure of material transactions with related companies and persons that do not comply with the arm’s-length principle.
CbCRinTaxReturn: The CbCR notification is not included.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 March (if represented by tax advisor)/30 June (if filed electronically)
MasterFileDeadline: 30 days upon request by the competent tax office after the constituent entity files its tax return
CbCRDeadline: 31 December (within 12 months after the end of the respective FY)
CbCRNotificationDeadline: 31 December (by the last day of the FY for which a CbCR is filed; no notification if no changes from previous year for FYs after 31 Dec 2021)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: No later than the time of completing and filing the tax return for the fiscal year in which the transaction takes place
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: 30 days upon request by the competent tax office after the constituent entity files its tax return
TPMethodPreference: Yes, the method providing the highest degree of certainty for arm’s-length determination must be selected, following the OECD Guidelines' replacement of method hierarchy.
LocalComparables: Generally, local comparables are preferred. Regional pan-European Amadeus benchmark studies (EU 15 or EU 27 along with Iceland, Norway, Switzerland, and the UK) are accepted.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear analysis is used for the financials of comparables. For the tested party, each separate year should be within the interquartile range.
InterquartileRange: Yes, interquartile range calculation using spreadsheet quartile formulas is acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: Searches in databases for comparables shall be updated at least every three years if operating conditions remain unchanged. Annual update of financial data is not necessary.
BenchmarkingType: Clear preference for the weighted average for arm’s-length analysis. Three-year weighted average arm’s-length ranges are commonly applied.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Independence (rejection of companies with >=25% ownership/subsidiary thresholds)- unconsolidated accounts- loss-making companies (weighted average loss) are frequently rejected- comparability of accounting standards (EU accounting regulations generally assumed comparable)- adjustment for research premium in cost-based R&D services.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance/non-furnishing/incomplete furnishing of documentation: None specified, but increased risk of adjustments and investigations based on Criminal Tax Law (CTL). General regulations of Section 111 FTC (fine up to EUR5,000 after warning) and Section 51 ( 1) lit., a CTL (monetary penalty up to EUR5,000 for intentional violation of disclosure obligations) may apply. Failure to furnish Master File: Not applicable (no specific penalty, general FTC/CTL may apply). Failure to furnish CbCR: Up to EUR50,000 for intent, up to EUR25,000 for gross negligence (Section 49b CTL).
PenaltiesPostAudit: Incomplete documentation: No specific penalty, but increased risk of investigations based on CTL. Withholding tax may be levied, and penalties according to CTL can be assessed in case of intent or gross negligence (percentage of unpaid taxes). Non-contemporaneous documentation: No specific penalty, but increased risk of investigations based on CTL. Interest charged: No, but non-deductible late-payment interest (two percentage points above ECB base rate) is levied on CIT payments for additional prior year for up to 48 months if taxable income is increased. Penalty relief: No.
TPLimitationPeriod: Usually six years after the end of the calendar year in which the relevant FY ends. 10 years if Criminal Tax Law (CTL) is applied. Extended if a tax audit starts within the six-year period, up to 10 years.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, adjustment to the point within the arm’s-length range. Often the median value, unless a more reliable comparative value within the range can be proven.
AuditLikelihood: Intercompany service transactions, intercompany royalty payments, intercompany financing arrangements, transactions with low-tax jurisdictions, business restructurings, and changes of TP policy leading to profit reduction. Specific focus on contract R&D services and consideration of location savings (e.g., research premium, COVID-19 funding).
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral binding advance rulings (Section 118 FTC) and participation in bilateral or multilateral APAs (Article 25 (3) of DTTs).
APATenure: Usually three years for unilateral APAs.
APARollback: Only for bilateral and multilateral APAs.
ThinCapRegulations: No fixed debt-to-equity rules. Loans from shareholders, group companies, or third parties (guaranteed by group companies) may be reclassified as equity if they typify equity contributions (e.g., insufficient equity, significantly below industry average debt-to-equity, inability to obtain third-party loans, profit participations). Interest is then non-deductible, and withholding tax on hidden profit distributions may apply. An equity ratio of about 20%-25% is generally recommended.
PCbCRRegulations: Federal Act on the Disclosure of Country-by-Country Income Tax Information Reports (CbCR Disclosure Act)
PCbCRStartDate: Applicable to FYs starting after 21 June 2024
PCbCR_BEPS13Alignment: No, it aligns with Amending Directive (EU) 2021/2101 of the EU Accounting Directive. Information may be presented based on Section III, Parts B and C, of Annex III to Council Directive 2011/16/EU (based on OECD BEPS Action 13).
PCbCRAggregationAllowed: No (PCbCR does not include any reporting of transactions).
PCbCRDataSources: CbCR Disclosure Act, version as of 1 January 2025
PCbCRLodgmentOtherJurisdiction: Yes, subsidiary undertakings and branches are exempt if the non-EU/EEA ultimate parent company makes the CbCR publicly available on its website.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: No later than 12 months after the balance sheet date.
PCbCRMaxPenalties: Maximum of EUR100,000 (EUR20,000 for medium-sized companies/branches, EUR50,000 for large companies, EUR100,000 for companies of public interest).

TaxAuthority: The State Tax Service under the Ministry of Economy of the Republic of Azerbaijan
TPLaw: Tax Code of the Republic of Azerbaijan and Decision on Determination and Application of Transfer Pricing
TPSection: Article 14-1, 16.1.4 and 18 of the Tax Code
BEPS13Overview: Jurisdiction has not adopted BEPS Action 13, but requires Local File, Master File, and CbCR largely consistent with OECD Action 13 template.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation rules exist, not contemporaneously submitted, required annually for local branches and stand-alone for MNE entities.
MaterialityThresholds: No specific threshold for TP documentation, Master File, Local File, or Economic Analysis. CbCR threshold is EUR750 million MNE total consolidated income.
SpecificRequirements: Local language required (translation possible), no safe harbor, individual testing preferred.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 March (extension possible)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Within five business days for desk audit, 60 days for field audit.
LocalComparables: No specific preference, depends on facts and circumstances.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiple-year analysis is required.
InterquartileRange: Yes
AnnualBenchmarking: The benchmarking study is required to be refreshed every year.
BenchmarkingType: A simple average is applied for multiple-year search results.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: 20% independence and three-year average range including reporting year and two previous years.
CompliancePenals: AZN6,000 (approx. USD3,500) for non-submission of TP documentation or notification, or inaccurate notification. AZN10,000 (approx. USD5,880) for failure to furnish CbCR or CbCR notification.
PenaltiesPostAudit: AZN6,000 for incomplete documentation. 50% of understated tax amount if adjustment made. Late payment interest of 0.1% of underpaid tax. Penalty relief not available.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years from the violation of the Tax Code. Can extend to five years in special circumstances.
AdjustmentRegulations: The median should be used.
AuditLikelihood: All related-party transactions are closely reviewed.
APAAvailable: Yes
MAPAvailable: Depending on double tax treaty provisions
ThinCapRegulations: There are thin capitalization rules.

TaxAuthority: The National Bureau for Revenue (NBR)
TPLaw: Bahrain DMTT Law (Decree-Law No. 11/2024) and its Executive Regulations
TPStartDate: Effective from 1 January 2025 for in-scope MNEs/CEs
TPSection: Article 13 of the Executive Regulations for Decree-Law No.11/2024
OECDGuidelines: Largely – Under the Bahrain DMTT Law, reference is made to OECD TP Guidelines
BEPS13Overview: Yes – Under the Bahrain DMTT Executive Regulations, TP documentation requirements are provided. CbCR, Master File, and Local File are required.
DocRequirements: Yes – under Bahrain DMTT Law. Needs to be prepared contemporaneously. Required annually for each entity.
MaterialityThresholds: No financial threshold for TP documentation, Master File, Local File, or Economic analysis. CbCR threshold: Consolidated revenues equal to or exceeding BHD342 million (approx. EUR760 million/ USD900 million) based on annual global income.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement. Safe harbor unspecified. No preference for aggregation or individual testing.
CbCRinTaxReturn: No – It is a separate notification.
TaxReturnDeadline: Within 15 months from the end of the fiscal years
CbCRDeadline: 12 months from the end of the fiscal year
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Last day of the fiscal year
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Not applicable for submission upon tax authority request.
LocalComparables: Not specified under the Bahrain DMTT
SingleYearAnalysis: Not specified under the Bahrain DMTT
InterquartileRange: Not specified under the Bahrain DMTT
AnnualBenchmarking: Not specified
CompliancePenals: No explicit TP penalties under Bahrain DMTT Law for documentation. CbCR failure: up to BHD100,000 and suspension of commercial registration for up to six months. No explicit TP penalties for Master File.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No penalty if documentation is deemed incomplete or non-contemporaneous. No interest charged on penalties or payable on a refund. Penalty relief can be obtained.
TPLimitationPeriod: Not provided
AdjustmentRegulations: Aligned to OECD TP Guidelines
AuditLikelihood: DMTT Law recently introduced, difficult to comment at this time.
APAAvailable: No
MAPAvailable: Yes - Taxpayers can access MAP provisions under applicable tax treaties, with formal guidance available.
ThinCapRegulations: Not applicable

TaxAuthority: National Board of Revenue (NBR)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Act sections
TPSection: Various Income Tax Act sections
BEPS13Overview: No
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: BDT 30 million (Turnover)
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement; No safe harbor; No preference for aggregation or individual testing.
TaxReturnDeadline: 15 July or 15 September
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; typically seven to 10 days upon request.
LocalComparables: Regional benchmarking undertaken due to lack of local databases.
SingleYearAnalysis: No preference
InterquartileRange: Yes, 30th to 70th percentile range if six or more data sets are used.
AnnualBenchmarking: Preferable
CompliancePenals: Failure to keep/maintain/furnish info/docs: up to 1% of international transaction value. Failure to comply with notice: up to 1% of international transaction value. Failure to file SIT: 2% of international transaction value. Not furnishing accountant's certificate: up to BDT 300,000.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No penalty for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation. No interest on penalties/refunds. No penalty relief regulation provided.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years from the end of the assessment year in which the income was first assessable.
AdjustmentRegulations: Not applicable
AuditLikelihood: Not applicable
APAAvailable: No formal APA program.
ThinCapRegulations: None

TaxAuthority: Belgian General Administration of Taxes, part of the Federal Public Service Finance
TPLaw: Belgian Income Tax Code (ITC), Royal Decrees on TP documentation, administrative guidelines and circular letters
TPSection: Articles 26, 49, 53, 54, 55, 79, 185 Section 2, 206-3, 307 Section 1 s. 3, 321-1 to 321-7, 344, 445 Section 3 of the Belgian ITC
BEPS13Overview: Adopted own version of BEPS Action 13, requiring CbCR, Master File, and Local File.
BEPS13PenaltyProtection: Yes, provided compliance with TP forms and related laws-Royal Decrees are met
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously prepared, annually, for each entity, and applicable to local branches.
MaterialityThresholds: No specific threshold for general TP documentation or economic analysis. CbCR: EUR750 million consolidated group turnover. Master File-Local File: EUR50 million operating-financial income OR EUR1 billion balance sheet total OR 100 FTE.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (English accepted), no safe harbor, individual testing preferred.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, information on off-balance sheet arrangements and material non-arm's length transactions with affiliated parties required in notes-annex of statutory annual accounts.
TaxReturnDeadline: Generally 7 months after financial year-end (e.g., 31 July for calendar year), collective extensions possible.
TPReturnDeadline: Same as corporate tax return deadline (e.g., 31 July for calendar year).
MasterFileDeadline: 12 months after group's financial year-end (e.g., 31 December for calendar year).
CbCRDeadline: 12 months after group's financial year-end (e.g., 31 December for calendar year).
CbCRNotificationDeadline: By the end of the group's financial year (e.g., 31 December for calendar year).
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Contemporaneously, available upon request (within 30 days). Local File form (275.LF) due with corporate tax return (e.g., 31 July).
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline for submission, but must be submitted within 30 days upon tax authority request.
TPMethodPreference: Yes, traditional transaction methods preferred over transactional profit methods if equally reliable. CUP preferred if equally reliable.
LocalComparables: Not explicitly preferred, but local references sought first. Pan-European studies accepted if local comparables are insufficient.
SingleYearAnalysis: Yes, single-year testing is required.
InterquartileRange: Yes, interquartile range is preferred.
AnnualBenchmarking: Full update recommended every three years; yearly update of results expected.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Yes, detailed administrative guidelines with suggested criteria in 2020 circular.
CompliancePenals: Failure to file CbCR, CbCR notification, Master File, or Local File forms: EUR1,250 to EUR25,000 (from second infringement). Non-maintenance-incomplete documentation: reversal of burden of proof, administrative penalties EUR1,250 to EUR25,000. General tax penalties 10% to 200% for adjustments.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Penalties apply if documentation is non-contemporaneous. General tax penalty framework (10%-200%) applies to TP adjustments. Interest due on late payments of additional tax. Penalty relief possible.
TPLimitationPeriod: General: 3 years from accounting year-end. For companies subject to TP reporting (275.LF or 285.MF): 6 years (for financial years starting on or after 1 January 2022). Late-incomplete filing: 4 years. Fraud: 10 years. Tax loss years can be audited beyond standard statutes.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, adjustments are generally to the median of the interquartile range (or full range), unless another point is sufficiently supported.
AuditLikelihood: Yes, structural losses, sudden decrease in profitability, business reorganizations, migration of businesses, use of tax havens, back-to-back operations, circular structures, year-end service invoices, changes in employee numbers, business restructurings, intangibles-related and financial transactions, failure to file TP forms.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral, bilateral, and multilateral APAs are available.
APATenure: Generally 5 years (legal maximum); unilateral APAs typically 3 years.
APARollback: Yes, allowed in principle for one year, subject to approval and time limits. Not available for unilateral APAs.
MAPAvailable: Yes, under double tax treaties and the EU Arbitration Convention.
ThinCapRegulations: Until tax year 2019: 5-1 debt-equity ratio rule (with grandfathering and for tax haven interest). As of tax year 2020: EBITDA-based rule (30% of fiscal EBITDA or EUR3 million, whichever is higher), with indefinite carry-forward and group transfer possibilities.
PCbCRStartDate: All financial years starting on or after 22 June 2024
PCbCRAggregationAllowed: Yes, for all other third jurisdictions and stateless income, information should be disclosed on an aggregated basis. Specific country-by-country disclosure for EU-EEA, Annex I, and Annex II jurisdictions.
PCbCRDataSources: Law of 8 January 2024, Royal Decree of 18 April 2024.
PCbCRLodgmentOtherJurisdiction: Yes, if a European parent files the report or non-EU UPU publishes on its website with reference to Belgian subsidiary.
PCbCRLodgmentFormat: Yes, required with National Bank of Belgium and publication on website (format to be confirmed).
PCbCRCriminalRisk: Yes, sentences up to one year.

TaxAuthority: Directorate-General of Taxes (Direction Générale des Impôts (DGI))
TPLaw: General Tax Code (GTC) Articles (Finance Law 2020, Fiscal Law 2022) and related rulings
BEPS13Overview: CbCR, Master File, and Local File required, but BEPS Action 13 not adopted
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously prepared, required for local branches and stand-alone entities, but not annually
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: XOF1 billion annual turnover-gross assets (or control threshold). CbCR: XOF492 billion annual consolidated turnover. Master File-Local File: Refer to TP documentation threshold. No threshold for economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (French) required. No safe harbor or preference for aggregation-individual testing.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 April
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: By time of tax audit (30-day notice if not available)
LocalComparables: No specific requirement. Local or West African comparables accepted.
SingleYearAnalysis: No specific requirement.
InterquartileRange: No specific requirement.
AnnualBenchmarking: No specific requirement.
CompliancePenals: TP documentation: 0.5% of unjustified transactions (min XOF10 million per FY). CbCR-TP return: XOF10 million. No specific penalty for Master File failure.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No specific penalty for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation, but general penalties of 20-80% of tax due apply based on error type. No interest on penalties. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years (common tax regime)
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific requirement.
AuditLikelihood: No specific transactions
APAAvailable: Unspecified
PCbCRApplies: Interest to shareholders limited to 30% of EBITDA and central bank rate + 3%. Loan repayment within 5 years, no liquidation, fully paid-up share capital.

TaxAuthority: Internal Taxes Service (Servicio de Impuestos Nacionales)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings
TPSection: Articles 45°, 45 bis and 45° ter of Act No. 843
BEPS13Overview: Not adopted. CbCR, Master File, and Local File not required.
DocRequirements: Yes, prepared contemporaneously and annually. Local branch must comply. Stand-alone reports for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: Yes, for TP documentation. Based on yearly transactions with related parties: >Bs15,000,000 (TP Study and Form 601), Bs7,500,000-Bs15,000,000 (Form 601), <Bs7,500,000 (maintain info). No thresholds for CbCR, Master File, Local File, Economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Spanish) required. Safe harbor unspecified. No preference for aggregation/individual testing. Other requirements: physical and digital format, amounts in BOB, legal representative's signature, minimum content.
TaxReturnDeadline: 120 days after FY close
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Yes, 120 days after FY close. Upon request, generally 5 working days.
TPMethodPreference: Yes, best method must be used (CUP, resale price, cost-plus, profit-split or TNMM). For commodities, price in transparent markets.
LocalComparables: Both are accepted.
SingleYearAnalysis: No rule specified.
InterquartileRange: Not applicable. The formula used is called the difference value range (rango de diferencias de valor).
AnnualBenchmarking: No rule specified.
CompliancePenals: For non-filing: 5,000 UFVs (physical TP info), 5,000 UFVs (electronic TP info), 5,000 UFVs (Form 601). For uncompleted/late filing: 2,500 UFVs for each of the above. CbCR/Master File penalties: Not applicable.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Penalty applicable if documentation is deemed incomplete (2,500 UFVs for each type of filing) or non-contemporaneous (2,500 UFVs for each type of filing). No interest charged. Penalty relief not obtainable.
TPLimitationPeriod: 8 years, extended to 10 years for transactions with low- or no-tax countries. Audits can be performed within 2 years.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, adjustment to the midpoint of the Bolivian range.
AuditLikelihood: None specified.
APAAvailable: Not defined in the current law.
ThinCapRegulations: Not applicable
PCbCRCriminalRisk: No / Not applicable / No / Not applicable

TaxAuthority: Tax Authority of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina; Tax Administration of Republic of Srpska
TPLaw: Various Corporate Income Tax (CIT) Laws and Rulebooks on TP
TPStartDate: FBiH TP Rulebook: 5 March 2016; RS TP Rulebook: 26 May 2016
TPSection: FBiH: Article 44 of the CIT Law and Article 6 of the Rulebook on TP; RS: Article 31 of the CIT Law and Article 4 of the Rulebook on TP
BEPS13Overview: BEPS Action 13 implemented to varying degrees. CbCR and Master File adopted in FBiH, CbCR only in RS. Threshold EUR750m. Local File required in FBiH. No material differences from OECD format in FBiH.
DocRequirements: Yes (guidelines); No (contemporaneous submission); Yes (local branch); Yes (annually); Yes (stand-alone reports for multiple entities)
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: No; CbCR: EUR750 million (Annual global income); Master File: FBiH: EUR750 million (Annual global income), RS: Not applicable; Local File: Not applicable; Economic analysis: No
SpecificRequirements: Yes, local language (Bosnian, Croatian or Serbian). FBiH: Master File in English possible, but translation may be requested. Safe harbor available in FBiH (5% on total cost for specific administrative-support services), not in RS. Individual testing preferred, but aggregation allowed in specific circumstances. Documentation in local currency (BAM).
TPReturn: Yes. FBiH: TP 902 form (transactions > BAM500,000) and TP-900 form (for double taxation within FBiH) by 31 March. RS: Annual report of controlled transactions (total amount > BAM700,000) by 31 March.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, within notes in the financial statements.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 March (FBiH)-31 March (Republic of Srpska)
MasterFileDeadline: FBiH: 45 days from request; RS: Not applicable
CbCRDeadline: FBiH: No later than 12 months after the last day of the reporting tax period of the MPL group. RS: Prepared by 31 March, submitted within 30 days upon request.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: No deadline prescribed (understood to be same as CbCR deadline in FBiH; Not applicable in RS).
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. FBiH: 45 days upon tax authority request; RS: 30 days upon tax authority request.
TPMethodPreference: Yes. FBiH: Traditional transaction methods have priority, CUP most preferable. RS: No prescribed priorities.
LocalComparables: Foreign comparables are accepted if no local comparables could be identified.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear analysis mandatory in FBiH; recommended in RS.
InterquartileRange: Mandatory in FBiH; recommended in RS.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, roll-forward of comparable companies and update of financials is acceptable.
BenchmarkingType: Application of weighted average is mandatory in FBiH; recommended in RS.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Independence (25% shares or votes). FBiH: Exclude companies with average weighted loss for tested period or loss for more than half of tested periods.
CompliancePenals: FBiH: BAM3,000-BAM100,000 (taxpayer), BAM2,500-BAM10,000 (individual) for non-possession-non-compliance. RS: BAM20,000-BAM60,000 (taxpayer), BAM5,000-BAM15,000 (individual). Penalties for non-possession on CIT due date are similar. Criminal prosecution risk for tax evasion (unpaid taxes > EUR5,000).
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes (incomplete documentation leads to increased CIT liability and penalty interest). No (non-contemporaneous, but could lead to adjustments). No (interest on penalties, but on tax liability: FBiH 0.04% daily, RS 0.03% daily). No (penalty relief).
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years (general statute of limitations for direct taxes). No statute of limitation in FBiH for certain circumstances (e.g., false returns, intentional concealment).
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes. TP practice is developing; tax authorities are becoming more sophisticated and examining content more closely.
AdjustmentRegulations: FBiH: Not prescribed to which point within interquartile range adjustment should be made for TNMM. RS: Adjustment should be calculated to the median.
AuditLikelihood: Management and similar support services.
APAAvailable: No
ThinCapRegulations: FBiH: 4:1 debt-to-equity ratio (interest expense on debt exceeding this is nondeductible). RS: Interest cost cannot exceed 30% of the tax base before interest (exceeding threshold is nondeductible).

TaxAuthority: Botswana Unified Revenue Service (BURS)
TPLaw: Income Tax (Transfer Pricing) Regulations, 2019
TPSection: Section 36A of the Income Tax (Amendment) Act, 2018, comes into effect on 1 July 2019.
DomesticTPObligations: Yes. Limited to transactions relating to companies under the International Financial Services Center (IFSC).
OECDGuidelines: Largely. OECD Guidelines are a relevant source of interpretation.
BEPS13Overview: No BEPS Action 13 adoption, no CbCR. Master File and Local File required, effective 1 July 2019, no material differences from OECD format.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously. Local branch of foreign company needs to comply. Prepared annually. Stand-alone reports for each entity.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation, Master File, Local File: BWP5 million threshold for international related-party transactions. No CbCR requirement. No threshold for Economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (English/Setswana accepted). No safe harbor. Individual testing of transactions. No other disclosure.
TPReturn: No. Local File filed as attachment to corporate income tax return.
TaxReturnDeadline: Four months after the end of the taxpayer’s financial year
MasterFileDeadline: Upon notification from tax authority. Due date stated in notice.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Four months after the end of the fiscal year (with tax return). Upon request, deadline specified in notice.
TPMethodPreference: Yes. CUP is default. Traditional methods preferred over transactional if equally applicable. Other methods allowed if Commissioner General is satisfied and approved methods cannot be reasonably applied.
LocalComparables: Tax authority considers comparables from the same geographic market. If not available, foreign comparables may be accepted.
SingleYearAnalysis: Not mandatory. If multiyear data is used, taxpayer must justify it.
InterquartileRange: Regulations provide for the use of the full range, not interquartile.
AnnualBenchmarking: The law provides for analysis for each tax year.
BenchmarkingType: No provision for the use of averages.
CompliancePenals: BWP500,000 for documentation-Master File. None for CbCR.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Greater of 200% of tax or BWP10,000 for incomplete-non-contemporaneous documentation. Interest at 1.5% per month. Penalty relief up to 50% available.
TPLimitationPeriod: No guideline provided yet. General statute of limitations is eight years.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, adjustment. May be considered high based on current general anti-avoidance audits.
AdjustmentRegulations: Adjustment shall be to the median in the arm’s-length range.
AuditLikelihood: Related-party transactions. Mining, capital projects, and financial services industries.
APAAvailable: While the law provides for APAs, terms and conditions have not yet been prescribed.
MAPAvailable: Yes, in terms of the relevant double tax treaty.
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization rules in Income Tax Act, only for IFSC companies. Net interest expense limited to 30% of EBITDA for all entities. Excess carried forward for 10 years (mining) or three years (others).

TaxAuthority: Federal Revenue Departament (Receita Federal do Brasil - RFB)
TPLaw: Law 14,596/2023, RFB Normative Instruction 2161/2023, RFB Normative Instruction 2246/2024
TPStartDate: 1996 for the old rules; From 2024 onward for the new rules
BEPS13Overview: Full alignment with Action 13 from 2024 (limited to CbCR until 2023). CbCR required from 2016 (threshold BRL2.26 billion or EUR750 million). Master File required from 2024. Local File required from 2024 for entities with R$15 million+ controlled transactions. Specific format for Local File. Thresholds for presentation: up to R$15M (exempt), R$15M-R$500M (simplified Local File, complete Master File), >=R$500M (complete Local File and Master File).
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation needs to be submitted or prepared contemporaneously. Local branch of a foreign company needs to comply. Required annually. Stand-alone reports for each entity in an MNE with multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Yes, based on value of international transactions; TP info in tax return mandatory annually. CbCR: BRL2.26 billion/EUR750 million annual global income. Master File: R$15 million+ total international related-party transactions (from 2024). Local File: R$15 million+ total international related-party transactions (from 2024). Thresholds for Local File/Master File presentation: up to R$15M (exempt), R$15M-R$500M (simplified Local File, complete Master File), >=R$500M (complete Local File and Master File). Economic analysis: No materiality limit from 2024.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Portuguese for TP documentation and Local File; Master File in English or Spanish). Safe harbor available (5% markup for low-value-added services). Individual testing of transactions preferred (CUP for commodities, royalties, financial transactions).
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 July
MasterFileDeadline: Last business day of July of the following year. Exception for 2024 calendar year: 31 December 2025.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: By end of January of the following year, for income tax and social contribution payments purposes. Submission deadline is last business day of July of the following year. Exception for 2024 calendar year: 31 December 2025 for Local File and Master File submission.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Yes, statutory deadline. Exception for 2024 calendar year: 31 December 2025. In subsequent years: 31 July of the year following the analysis. Upon request: 30 days (additional time possible).
TPMethodPreference: Yes. From 2024, CUP is most appropriate for cross-border commodities transactions when reliable comparables are available, but other methods may apply based on facts and circumstances.
LocalComparables: From calendar year 2024 on: Yes, but not limited. A country risk adjustment is foreseen for comparables outside of Brazil.
SingleYearAnalysis: From calendar year 2024 on: It depends on the method. The PIC method is preferable for the year of analysis, but for other methods, a multiyear analysis is possible depending on the business cycle.
InterquartileRange: From calendar year 2024 on: Yes, interquartile range is acceptable. If multi-year data used, arithmetic mean of financial indicators for each comparable over those years must be calculated, using weighted average. Multi-year analysis for TNMM generally derived from last three years. Unrelated parties with negative weighted average or negative financial indicator in more than one period must be excluded.
AnnualBenchmarking: Calendar year 2024 on: a roll forward of comparable companies and update of the financials acceptable
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Preference is given to local comparables; however, this is not exclusive and may vary based on the available information. A country risk adjustment is foreseen in the legislation for comparables outside of Brazil.
CompliancePenals: For late submission: 0.2% per month (or fraction) on gross revenue. For incorrect/incomplete info: 5% on transaction value or 0.2% on MNE group consolidated revenue. For failure to comply: 3% on gross revenue. For late submission during audit: 5% on transaction value (capped at BRL5 million).
TPLimitationPeriod: No penalty for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation if taxpayer amends tax returns. No interest charged on penalties (from 2023). Penalty relief available if reasonable cause and good faith established (e.g., cooperative during audit, reasonable efforts to comply).
MethodologyScrutiny: A general statute of limitations of five years from the first day of the following fiscal year applies. In the case of filing amended tax returns, the statute starts with the filing of the latest amended return.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes. Medium to high scrutiny due to tax authorities' access to electronic databases. Well-reasoned documentation may reduce scrutiny.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, adjustment. Penalties will be applied based on criteria for late filing or misfiling.
AuditLikelihood: From calendar year 2023 (early adoption) on: Yes. If financial indicator of controlled transaction is not within appropriate interquartile range, the value of the median shall be assigned to the controlled transaction.
APAAvailable: Yes. Automotive, pharmaceutical, chemical, oil and gas industries, and intragroup services into Brazil. High risk if inconsistencies in electronically filed information (e.g., customs declaration, financial statements, SISCOMEX).
APATenure: APA was introduced by Law 14, 596/ 23; however, the implementation regulations are yet to be issued.
MAPAvailable: Roll-back provisions may be applicable provided the facts and circumstances are the same as the ones considered for the issuance of the APA.
ThinCapRegulations: Yes. RFB Normative Instruction 1, 846/ 18 regulates MAP in Brazil, aligned with BEPS Action 14 minimum standards. Includes Unilateral and Bilateral MAP phases.
PCbCRApplies: Thin capitalization rules apply to interest paid to related parties. For non-tax haven related parties: deductible if necessary for activities and debt-to-equity ratios (related-party and overall) do not exceed 2:1. For tax haven/preferential regime entities (related or not): deductible if necessary for activities and indebtedness to such entities does not exceed 30% of net equity (both individual and total). Excess interest is non-deductible for IRPJ and CSLL. TP rules for cross-border loans and general deductibility requirements also apply.

TaxAuthority: National Revenue Agency (NRA)
TPLaw: Corporate Income Tax Act, Tax and Social Insurance Procedure Code, Ordinance N 9, Double-taxation treaties, NRA Manual on Transfer Pricing Audits
TPSection: Articles 15 and 16 of CITA, TSIPC, Ordinance N 9, and NRA Manual on Transfer Pricing Audits. Mandatory TP rules in TSIPC (2019) effective Jan 1, 2020.
BEPS13Overview: Bulgaria has adopted BEPS Action 13 for TP documentation in the local regulations in terms of CbCR, as well as for overall TP documentation starting January 2020.
DocRequirements: Yes, guidelines exist and require contemporaneous annual preparation. Local branches must comply. Stand-alone reports are required for MNEs with multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: For TP documentation (Master File, Local File): applies to 'large enterprises' (meeting 2 of 3 thresholds: assets > BGN38M, net sales > BGN76M, employees > 250). Local File also has transaction-specific thresholds (e.g., BGN400k goods, BGN200k services/intangibles, BGN1M loan principal, BGN50k interest). CbCR: BGN1,467M consolidated revenue.
SpecificRequirements: Local language required for submission (Master File can be in another language but translated upon request). Individual testing preferred, aggregation allowed if individual testing not possible. No safe harbor or other specific disclosure.
OtherRequiredDocs: Yes, CbCR notification stating which entity submits the CbCR returns.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 June of the following year
MasterFileDeadline: No submission, kept by taxpayer and provided upon request.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: 31 December of the respective fiscal year
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Upon request, usually 7-14 days, with possible extension up to 3 months.
LocalComparables: Yes, highly recommended to review Bulgarian comparables and consider them with priority.
SingleYearAnalysis: No, multiyear testing is used (usually three years).
InterquartileRange: Yes, when TNMM method is applied.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, benchmarks may be updated once every three years if no significant changes, but financial data and transaction data need annual update.
CompliancePenals: Incorrect/incomplete documentation: BGN1,500-BGN5,000. Failure to submit Local File: up to 0.5% of transaction volume. Failure to submit Master File: BGN5,000-BGN10,000. Not cooperating: BGN250-BGN500. Hidden profit distribution: 20% sanction, 5% WHT. No penalty for failure to furnish CbCR (in this section).
PenaltiesPostAudit: No specific penalties for incomplete/non-contemporaneous documentation beyond compliance penalties. Interest charged on penalties/refunds (10% + BNB base interest). Penalty relief possible via voluntary disclosure of hidden profit distribution or appeal process. EU Arbitration Convention available.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years from the year following the year of expiration of the statutory term granted for filing corporate income tax returns.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, adjustment to taxable profit. Scrutiny on entities with sizable operations earning limited margins or losses. Pushback on 5% markup unless specialized skill set is clearly provided.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, adjusted to a point reflecting facts and circumstances; if not found, then to the median.
AuditLikelihood: Local affiliates of multinationals reporting recurring losses or low profitability in high-margin sectors. Large employers with group stock incentive plans.
APAAvailable: No
ThinCapRegulations: Bulgarian thin capitalization rules apply to all financing (interest) expenses, with specific exemptions (e.g., non-deductible interest, penalty interest, capitalized interest, financial lease-bank loan unless guaranteed by related party). As of Jan 2020, rules don't apply to part of interest on loans guaranteed by both Bulgarian entity and related party.
PCbCRRegulations: Tax and Social Security Procedures Code
PCbCRDataSources: No PCbCR guidance has been published from the Bulgarian tax authorities.
PCbCRMaxPenalties: Individual: BGN1,000-BGN3,000 (EUR511-EUR1,534). Company (first breach): BGN2,000-BGN5,000 (EUR1,023-EUR2,556). Doubled for repeat breach.

TaxAuthority: Directorate General for Taxation (Direction Générale des Impôts - DGI)
TPLaw: Article 98-1 of the General Tax Code: Transfer Pricing form requirements (1 January 2023-Updated Finance Law 2023) Article 98-2 of the General Tax Code: CbCR requirements (1 January 2023-Updated Finance Law 2023) Article 99 of the General Tax Code: Transfer Pricing Documentation requirements (1 January 2023-Updated Finance Law 2023) Article 757 of the Tax Book Procedures: Penalties (1 January 2023-Updated Finance Law 2023) Ministry of Finance decree dated 15 April 2022 determining the content of the transfer pricing documentation
TPSection: General Tax Code: Articles 66, 98-1, 98-2, 99, 757
BEPS13Overview: Adopted BEPS Action 13. CbCR, Master File, and Local File required. CbCR for aggregated sales >= EUR748 million, effective 1 Jan 2023. Master File effective 1 Jan 2022. Local File effective FY 2018, updated 2022. No material differences from OECD templates.
DocRequirements: Yes, guidelines exist. Prepared contemporaneously and annually. Local branches must comply. Stand-alone reports required for MNEs with multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Annual sales/gross assets >= XOF1 billion. CbCR: Consolidated annual turnover >= EUR748 million. Master File: Total assets >= XOF1 billion. Local File: Total assets >= XOF1 billion. No threshold for economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: French language required. No safe harbor. Individual testing preferred. Tax authorities can request info/docs if profit transfer presumed and documentary obligation not fulfilled.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 April or 31 May (insurance companies)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Upon request: at beginning of tax audit and within 30 days of official request.
LocalComparables: No specific requirement, but local or West African comparables would be preferred.
SingleYearAnalysis: No specific requirement.
InterquartileRange: No specific requirement.
AnnualBenchmarking: No specific requirement.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance/non-furnishing/incomplete documentation: 0.5% of transaction amount (min XOF10 million/fiscal year). Failure to furnish CbCR: XOF50 million. Failure to submit TP return: XOF10 million.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Penalty for incomplete/non-contemporaneous documentation: 0.5% of transaction amount (min XOF10 million/fiscal year). No interest charged on penalties. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years (common tax regime), plus two years in case of TP tax audit or information exchange procedure.
AdjustmentRegulations: Not specified by Law; depends on each tax inspector.
AuditLikelihood: None specified.
APAAvailable: Yes, provided by law (Article 588-8), but no further guidance.
APATenure: Year of request and four subsequent years.
ThinCapRegulations: Intercompany interest deductible if capital fully released. Max deductible: legal interest rate + 2 percentage points, not > 15% of profit before EBITDA.

TaxAuthority: General Department of Taxation (GDT)
TPLaw: Prakas 986 (effective 2017) and Prakas 574 (effective 2025) on income and expense allocation between related parties
TPSection: Articles 5 and 18 of the Law on Taxation (2023)
BEPS13Overview: No adoption of BEPS Action 13; CbCR and Master File not required; Local File required
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and need to be prepared contemporaneously and annually. Local branches of foreign companies must comply. Stand-alone reports required for each entity in an MNE.
MaterialityThresholds: For TP documentation (including Local File) from 1 Jan 2025: annual turnover < KHR8bn (USD2m) AND total assets < KHR4bn (USD1m) AND related party transactions < KHR1bn (USD250k) (excluding loans). No CbCR or Master File thresholds. No specific economic analysis threshold, but contemporaneous benchmarking is required.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (English accepted). Safe harbor unspecified. No preference for aggregation or individual testing. Annex 1 (related-party disclosure form) required with CIT return.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 March or 90 days after the end of the fiscal year-end
TPReturnDeadline: 31 March or 90 days after the end of the fiscal year-end
LocalFilePrepDeadline: No specified deadline, but must be readily available when requested by tax auditor
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within seven working days upon tax authority request
LocalComparables: Yes, local comparables are preferred, but regional comparables are accepted due to difficulty in finding local ones
SingleYearAnalysis: No preference
InterquartileRange: Use of full range and interquartile range based on the spreadsheet quartile formula is accepted
AnnualBenchmarking: Roll-forward study is acceptable
BenchmarkingType: No preference. Simple average is acceptable.
CompliancePenals: Fine of KHR10 million for failure to maintain proper records (including TP documentation). Administrative penalties (e.g., withdrawal of tax compliance certificate) for failure to submit, late submission, or incorrect disclosures. Risk of criminal violation charges.
PenaltiesPostAudit: 10%-40% penalty on underdeclared amount for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation. 1.5% monthly interest on underdeclared taxes. Penalty relief generally not available.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years, extendable to 10 years for fraud or obstruction
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, adjusted to the median
AuditLikelihood: Garment, logistic, shipping, freight-forwarding industries; management fees, royalties, payments for other intangibles
APAAvailable: Unspecified
ThinCapRegulations: No dedicated rules; interest deductions capped at 50% of EBIT plus interest income

TaxAuthority: Canada Revenue Agency (CRA)
TPLaw: Section 247 of the Income Tax Act (ITA), various Information Circulars (ICs) and Transfer Pricing Memoranda (TPMs)
TPSection: Section 247 of the Income Tax Act (ITA)
BEPS13Overview: Canada has not adopted BEPS Action 13 for documentation, relying on ITA Section 247(4)(a)(i) to (vi). CbCR is required for MNEs with EUR750 million global income, effective 1 January 2016, with no material differences from OECD format. Master File and Local File are not required.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist. It must be prepared contemporaneously and annually, but submitted only upon CRA request. Local branches and MNE entities (stand-alone reports) must comply.
MaterialityThresholds: No financial threshold for TP documentation. CbCR threshold is EUR750 million annual global income. No thresholds for Master File, Local File, or Economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (English or French accepted). No safe harbor. Individual testing of transactions is preferred. No other specific disclosure-compliance requirements.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: Yes, the T-106 information return for transactions exceeding CAD1 million with non-arm's-length nonresidents.
TaxReturnDeadline: Within six months after year-end for corporations; five months for partnerships.
TPReturnDeadline: Within six months after year-end for corporations; five months for partnerships (for T-106).
CbCRDeadline: 12 months after the last day of the fiscal year.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: By the corporate tax return filing deadline (six months after year-end for corporations; five months for partnerships).
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; within three months of CRA written request.
TPMethodPreference: Yes, traditionally a natural hierarchy (CUP preferred), but now depends on comparability and data reliability, aligning with OECD Guidelines.
LocalComparables: Yes, local (Canadian) comparables are preferred, but North American companies are generally acceptable.
SingleYearAnalysis: Yes, single-year testing is generally required.
InterquartileRange: No, full range is relevant; quartiles are not critical but may be presented.
AnnualBenchmarking: Not required annually; rollforward and update of prior study financials are acceptable if facts haven't changed. Fresh search recommended every three years.
BenchmarkingType: Taxpayer's results tested on single-year basis; comparable company data often presented using weighted average for multiple years.
CompliancePenals: 10% of TP adjustment if reasonable efforts not made, applicable if adjustments exceed lesser of 10% gross revenue or CAD5 million. CbCR failure: $500-month. No Master File penalty. Documentation must be complete, accurate, and provided within three months of request.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation. Interest charged on penalties (currently 8% in 2025). Penalty relief possible if reasonable efforts made, covered by APA, or adjusted via MAP-CRA Appeals.
TPLimitationPeriod: Seven years for non-arm's-length nonresident transactions (four years plus three additional years). Can be extended by waiver or reduced by tax treaties.
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes, high risk of methodology being challenged during an audit.
AdjustmentRegulations: If outside the arm's length range, CRA determines the most appropriate point using central tendency, usually the average if no further distinction can be made.
AuditLikelihood: Corporate restructuring, royalties, hybrid debt, financial products, and corporate services charges are more likely, but all transactions are susceptible.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral, bilateral, and multilateral APAs are available, including a small-business program. No fee charged.
APATenure: Typically five years, but can vary.
APARollback: Yes, but not for years where a Section 247 documentation request has been issued or years undergoing a TP audit.
ThinCapRegulations: Subsection 18(4) of the ITA limits interest deductibility to debt 1.5 times equity for related nonresident payees. Proposed legislation on Excessive Interest and Finance Expenses (EIFEL).

TaxAuthority: National Directorate of State Revenues (Direcção Nacional de Receitas do Estado — DNRE)
TPLaw: Articles 65 and 66 of CITC; Ministerial Order No. 75/2015 (updated by No. 24/2023)
TPSection: Article 66 of the CITC
BEPS13Overview: CbCR introduced (OECD aligned, EUR750M threshold); Master File and Local File not adopted but local documentation requirements align with OECD principles.
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Turnover > CVE300 million or global tax > CVE15 million or 'large taxpayers'. CbCR: EUR750 million annual global income. Master File/Local File: Not applicable.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Portuguese) required. Safe harbor unspecified. Individual testing of transactions preferred, aggregation allowed if conditions met.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 May
LocalFilePrepDeadline: End of the seventh month after year-end
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline, submitted upon request.
LocalComparables: There is no specific requirement.
SingleYearAnalysis: There is no specific requirement.
InterquartileRange: There is no specific requirement.
AnnualBenchmarking: There is no specific requirement.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance/non-furnishing/incomplete documentation: CVE100,000 to CVE2.5 million. Failure to furnish CbCR: CVE100,000 to CVE2,500,000.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Penalty applicable if documentation is deemed incomplete (Yes) or non-contemporaneous (Yes). Interest not charged on penalties. Penalty relief not obtainable.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years, counting from the beginning of the fiscal year after the one in which the tax issue was raised.
AdjustmentRegulations: Not applicable
AuditLikelihood: Not applicable
APAAvailable: Not applicable
MAPAvailable: MAP is only available in the specific context of a convention to avoid double taxation, namely with Portugal.
ThinCapRegulations: No relevant regulations or rulings are in place.

TaxAuthority: General Director of Taxation
TPLaw: Various Finance Laws and rulings
TPSection: Various General Tax Code Articles and rulings
BEPS13Overview: Not adopted; no CbCR, Master File, or Local File requirements.
DocRequirements: Yes, prepared contemporaneously for all foreign intercompany transactions; local branch must comply; covers annual transactions; stand-alone reports for each entity.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Yes, Turnover, XAF500 million (companies with turnover less than XAF500 million file annual TP return; companies with turnover equal to or more than XAF500 million submit documentation). CbCR: Not applicable. Master File: Not applicable. Local File: Not applicable. Economic analysis: No.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (French or Arabic); Safe harbor unspecified; No preference for aggregation or individual testing; No other disclosure.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, details in "Instruction Specifying the Procedures for Applying the Transfer Pricing Rules."
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 April (or 15 May if extended)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Yes, 30 April (or 15 May if extended); upon request, within 15 days.
LocalComparables: African comparables are preferable.
SingleYearAnalysis: No specified method, company should specify.
InterquartileRange: No specified method, company should specify.
AnnualBenchmarking: No specified method, company should specify.
BenchmarkingType: No specified method, company should specify.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: No specified method, company should specify.
CompliancePenals: Rejection of deductibility of intragroup transaction; Fine of 5% of total intragroup transactions (minimum XAF50 million per fiscal year). Late submission penalties: XAF10 million (15 May-31 May), XAF20 million (1 June-30 June), XAF25 million (1 July-31 July), XAF5 million per month from 1 August.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No penalty if documentation is incomplete or non-contemporaneous; No interest charged; Penalty relief cannot be obtained, but enterprise can request total or partial deductibility of expenses.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years
AdjustmentRegulations: Not applicable
AuditLikelihood: Not applicable
APAAvailable: Unilateral and multilateral APA are available
APATenure: Allows a set of appropriate criteria (including the method to be used, the comparable and adjustments to be made, and the key assumptions about future developments) to be determined in advance of transactions between associated companies
ThinCapRegulations: Loan from parent: interest deduction limited to half of share capital, rate max BEAC rate + 2 points. Loan from affiliates (not parent): interest not deductible.

TaxAuthority: Internal Tax Service (Servicio de Impuestos Internos — SII)
TPLaw: Article 41E of the Income Tax Law (ITL)
TPSection: Article 41E and 41H of the ITL
BEPS13Overview: Chile has adopted BEPS Action 13, requiring CbCR, Master File, and Local File. CbCR applicable from 1 January 2016, Master File and Local File from FY 2020. No material differences from OECD format for CbCR.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist, must be prepared contemporaneously and annually, applies to local branches, and stand-alone reports are required for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: large taxpayer, related-party transactions > CLP200 million, or MNE obligated to CbCR. CbCR: EUR750 million annual global income. Master File: EUR750 million annual global income. Local File: large taxpayer, related-party transactions > CLP200 million, or MNE obligated to CbCR. No specific threshold for economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: Spanish language required (some English allowed). No safe harbor, but a 4% royalty rate limit exists for deductibility. Individual testing preferred, but aggregation possible. Other disclosures include legal structures, agreements, financial statements, and organizational charts.
CbCRinTaxReturn: No, it is part of Form 1907.
OtherRequiredDocs: Yes, Forms 1913 (Global Characterization of the Taxpayer), 1951 (Local File), 1937 (CbCR), 1950 (Master File). These require intercompany agreements, financial statements, group shareholding charts, among other information.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 April
TPReturnDeadline: Last business day of June (with possible 3-month extension)
CbCRNotificationDeadline: 30 June (for surrogate entity, constituent entities via Form 1907)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Contemporaneously and upon request. If Form 1951 is required, then 30 June (with possible 3-month extension).
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline, but upon request (usually 30 days). If Form 1951 is required, then 30 June (with possible 3-month extension).
TPMethodPreference: Yes, the 'best method rule' applies, accepting OECD methods and an 'other' method.
LocalComparables: Foreign comparable entities and transactions are accepted in the absence of local comparable entities and transactions, if they are similar in functions, assets and risks of the tested party or tested transaction.
SingleYearAnalysis: Single-year testing is recommended for tested parties. Multi-year analysis is usual for comparable information. Multi-year for tested party possible if explained.
InterquartileRange: Yes, ITL Article 41E incorporates the interquartile range as a parameter.
AnnualBenchmarking: Not specified, but practice follows OECD recommendations, considering both options.
BenchmarkingType: Weighted average is usually used; however, it is not mandatory. Best practice must be applied.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Financial information used for tested party must be comparable to benchmark, requiring comparability adjustments for accounting standard differences.
CompliancePenals: Monetary penalty for non-maintenance-late-incorrect filing of Forms 1907, 1937, 1950, 1951 is between 10 and 50 Chilean annual tax units (approx. USD10,000-USD50,000), not exceeding 15% of tax equity.
PenaltiesPostAudit: 40% single tax penalty on adjustments (additional 5% for non-collaboration). No specific penalty for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation, but it weakens defense. No interest on penalties. No prescribed relief, but good faith (contemporaneous documentation) can reduce penalties.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years from the latest due date, extended to six years if no return filed or false returns.
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes, high probability, especially for services, royalties, interest, or operating losses.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, a corresponding adjustment would probably be applied.
AdjustmentRegulations: If the Chilean IRS issues a transfer pricing adjustment, the median of interquartile range will be used. However, if the Chilean Tax Payers accepts transfer pricing analysis prepared by Chilean IRS previous to transfer pricing assessment is issued formally by Chilean IRS (which means during transfer pricing audit), any value within interquartile range could be used.
AuditLikelihood: Yes, mining industry, intragroup services (management, technical, routine), royalties, interest, expense reimbursements, commodity transactions.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral or multilateral APAs can be proposed and subscribed by the SII.
APATenure: Up to five commercial years, extendable.
APARollback: Yes, three years could be contemplated.
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization analysis is based on benchmarking and OECD Guidelines. Specific tax thin capitalization rules exist for withholding-tax purposes.

TaxAuthority: State Taxation Administration (STA)
TPLaw: Various STA Bulletins and Circulars (e.g., Bulletin 24, Bulletin 6, Bulletin 64, Bulletin 42, Circular 2, etc.)
TPStartDate: Various dates, starting from 1 January 2008 (Circular 2) to 1 September 2021 (Bulletin 24)
TPSection: Bulletin 42 defines related-party relationships based on share ownership (25% or more), debt (50% of capital or 10% of debt guaranteed), dependence on intangibles, control over operations, common board/management, and other common interests.
DomesticTPObligations: Yes. Documentation required for domestic transactions, but taxpayers dealing only with domestic related parties may be exempted.
OECDGuidelines: Largely. China is not an OECD member but its TP framework is generally consistent with OECD Guidelines. STA has observer status and was involved in BEPS. Key differences include emphasis on Location-Specific Advantages (LSAs), local intangibles (DEMPEP functions), and scrutiny of intragroup services.
BEPS13Overview: Yes, China adopted BEPS Action 13 for TP documentation effective from 1 January 2016.
