CbCR: Yes, for ultimate parent companies with consolidated revenue > RMB5.5 billion in the previous year. Surrogate filings accepted. Effective 1 January 2016. No material differences from OECD format. Master File: Yes, covered. Effective 1 January 2016. Bulletin 42 requests more detailed information (industrial structure adjustments, R&D facilities, CbCR filing entity). Local File: Yes, covered. Effective 1 January 2016. Bulletin 42 requires detailed analysis of location-specific factors, value chain, related service transactions, foreign investment, related-party share transfer, and APAs in other jurisdictions.
BEPS13PenaltyProtection: No. Master File and Local File must comply with Bulletin 42, addressing additional items. Failure to produce a Bulletin 42 compliant report results in non-compliance record and potential loss of penalty protection.
DocRequirements: Yes, TP documentation guidelines-rules exist and require contemporaneous documentation. A local branch of a foreign company needs to comply. Documentation must be prepared annually (full report update expected). Stand-alone TP reports are required for each entity of an MNE with multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Yes, other (refer to Master File and Local File thresholds). CbCR: RMB5.5 billion annual global income. Master File: RMB1 billion annual RPTs OR cross-border RPTs during the year and ultimate holding company prepared a Master File. Local File: Tangible asset transfers > RMB200 million; OR Financial asset transfers > RMB100 million; OR Intangible asset transfers > RMB100 million; OR Aggregate other RPTs > RMB40 million. Economic analysis: No specified financial threshold.
SpecificRequirements: Local language requirement: Yes, Chinese (Article 21 of Bulletin 42). Safe harbor: No. Aggregation or individual testing: Individual testing generally preferred by tax authorities, though aggregation is observed in practice. Other disclosure: Yes, "special item files" for CSAs and thin capitalization.
TPReturn: No. China does not have TP-specific returns, but extensive return disclosures are required.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: Yes. Article 1 of Bulletin 42 requires submission of up to 22 RPT annual reporting forms (including CbCR forms and 16 other RPT forms) with the annual tax filing by 31 May.
RelatedPartyFinancials: In general, the annual report would include a section of related-party disclosures.
CbCRinTaxReturn: None specified. However, the name and location of its ultimate parent company should be stated in the RPT form, and whether the local entity is designated to file the CbC report of the group.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 May
MasterFileDeadline: 31 December (within 12 months after the financial year-end of the ultimate parent company)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: 30 June of the following year (Local File and special item files)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Submission required within 30 days upon tax authority request.
TPMethodPreference: No. Bulletin 6 states no priority among OECD methods (CUP, resale price, cost-plus, TNMM, profit-split) and other arm's-length consistent methods. Asset valuation methods (cost, market, income) are also allowed. TNMM is not appropriate for significant intangibles. Operating margin and markup on total costs are common PLIs for TNMM. Database searches for comparable companies are generally limited to publicly traded companies. Toll manufacturing allows working capital adjustments (up to 10%) and requires adding material-equipment value to cost base if comparable business models are unavailable.
LocalComparables: Pan Asia-Pacific or Chinese companies are acceptable. Tax authorities prefer local Chinese comparables but accept regional sets if local ones are insufficient. Adjustments for LSAs are sought when foreign comparables are used. Publicly available data is preferred, but nonpublic information (secret comparables) is also authorized and used.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear testing (up to three years) is acceptable.
InterquartileRange: Interquartile range calculation using spreadsheet quartile formulas is acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: Fresh benchmarking search is the suggested practice; however, there is no specification from the regulation.
BenchmarkingType: Preference for weighted average for arm’s-length analysis in practice. Bulletin 6 allows tax authorities to use arithmetic means, weighted averages, or interquartile ranges.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance-non-furnishing-incomplete documentation: Fines from CNY10,000 to CNY50,000. Negative compliance record and additional 5% penalty in case of TP adjustment. Tax authorities can deem taxable income. Failure to furnish CbCR-Master File: No specific penalty, but general rules under Tax Administrative and Collection Law apply. Other penalties: General penalties for failing to fulfill tax-filing obligations (RMB2,000-RMB10,000) and failing to maintain-provide accounting books-information (RMB2,000-RMB10,000). Refusal or false information can lead to deemed taxable income assessment.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Incomplete documentation: Yes, 5% interest surcharge if TP disclosure forms not filed or contemporaneous documentation requirements not met. Negative compliance record and additional 5% penalty. Interest applied to underreported tax. Non-contemporaneous documentation: Yes, fines from CNY10,000 to CNY50,000. Negative compliance record and additional 5% penalty. Tax authorities can deem taxable income. Interest charged on penalties or payable on a refund: No, but 5% interest surcharge applies if TP disclosure forms not filed or contemporaneous documentation requirements not met. Interest is applied to the underreported tax. Penalty relief: No, but the 5% interest surcharge can be avoided by filing TP disclosure forms and meeting contemporaneous documentation requirements.
TPLimitationPeriod: Could be as long as 10 years (e.g., 2015-2024 if audit in 2025). Bulletin 42 requires documentation to be maintained for 10 years.
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes. Tax authorities screen and select audit targets annually using big data analysis and internet information for risk assessment.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, an adjustment. Chinese tax authorities focus on local contributions and intangibles, often testing TNMM effectiveness. Profit margins are usually adjusted upward.
AdjustmentRegulations: According to Article 25 of Bulletin 6, the median is often referenced for transfer pricing adjustments.
AuditLikelihood: Yes. High-risk taxpayers are more likely to face audits. Pharmaceuticals and luxury goods are currently analyzed due to LSAs (market premiums). Close attention is paid to outbound payments of royalties (focus on local contributions to intangibles) and service fees (authentication of services, appropriate cost allocation). Financing transactions and domestic related-party transactions are also increasingly scrutinized.
APAAvailable: Unilateral, bilateral, and multilateral APAs are available. Guidance in Bulletin 64. Bulletin 24 provides simplified unilateral APA procedures (decision within 90 days, negotiation within 6 months). Requirements: RPT volume > RMB40 million for past three years, duly filed RPT forms, met contemporaneous documentation. No application fee.
APARollback: Yes. Retrospective period up to 10 prior years if RPTs are same or similar.
MAPAvailable: Yes. Application within a reasonable period from first notification of non-DTT compliant taxation.
ThinCapRegulations: The CIT law has a thin capitalization rule disallowing interest expense from excessive related-party loans. Safe harbor debt-to-equity ratio: 5:1 for financial industry, 2:1 for other industries. Interest may still be fully deductible if arm's-length evidence (e.g., thin capitalization special item file) is provided, even if ratios are exceeded.

TaxAuthority: National Tax and Customs Authority (Dirección de Impuestos y Aduanas Nacionales (DIAN))
TPLaw: Articles 260-1 to 260-11 in the Colombian Tax Code and Regulatory Decree 1625 of 2016
TPSection: Articles 260-1 to 260-11 of the Colombian Tax Code; Regulatory Decree 1625 de 2016, Book 1, Part 2, Title 2
DomesticTPObligations: Yes, for transactions with local related parties in free trade zones.
OECDGuidelines: Limited; used as technical reference criteria.
BEPS13Overview: Adopted BEPS Action 13; requires CbCR, Master File, and Local File.
BEPS13PenaltyProtection: Not applicable; no penalty protection regime.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation rules exist and must be prepared contemporaneously and annually. Applies to foreign related parties, local related parties in free trade zones, and third parties in low-tax jurisdictions/preferential tax regimes. Local branches and MNE entities require stand-alone reports.
MaterialityThresholds: Local File: COP2,117,925,000 (foreign/free trade zone related parties) or COP470,650,000 (tax haven transactions) per transaction type, plus equity/revenue thresholds. Master File: Required if Local File is required. CbCR: COP3,812,265,000,000 annual global income.
SpecificRequirements: Local File in Spanish; Master File in English or Spanish (translation may be requested). No safe harbor. Individual testing preferred (aggregation must be justified). Tested party's financial information must be certified.
TPReturn: Yes, a transfer pricing informative return is required if equity or revenues exceed specified thresholds.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: No, disclosures are in the TP informative return.
CbCRinTaxReturn: Included in the transfer pricing informative return; if no TP return, submitted separately.
TaxReturnDeadline: Varies (9 April to 24 April, depending on Tax ID number)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: 9 September to 22 September
TPMethodPreference: Yes, OECD methods (CUP, resale price, cost-plus, TNMM, profit-split) are established. Method selection based on transaction characteristics, prioritizing internal comparables.
LocalComparables: No legal preference for local comparables. Local, Americas, or global benchmarks can be used; European, Asian, Middle East, or other continents' benchmarks cannot.
SingleYearAnalysis: Single-year analysis is the general rule; multiyear allowed in extraordinary circumstances with justification.
InterquartileRange: Yes, interquartile range using spreadsheet formulas is acceptable; other statistical measures allowed in exceptional cases.
AnnualBenchmarking: No rule for fresh searches every year, but comparability factors must be re-evaluated. Disclosure of search date and financial updates required.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: No specific criteria, but common practice uses public financial information, companies not affected by significant controlled transactions, and without extraordinary situations like recurring losses.
CompliancePenals: Penalties for documentation: Late filing (0.05%-0.2% of transaction value, max COP941.3M), Inconsistencies (1% of inconsistent transactions, max COP235.3M), Omission (2% for related parties, 4% for tax havens, max COP235.3M/COP470.6M), Non-submission (4% for related parties, 6% for tax havens, max COP1.17B/COP1.41B), Amendment (1%-4% of changed transactions, max COP235.3M/COP941.3M). CbCR failure: 0.5 UVT per data piece, max 7,500 UVT (COP352.9M). Master File failure: Non-submission or late filing penalties apply.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation ("Inconsistencies" or "Omission" penalties apply). No interest charged on penalties. No penalty relief regime, but amendment before penalty order can reduce penalty by 50%.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Adjustment to the median of the market range, included in income tax return. Inaccuracy penalty (100% of higher income tax) and interest rate applied. Penalty may be avoided if controversy is due to differing legal criteria application.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, adjustment should apply to the median of the interquartile range.
AuditLikelihood: Yes, oil and gas, mining, pharmaceutical industries. Also, general and specialized services, royalties, intercompany loans, economic/extraordinary adjustments, unusual analysis approaches, gross margin methods, and commodity transactions. Cost-plus or resale price methods with external comparables are often challenged.
APAAvailable: Yes, for any related-party transaction covered by local regulations.
APATenure: Year of subscription, year before, and up to three taxable years after.
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization rules apply to intercompany debt, with a 2:1 debt-to-equity ratio.

TaxAuthority: Congolese tax authorities (formerly Direction Générale des Impôts et des Domaines (DGID))
TPLaw: General Tax Code, Articles 120 to 120 I, Tome 1
TPSection: Article 120 and following of General Tax Code
BEPS13Overview: Not adopted BEPS Action 13; CbCR and Local File required, Master File not required.
DocRequirements: No specific guidelines, but documentation must be prepared contemporaneously and annually; local branches and multiple entities require separate reports.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: XAF50 million (value of international transactions); CbCR & Local File: XAF500 million turnover or gross assets; Master File: Not specified.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (French) required; no safe harbor; no preference for aggregation; no other disclosure.
TaxReturnDeadline: 20 May
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: 20 November (statutory); 8 days upon request
CompliancePenals: Failure to provide complete TP documentation by audit initiation: XAF25 million. Failure to furnish CbCR: XAF5 million. Failure to submit local TP return and/or TP documentation: XAF5 million after 8 days notice. Late CbCR/TP documentation declaration: XAF5 million. TP reassessments trigger adjustment of taxable profit for CIT (one-third of amounts).
PenaltiesPostAudit: Reassessment leads to additional CIT (28%) and deemed dividend (15%), plus penalties of 50% for CIT and 100% for deemed dividend; no interest; no penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Four years following the year for which the tax is due.
AuditLikelihood: All types of intragroup transactions (e.g., management fees, royalties and licenses)
APAAvailable: Not applicable

TaxAuthority: Tax Administration of Costa Rica (Dirección General de Tributación - DGT)
TPLaw: Various Executive Decrees and DGT Resolutions
TPSection: DGT-R- 49- 2019 resolution (replaces DGT-R- 16- 2017)
OECDGuidelines: Limited, local regulations prevail, but OECD Guidelines are a recognized technical reference.
BEPS13Overview: Documentation incorporates some BEPS Action 13 elements with local additions. CbCR, Master File, and Local File are required, largely aligning with OECD format for CbCR and Master File, but Local File has local additions.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously, annually, for local branches, stand-alone reports for each entity.
MaterialityThresholds: No materiality limit for TP documentation, Master File, Local File, or Economic analysis. CbCR threshold is EUR750 million annual global income.
SpecificRequirements: Documentation must be in Spanish. No safe harbor. Individual testing of transactions preferred.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, usually includes type, amount, and name of related party, consistent with other TP disclosures.
TaxReturnDeadline: 15 March
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline, 10 working days upon request
TPMethodPreference: Yes, CUP, resale price, cost-plus, profit-split, TNMM, and international quotations method. Most appropriate method required.
LocalComparables: No, international comparables are accepted due to lack of local financial information.
SingleYearAnalysis: No, multiple-year testing (typically three years) for comparables.
InterquartileRange: Not specified, but spreadsheet quartile calculation is preferred and common.
AnnualBenchmarking: Yes, preferred over updating financials of a prior study.
CompliancePenals: No express monetary penalties for non-maintenance-non-furnishing-incomplete documentation or Master File, but general Tax Code penalties apply by default. CbCR penalty not specified.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Penalties apply if documentation is incomplete (general Tax Code). No express monetary penalty for non-contemporaneous documentation, but general Tax Code penalties apply. Interest charged on TP income adjustments. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Standard four years, extended to 10 years for unregistered taxpayers, fraudulent returns, or failure to file. Starts next month after tax return due date.
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes, and challenge is high. DGT prefers CUP, but accepts TNMM.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, usually results in an adjustment.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, adjustment to the median of the interquartile range if margin-price falls outside.
AuditLikelihood: Yes, large taxpayers have a higher possibility of being audited.
APAAvailable: Yes, contemplated under TP Executive Decree.
MAPAvailable: Yes, guidance in Resolution N° DGT-R- 12- 2017.
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization rule limits interest deduction to 20% of EBITDA (excluding certain local-foreign financial institution loans). Interest exceeding threshold is nondeductible but can be carried forward. Phased reduction from 30% to 20%.

TaxAuthority: Directorate General for Taxation (Direction Générale des Impôts - DGI)
TPLaw: Articles 36, 36 Bis and 38 of the General Tax Code; Article 50 Bis of the Tax Procedure Book; Article 15 of the 2017 Finance Law; Article 14 of the 2018 Finance Law; Article 12 of the 2023 Finance Law; Article 14-2 of 2024 Fiscal Law
TPSection: Articles 36, 36 Bis, 36 Ter and 38 of the General Tax Code, Article 50 Bis of the Tax Procedure Book
BEPS13Overview: Cote d’Ivoire has adopted BEPS Action 13 for TP documentation in terms of TP return and CbCR. It requires CbCR (EUR381,122,543 threshold, effective 1 Jan 2018), Master File (effective 1 Jan 2023), and Local File (effective 1 Jan 2023). No material differences from OECD format.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation needs to be prepared contemporaneously and annually. Applicable to Ivorian companies with annual turnover exceeding XOF500 million (EUR762,245). Local branches of foreign companies also comply. Stand-alone reports for each entity are required.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation, Master File, Local File: Annual turnover exceeding XOF500 million (EUR762,245). CbCR: Annual consolidated group gross revenue equaling or exceeding EUR381,122,543 (XOF250 billion).
SpecificRequirements: TP documentation needs to be in French. No safe harbor specified. No preference for aggregation or individual testing of transactions.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 June (for certified financial statement filers) or 30 May (for others)
CbCRDeadline: 31 December (12 months after fiscal year end)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within one month upon tax authority request
LocalComparables: No specific guidance, but tax authorities could accept local or West African comparables.
SingleYearAnalysis: No specific guidance. Three-year testing could be acceptable.
InterquartileRange: No specific guidance
AnnualBenchmarking: No specific guidance. Updates could be acceptable.
BenchmarkingType: No specific guidance. Simple average could be preferred.
CompliancePenals: TP documentation: 0.5% of transactions (min XOF10 million) for failure to furnish. CbCR: XOF5 million for failure to furnish, XOF2 million per mistake-omission. TP return: XOF5 million + XOF100,000 per late month, denial of deductibility.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation (0.5% of transactions, min XOF10 million). No interest charged on penalties. Penalty relief can be obtained.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years
AdjustmentRegulations: None specified
AuditLikelihood: None specified
APAAvailable: No
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization rules apply: Total loaned amount not to exceed share capital (with exception for holding companies). Total paid amount not to exceed 30% of EBITDA. Interest rate not to exceed central bank rate + 2 percentage points. Loan repaid within five years. Borrowing company not in liquidation. Share capital fully paid up.

TaxAuthority: Ministry of Finance (Ministarstvo Financija)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings
TPSection: Article 13 of the CIT Act
BEPS13Overview: Croatia has adopted BEPS Action 13 only in relation to CbCR as of 1 January 2017. Amendments to the local tax legislation, in force as of 1 February 2025, introduce the information about the Group and information about the local taxpayer that should be prepared and maintained by the local taxpayer.
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: EUR750 million for CbCR; no general materiality limit for TP documentation, Local File, or Economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: Local language requirement (Croatian); Safe harbor available for interest rate on intercompany loans (e.g., 4.38% for 2025); No preference for aggregation or individual testing of transactions.
CbCRinTaxReturn: CbCR notification is a separate filing and is not included in the statutory tax return.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 April
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; upon request (eight days, generally extended)
LocalComparables: OECD approach followed; no specific preference for local comparables in legislation.
SingleYearAnalysis: No; Multiyear analysis (three to five years) is common practice.
InterquartileRange: No; Mathematic quartile is used as per common practice.
AnnualBenchmarking: No; Fresh search usually every three years, update of financials accepted for other years.
CompliancePenals: Fines up to EUR26,540 for company and EUR2,650 for individual for underestimation of CIT liability or failure to furnish CbCR. Penalty interest for late payment of tax liability.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No specific penalty for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation. No interest on penalties. Penalty relief available.
TPLimitationPeriod: Six years following the year in which tax liability arose (for determining tax liabilities and refunds). For cross-border transactions with related parties, including TP, extended to six years as of 1 January 2025.
AdjustmentRegulations: None specified.
AuditLikelihood: None specified.
APAAvailable: Yes
ThinCapRegulations: Interest limitation rule (30% of EBITDA or EUR3 million, whichever is higher; non-deductible costs can be carried forward for three years). Thin capitalization rule (4:1 debt-to-equity ratio for loans from non-resident related parties or guaranteed by shareholders).
PCbCRDataSources: Accounting Act (in Croatian: Zakon o računovodstvu)
PCbCRMaxPenalties: Up to EUR13,270 for taxpayer, up to EUR2,650 for responsible individual.

TaxAuthority: Cyprus Tax Department, Ministry of Finance
TPLaw: Cyprus Income Tax Law Section 33, Council of Ministers Regulation, and Tax Commissioner Notification Κ.Δ.Π. 314/ 2022
TPSection: Section 33 of the Cyprus Income Tax Law (L 118(I) of 2002, as amended, Section 33)
BEPS13Overview: Cyprus has adopted the three-tier approach (i.e., Master File, Local File and CbCR) as described in OECD BEPS Action 13.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously prepared.
MaterialityThresholds: CbCR/Master File: EUR750 million global consolidated revenue. Local File: EUR5 million for financial transactions, EUR1 million for other transactions.
SpecificRequirements: Documentation in English or Greek. Safe harbors available for certain financing and low value-adding services. No preference for aggregation or individual testing.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Related-party transactions and balances are required to be disclosed in the “Notes of the Financial Statements” as provided under IFRS.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 March (15 months from FY-end)
MasterFileDeadline: Within 60 days upon request (preparation by 31 March, 15 months from FY-end)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: By CIT return deadline (31 March, 15 months from FY-end)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within 60 days upon the tax authorities’ formal request.
LocalComparables: No, pan-European studies are sufficient.
SingleYearAnalysis: No, multi-year (three years) analysis is accepted.
InterquartileRange: Yes, spreadsheet quartile function is generally accepted.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, comparable data can be used for two consecutive years, but financial data must be updated annually.
CompliancePenals: Master/Local File: EUR5,000 (61-90 days late), EUR10,000 (91-120 days late), EUR20,000 (over 120 days late or not submitted). SIT: EUR500. CbCR: up to EUR10,000 (reporting entity), up to EUR5,000 (constituent entity), up to EUR20,000 (continuous infractions).
PenaltiesPostAudit: 5% penalty plus 5.5% interest on assessed amount if documentation is deemed incomplete or non-contemporaneous. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Six years from the end of the year of assessment, which may be increased to 12 years in the case of fraud or willful default.
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific regulations, but adjustments are applied to the median in practice.
AuditLikelihood: Not applicable.
APAAvailable: Yes
ThinCapRegulations: Anti-Tax Avoidance Directive provisions for interest limitation rules (from 1 Jan 2019).
PCbCRAuthority: Cyprus Tax Department, Ministry of Finance
PCbCRStartDate: Reporting requirement applies for financial years (FYs) starting on or after 22 June 2024.
PCbCRSection: Articles 157A to 157N of Cyprus Companies Law.
PCbCRIncomeThreshold: EUR750 million in each of the last two consecutive financial years.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: Within 12 months of the balance sheet date for the relevant FY

TaxAuthority: Ministry of Finance (Ministerstvo Financí České Republiky — MF)
TPLaw: Czech Income Tax Act and various Directives (D-10, D-34, D-32, D-334)
TPSection: Section 23/ 7 of the Czech Income Tax Act
BEPS13Overview: Yes, but only CbCR obligation effectively adopted. Master File and Local File are not covered, but Directive D-334 has similar requirements.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist. Not submitted contemporaneously, but prepared annually. Local branch of foreign company must comply. Stand-alone reports not required for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: No financial threshold for TP documentation, Master File, Local File, or Economic analysis. CbCR threshold is EUR750 million annual global income.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Czech) required, but English accepted. No safe harbor specified. Individual testing of transactions preferred. No other disclosure.
TaxReturnDeadline: Three months after year-end, four months if filed electronically, or six months if subject to obligatory audit or filed by certified tax advisor.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: End of the respective year (only if changes from previous year).
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Upon request of the tax authorities.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Usually 15 days upon request, may be extended to at least 30 days.
TPMethodPreference: Yes, CUP method generally preferred. Profit-based methods acceptable when substantiated. MF follows OECD Guidelines.
LocalComparables: Yes, preference for local comparables, though EU comparables are usually accepted. No legal requirement.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear (three years) analysis preferred.
InterquartileRange: Spreadsheet quartile is used as per common practice.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, but update of financials is recommended annually.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: 25% independence threshold based on Czech tax law.
CompliancePenals: No specific penalties for not having TP documentation. Penalty up to CZK1.5 million for not filing CbCR. Penalty up to CZK500,000 for not filing CbCR notification. Penalty up to CZK500,000 for not filing TP appendix to CITR.
PenaltiesPostAudit: If TP challenged, 20% of unpaid tax or 1% of decreased tax loss, plus interest at 8% above CNB repo rate. No penalty for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation. Penalty relief is at MF's discretion in specific situations.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years from CITR deadline, extendable in cases of tax scrutiny, supplementary CITR, tax losses (up to 5 additional years), or investment incentives (up to 10 additional years).
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, adjustment to the point in the arm’s-length range most advantageous for the taxpayer (e.g., lower quartile).
AuditLikelihood: Intangibles, royalties, long-term losses, service fees. Transactions with tax-haven jurisdictions.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral, bilateral, and multilateral APAs available. Nonresidents can ask for APA for PE profit allocation.
APARollback: No, but decisions are respected for previous periods in practice.
MAPAvailable: Yes, in line with EU arbitration convention, DRM Directive, and DTTs.
ThinCapRegulations: Debt-equity ratio 4:1 (6:1 for banks-insurance). Financing expenses for profit-participating loans nondeductible. Interest deductibility limitation rule (ATAD transposition) - higher of 30% tax EBITDA or CZK80 million. Disallowed costs can be carried forward.
PCbCRStartDate: Financial years starting on or after 22 June 2024
PCbCRMaterialityExemptions: Yes, if Czech entity is part of a non-EU group, it files PCbCR only if its net turnover exceeded CZK200 million in two consecutive accounting periods.
PCbCRAggregationAllowed: Yes, PCbCR presents total figures per jurisdiction, not per transaction.
PCbCRLodgmentPossible: Yes, by filing in the Czech Commercial Register.
PCbCRLodgmentOtherJurisdiction: Yes, on certain conditions, but filing in Czech Commercial Register is still needed.
PCbCRLodgmentFormat: Yes, prescribed language (Czech or English), electronic form and structure.
PCbCRCriminalRisk: Yes, if breach is deliberate, hides profit shifting-tax evasion-systematic fraud, and causes serious harm.

TaxAuthority: General Direction of Tax (Direction Générale des Impôts - DGI)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings
TPSection: Special tax provisions provided under 1b
BEPS13Overview: DRC has not adopted BEPS Action 13. However, CbCR (for MNEs with EUR750M+ sales), Master File, and Local File are required, effective 2017, with significant differences from OECD templates.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist. Not submitted contemporaneously, but upon request during audit. Local branches must comply. Annual preparation required. Stand-alone reports not required for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: Applicable for companies with annual net turnover of USD1 million and transactions of USD20,000 and above with affiliated companies outside DRC.
SpecificRequirements: Not applicable
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: USD 1 million Minimum Annual Revenue Excluding Taxes
RelatedPartyFinancials: Local language (French) required. Individual testing of transactions preferred. No safe harbor specified.
TaxReturnDeadline: Yes
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Not applicable
LocalComparables: By time of tax audit
SingleYearAnalysis: 20 days following tax auditor's request
InterquartileRange: No explicit priority. CUP, Cost-plus, Resale price, TNMM, and Profit split are accepted. Other justified methods are also acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: Local comparables preferred if available, but both are applicable.
CompliancePenals: None specified
PenaltiesPostAudit: None specified
TPLimitationPeriod: None specified
MethodologyScrutiny: Failure to declare TP documentation: fine of CDF500,000 per day of delay. Absence of complete TP documentation may lead to rejection of deducted professional charges.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: No penalty if documentation is deemed incomplete or non-contemporaneous. Reassessment leads to 30% CIT and 20% WHT on deemed distribution. Penalties: 20% of tax evaded (40% if recurring), plus 2% interest per month (capped at 50%).
AdjustmentRegulations: Five years
AuditLikelihood: No, but tax authorities ensure reality of transactions.
APAAvailable: Yes, adjustment likely if taxable base is lowered.
APARollback: Large companies: telecommunication, oil and gas, mining, and subcontracting mining companies.
ThinCapRegulations: Maximum of four years
PCbCRRegulations: Article 64 of 2023 Finance Act: interest paid to shareholders deductible only if loans do not exceed paid-up share capital. Disallowance of loan interest exceeding market rates or principal repayment beyond five years. Management fees deductible if genuine, not locally renderable, and arm's-length.
PCbCRCriminalRisk: Not applicable / Not applicable / Not applicable / No

TaxAuthority: Danish Tax Administration (Skattestyrelsen)
TPLaw: Tax Assessment Act (Ligningsloven), Tax Control Act (Skattekontrolloven), Executive Order No. 468 of 19 April 2022
TPSection: Tax Assessment Act Section 2, Tax Control Act Section 37-42
DomesticTPObligations: Yes, with exemptions for financial years starting on or after 1 January 2021 unless parties are subject to asymmetrical tax regimes or the transaction impacts a cross-border transaction
BEPS13Overview: Adopted for Master File, Local File, and CbCR
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously prepared and submitted annually for financial years starting on or after 1 January 2021; submitted upon request for prior years. Applies to local branches and requires stand-alone reports for each entity.
MaterialityThresholds: For 2024 and prior: Group threshold of <250 FTEs AND (<DKK125m assets OR <DKK250m revenue). For 2025 onwards: Group threshold of <250 FTEs AND (<DKK195m assets OR <DKK391m revenue). Also for 2025 onwards, de minimis transaction volume exemption of <DKK5m intercompany transactions AND <DKK50m intercompany receivables-debt, with exceptions for IP and non-EU-EEA treaty countries.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Danish, English, Swedish, Norwegian) accepted. Individual testing of transactions preferred.
TPReturn: Yes, disclosures embedded in corporate tax return, or Form 05.022 for specific cases.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: Yes, nature and volume of controlled transactions, jurisdiction of counterparties, exemption status.
TaxReturnDeadline: Six months after financial year-end, but no later than 1 September.
TPReturnDeadline: Same as corporate income tax return.
MasterFileDeadline: 60 days after corporate tax return deadline for financial years starting on or after 1 January 2021; 60 days upon request for prior years.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: No later than the end of the financial year.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: 60 days after corporate tax return deadline for financial years starting on or after 1 January 2021; contemporaneously with tax return for prior years (submitted upon request).
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: 60 days after corporate tax return deadline for financial years starting on or after 1 January 2021; 60 days upon request for prior years.
LocalComparables: No, Pan-European benchmarks are accepted.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multi-year testing generally accepted but single-year testing required for limited-risk entities.
InterquartileRange: Yes, preferred and respected.
AnnualBenchmarking: Consistent with OECD Guidance.
CompliancePenals: DKK250,000 per entity per year for no, insufficient, or late documentation (reducible by 50% if subsequently submitted). 10% of income adjustment in severe cases. Same for CbCR. Penalties for incorrect disclosures.
PenaltiesPostAudit: 10% of income adjustment in severe cases, nondeductible surcharge, interest on late payments (0.9% per month for 2024-2025). Penalties for non-contemporaneous documentation. Penalty relief possible (50% reduction).
TPLimitationPeriod: 1 May of the sixth year following the financial year concerned.
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific regulation, but DTA often argues for adjustment to median.
AuditLikelihood: Business restructurings-IP transfers, loss-making entities-branches, entities-branches with material financial transactions, material decreases in taxable income.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral (informal), bilateral, and multilateral.
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization rules: 4:1 debt-to-equity ratio, DKK10m controlled debt threshold. Interest ceiling rule: 6% (2024 rate) of qualified assets, DKK21.3m net financial expenses threshold (2024). EBITDA rule: 30% of EBITDA, DKK22.3m net financial expenses threshold (2024).
PCbCRStartDate: Financial years started 22 June 2024 or later
PCbCRSection: Danish Financial Statements Act (Årsregnskabsloven) LBK nr 1057 af 23-09-2024, Chapter 18a
PCbCRMaterialityExemptions: Yes, subsidiaries in accounting classes A or B or branches with revenue less than DKK111 million.
PCbCR_BEPS13Alignment: No, aligns with EU Directive 2021-2101 of 24 November 2021, does not require Stated capital or Fixed assets, includes Safe Clause.
PCbCRLodgmentOtherJurisdiction: Yes, if ultimate parent entity lodges in another EU-EEA jurisdiction under EU Directive 2021-2101.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: 12 months after the end of the financial year.
PCbCRCriminalRisk: Yes, risk of fine or more severe sentence under Penal Code.

TaxAuthority: Tax Administration of the Dominican Republic (Dirección General de Impuestos Internos - DGII)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings
TPSection: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings
BEPS13Overview: Jurisdiction adopted BEPS Action 13. CbCR required for MNEs with consolidated annual revenue >= DOP38.8 billion, effective 1 Jan 2022, no differences from OECD CbCR. Master File required, effective 1 Jan 2021, significant differences from OECD template. Local File required, effective 1 Jan 2021, significant differences from OECD template.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation needs to be prepared and submitted annually. Local branch of a foreign company needs to comply. Stand-alone reports required for MNEs with multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Yes, total intercompany transactions not exceeding DOP12,193,981.70 (adjusted annually) and no transactions with tax havens. CbCR: DOP38.8 billion annual global income. Master File: DOP12,193,981.70 (adjusted annually) total intercompany transactions and no transactions with tax havens. Local File: DOP12,193,981.70 (adjusted annually) total intercompany transactions and no transactions with tax havens. No threshold for Economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Spanish) required for TP documentation. Safe harbor unspecified. Individual testing of transactions preferred. Transfer pricing informative return (DIOR) required annually.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes. Usually, information of type of intercompany transactions, amount and name of the related party is included in the audited financial statements.
TaxReturnDeadline: 120 days after FY closing
TPReturnDeadline: 120 days after FY closing (for FY 2022 and onward- 180 days prior to FY 2022)
MasterFileDeadline: 180 days after the transfer pricing informative return deadline
CbCRDeadline: No later than 12 months after the fiscal year end of the MNE.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: UPE-reporting entity notification: no later than the last day of the multinational group’s reporting tax year. Other constituent entity notification: no later than three months before the end of the multinational group’s reporting tax year.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Documentation must be readily available by the time the transfer pricing informative return (DIOR) is filed.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Statutory deadline: Yes, within 180 days of the filing deadline of the transfer pricing informative return (DIOR) from FY 2021. Upon request: five days.
LocalComparables: International comparables are accepted due to lack of local financial information.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear testing for comparables is applicable, typically three years. Explanation required for multiyear analysis.
InterquartileRange: Yes
AnnualBenchmarking: A fresh benchmarking search every year over the update of the financials of a prior study is preferred.
BenchmarkingType: Weighted average is common in practice.
CompliancePenals: For non-maintenance-non-furnishing-incomplete furnishing of documentation, CbCR, and Master File: Penalties up to three times those in Article 257 (five to 30 minimum wages and 0.25% of previous year’s gross income).
PenaltiesPostAudit: If documentation is deemed incomplete, no direct penalty, but additional tax from adjustments incurs surcharges (10% first month, 4% subsequent) and interest (1.10% monthly). If non-contemporaneous, yes, same surcharges and interest apply. No interest on refunds. Penalty relief available: 40% for voluntary amendment, 30% if audited difference < 30%.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years, extended to five years if a taxpayer fails to file a return.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, adjustment to the median of the interquartile range if results fall outside.
AuditLikelihood: Any industry is subject to audit. Historically, consumer products, hospitality, and commodities industries were more likely.
APAAvailable: Yes
APATenure: Can be requested for a certain time period and renewed for an additional three years.
ThinCapRegulations: Article 287 of the Dominican Tax Code states that the limitation on interest deduction will be limited to the indebtedness capacity of the entity, which cannot exceed three times the value of its equity.

TaxAuthority: Internal Revenue Service (Servicio de Rentas Internas, or SRI) and National Customs Service (Servicio Nacional de Aduanas del Ecuador, or SENAE)
TPLaw: Ley de Régimen Tributario Interno (LRTI), tax administration resolutions and communications, SRI technical guidelines. OECD TP Guidelines as technical reference.
TPSection: LRTI’s first unnumbered article after Article 4 and SRI’s resolution on tax havens. Tax Law defines arm’s-length principle, methods, comparability criteria, and penalties.
OECDGuidelines: Limited. Applicable as technical reference for matters not regulated by internal law, regulation, resolution or international treaty. Most current OECD guidelines on January 1st of fiscal year are relevant.
BEPS13Overview: Jurisdiction has not adopted BEPS Action 13. CbCR is not required. Master File is not required as a standalone deliverable, but the Local Report (starting FY2023) must include most of the information typically contained in the Group’s Master File, plus additional corporate information and copies of relevant APAs. Local File is not required as a standalone deliverable, but a "Local Report" is assimilable to it, with specific content requirements.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and need to be submitted or prepared contemporaneously if thresholds are met. Prepared annually. Stand-alone reports for each entity. Local branch of foreign company must comply.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Yes, "relevant transactions" exceeding USD3 million for Transfer Pricing Annex, and USD10 million for Transfer Pricing Report. SRI may request documentation even if thresholds are not met. CbCR: Not applicable. Master File: Same threshold as TP Documentation (USD10 million for report submission), as Master File content is part of the Local Report. Local File: Not applicable. Economic analysis: No specific financial threshold, all transactions must comply with arm's-length principle.
SpecificRequirements: Local language: Yes, Spanish. Safe harbor: No. Aggregation: Individual testing. Other disclosure: No.
TPReturn: Yes, an informative transfer pricing return (Annex) in XML format must be filed along with the Transfer Pricing Report.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: Yes, total amounts of related party transactions are part of the CIT return.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, IFRS accounting standards require external auditors to include an opinion on arm's-length principle for related party transactions in notes to financial statements. Tax Compliance Report by external auditors is also required.
TaxReturnDeadline: Depends on taxpayer regime (General or Special Taxpayers) and ninth digit of tax ID. Special Taxpayers: 11 April (or 10-28 April based on ID). General Regime: based on ninth digit of tax ID.
TPReturnDeadline: Two months after CIT return filing. Deadlines established according to taxpayer regime.
MasterFileDeadline: Same as Transfer Pricing Documentation, as Master File content is part of the Group’s functional analysis within the Local Report.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Annually, no specific deadline for preparation.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Yes, statutory deadline. Within two months after the CIT return. Upon tax authority request for non-compliance-late submission: 5-10 business days. For inconsistencies: 10-20 business days.
LocalComparables: Yes, local comparables preferred, but limited by public availability of information by April 11 of the following fiscal year.
SingleYearAnalysis: Yes, PLI for analyses must be calculated only with financial information contemporaneous to the year of documentation.
InterquartileRange: Yes, compulsory whenever more than one comparable or observation is available.
AnnualBenchmarking: Yes, a fresh benchmarking search needs to be conducted every year.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: PLI using contemporaneous financial information. Prior year data allowed if conditions similar. Multi-year PLI requires factual justification. Operating losses allowed if market situations demonstrated. PLI denominator should not contain tested operations unless verified. Detailed review of comparables for business segments. Working capital adjustments must be explained and supported (not routine since 2018). Arm’s-length range with regular statistics formulas (EY interquartile range or weighted average not allowed).
CompliancePenals: Penalties up to USD15,000 for non-submission, inaccuracies, mistakes, differences, lack of information, or false data in TP report or annex. Fines accumulate. Resolution NAC-DGERCGC24-00000020 establishes tier-based penalty amounts.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Incomplete documentation: Yes, 20% surcharge on assessment. Non-contemporaneous documentation: Yes, 20% surcharge on assessment. Interest charged: Yes, 1.5 times the Ecuadorian lending rate on adjustments and refunds. Penalty relief: No, but 20% surcharge may be prevented if assessment accepted at draft stage.
TPLimitationPeriod: Four years from the date of the CIT return filing.
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes, high risk if selected for general tax audit.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, an adjustment. More than 75% of reviews result in assessments based on challenging methodology or comparable set.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, adjustments are calculated at the median value of the arm’s-length range.
AuditLikelihood: Recent focus on intangible property and services-related transactions. Risk of challenge similar for every taxpayer.
APAAvailable: Yes, an APA-like procedure exists (pricing or methodology consultations and information disclosure).
APATenure: The ruling term includes the year before the response date, the year when the response is issued, and the following three tax years.
APARollback: Yes, if favorable, taxpayer must amend tax returns for prior fiscal years.
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization rules apply to related-party transactions. For banks, insurance companies, and financial sector entities, interest on foreign loans from related parties is deductible if total external loans to equity ratio does not exceed 300%. For other companies-individuals, interest on foreign loans from related parties is deductible if it does not exceed 20% of earnings before interests, taxes, profit sharing, depreciations, and amortizations.

TaxAuthority: Egyptian Tax Authority (ETA)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings, Unified Tax Procedures Law, and TP guidelines
TPSection: Various Articles in ITL, Executive Regulations, TP Guidelines, and Unified Tax Procedures Law
BEPS13Overview: Adopted BEPS Action 13. Requires CbCR (threshold EGP3 billion, effective 2018), Master File (threshold EGP15 million, effective 2018), and Local File (threshold EGP15 million, effective 2018). No material differences from OECD format.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and need to be submitted contemporaneously. Local branches must comply. Required annually. Stand-alone reports for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation, Master File, Local File: EGP15 million for overall related-party transactions. CbCR: EGP3 billion annual global income. No limit for economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Arabic) required for submission, though English accepted with potential request for official translation. No safe harbor specified. No preference for aggregation or individual testing.
CbCRinTaxReturn: No. CbCR notification is to be submitted separately by the last day of the fiscal year to which the CbCR relates.
TaxReturnDeadline: Four months from the end of the financial year
MasterFileDeadline: For Egyptian entity having headquarters in Egypt or Egyptian entity part of overseas multinational group with no Master File submission requirement at ultimate parent entity’s jurisdiction, the Master File in Egypt is required to be submitted along with the Local File within two months from the tax return submission date. For Egyptian entity part of overseas multinational group where Master File submission requirement is specified in the ultimate parent entity’s jurisdiction, the Master File in Egypt is required to be submitted on the same date as per the timeline at ultimate parent entity’s jurisdiction.
CbCRDeadline: Within one year after the end of the reporting fiscal year.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Not later than the last day of the fiscal year to which the CbCR relates.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within two months following the date of filing or submission of CTR.
LocalComparables: Lack of local data- ETA accepts Middle East and Africa comparables. Global comparables accepted if local comparables are unavailable.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiple-year analysis (three years) is preferred.
InterquartileRange: No official preference, but used in practice.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, but updating financials of prior study is required. Fresh search generally every three years.
BenchmarkingType: Weighted average is used in practice- no official preference.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: ETA applies manual shareholding filter/criteria (e.g., rejecting comparables with >50% ownership or unknown ownership).
CompliancePenals: Failure to declare accurate value of related-party transactions (Table 508)- 1% of undeclared value. Failure to submit Master File or Local File- 3% of total related-party transactions. Failure to submit CbC report/notification- 2% of total related-party transactions. Penalties capped at 3% of total related-party transactions for a fiscal year.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No penalties for incomplete/non-contemporaneous documentation. Penalties for audit adjustments- 20% of tax difference (if <50% of final tax due), 40% of tax difference (if >50% of final tax due). Penalties can be reduced by 50% if agreement reached before appeal committee. No interest charged on penalties/refunds. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years
MethodologyScrutiny: No, but increasing. TP department has started issuing notices for non-submission of documentation.
AdjustmentRegulations: Median is used as common practice.
AuditLikelihood: Change in business model, consistent loss-makers, distribution, services, manufacturing businesses. Pharma sector faces greater audit challenges.
APAAvailable: Unilateral APAs are available, but none entered into so far.
ThinCapRegulations: Maximum debt-to-equity ratio: 4:1 for 2023, 3:1 for 2024-2027, 2:1 from 2028 onward. Excess interest not deductible.

TaxAuthority: Directorate General of Internal Taxes (Dirección General de los Impuestos Internos - DGII) and Ministry of Finance (Ministerio de Hacienda - MH)
TPLaw: Articles 62 A, 124, 147, 199-A, 199-B, 199-C, 199-D and 244 of the Salvadoran Tax Code; Administrative Guideline, or Guía de Orientación (GO), No. 001/ 2018
TPSection: Articles 62 A, 124, 147, 199-A, 199-B, 199-C, 199-D and 244 of the Salvadoran Tax Code; Administrative Guideline, or Guía de Orientación (GO), No. 001/ 2018
BEPS13Overview: No (Jurisdiction has not adopted BEPS Action 13, does not require CbCR, Master File, or Local File)
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: For Form F-982, threshold is USD571,429 on intercompany transactions. No other specific materiality limits for TP documentation, CbCR, Master File, Local File, or Economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Spanish) required; No safe harbor; Individual testing preferred.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Usually, information of type of intercompany transactions, amount and name of the related party is included in the audited financial statements.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 April
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; upon request of the tax authorities (usually 15 working days)
LocalComparables: International comparables are accepted by the tax authorities
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear testing for comparables (in practice, three years)
InterquartileRange: The spreadsheet interquartile calculation is indicated in the GO.
AnnualBenchmarking: A fresh benchmarking study needs to be conducted every year.
BenchmarkingType: The weighted average is preferred for arm’s-length analysis; three-year weighted average arm’s-length ranges are frequently calculated.
CompliancePenals: Late filing, failing to file, or incomplete/incorrect information in TP return: 0.5% of equity (min. 3 monthly minimum wages). No balance sheet: 9 monthly minimum wages. Failure to maintain documentation: 2% of equity (min. 9 monthly minimum wages). External tax auditor non-compliance: 5 monthly minimum wages. Taxpayer failure to provide info to auditor: 0.1% of equity (min. 4 monthly minimum wages).
PenaltiesPostAudit: No direct penalty for incomplete/non-contemporaneous documentation. Adjustments for underpayments on income tax or VAT: 25% to 50% of unpaid tax (min. USD568 or USD2,736). Penalty relief available (75% reduction for voluntary disclosure before examination, 30% during examination).
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years (ordinary); five years when no tax return has been filed.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes. If the margin or price falls outside the range, the adjustment should be made to the median of such range.
AuditLikelihood: None specified
APAAvailable: None specified
ThinCapRegulations: No
PCbCRCriminalRisk: No / No / No / Not applicable / Not applicable / No

TaxAuthority: Estonian Tax and Customs Board
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings
TPSection: Article 8 - Associated persons of Estonian Income Tax Act
BEPS13Overview: Yes, current TP regulation generally compliant with BEPS Action 13, aligned with OECD Guidelines post-BEPS. CbCR, Master File, Local File required with no material differences from OECD format.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation needs to be prepared contemporaneously and updated annually. Local branches and multiple entities require stand-alone reports.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Turnover, employees >= 250, turnover >= EUR50 million, consolidated assets >= EUR43 million, or credit institution/insurance undertaking/listed company, or transaction with non-cooperative jurisdiction. CbCR: Annual global income >= EUR750 million. Master File/Local File: Same as TP documentation.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Estonian) preferred, English acceptable with potential translation. Individual testing of transactions. Quarterly declaration of intragroup loans and financing instruments.
CbCRinTaxReturn: No, filed electronically on tax authority's website or by email
TaxReturnDeadline: 10th day of each month
CbCRDeadline: Within 12 months after financial year end
CbCRNotificationDeadline: During six months after end of financial year
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline, but within 60 days of tax authority's request.
LocalComparables: Local benchmarks preferred, but pan-European sets are acceptable.
SingleYearAnalysis: No, multiyear analysis is commonly performed.
InterquartileRange: Yes, Estonian legislation defines arm's-length range as interquartile range. Excel quartile formula commonly used.
AnnualBenchmarking: Fresh search every three years if no major changes, otherwise yearly. Financials updated yearly.
BenchmarkingType: Not specified in transfer pricing regulation
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance/incomplete documentation: up to EUR3,200. Failure to furnish CbCR: EUR3,300. Failure to furnish Master File: EUR3,200. Other: up to EUR3,200 for late submission, up to EUR32,000 for intentional false information, up to EUR16 million criminal penalty for intentional wrong information reducing tax.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Documentation incomplete: No penalty, but 22% income tax on difference. Documentation non-contemporaneous: EUR3,200 + 22% income tax on difference. Interest charged on tax amount at 0.06% per day. Penalty relief not available for non-arm's length adjustment.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years, five years for intentional failure to pay/withhold tax.
AdjustmentRegulations: No reference available, but in practice, most favorable value in interquartile range (lower or upper quartile) accepted.
AuditLikelihood: Intragroup financing, management and support services, restructurings, IP transactions, large-amount transactions, primary business transactions. Loans to shareholders/partners/members exceeding 48 months are scrutinized for hidden profit distribution.
APAAvailable: No
MAPAvailable: Yes, applied in practice, but no concrete procedure established in legislation.
ThinCapRegulations: Exceeding borrowing costs are taxable if they exceed EUR3 million and 30% of EBITDA.
PCbCRSection: Chapter 22 Automatic exchange of information on country-by-country reporting in European Union, § 207.
PCbCRLodgmentPossible: No, to be published by Tax and Customs Board on its website
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: On the 10th of the month following the month when data was provided

TaxAuthority: Fiji Revenue and Customs Services (FRCS)
TPLaw: Legal Notice 11, Fiji Transfer Pricing Regulations 2012
TPSection: Section 3 (Associates), subsection 2 of the Fiji Transfer Pricing Regulations
BEPS13Overview: Not adopted BEPS Action 13; CbCR, Master File, and Local File not required.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and must be prepared contemporaneously and annually. Local branches and MNE entities require stand-alone reports.
MaterialityThresholds: No financial threshold for TP documentation or economic analysis. CbCR, Master File, Local File not applicable.
SpecificRequirements: Local language required. No specific safe harbor. No preference for aggregation or individual testing. No other disclosure.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 March or three months after financial year-end (extensions possible)
TPReturnDeadline: 31 March (for disclosures); TPD prepared by tax return lodgment date
LocalFilePrepDeadline: By tax return lodgment date (e.g., March for Dec FYE)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Along with tax return; 14 days upon request
TPMethodPreference: No, most reliable method accepted (CUP, Resale price, Cost-plus, Profit-split, TNMM)
LocalComparables: Local benchmarking can be used
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear analysis (five years)
InterquartileRange: Used by tax authorities in recent audits
AnnualBenchmarking: No, financial updates acceptable
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: FRCS uses ATO industry benchmarking on profitability
CompliancePenals: Failure to keep TP documentation: FJD100,000 fine. Failure to keep records: 75% (knowingly-recklessly) or 20% (other) of tax payable. False-misleading statements: 75% (knowingly-recklessly) or 20% (other) of tax shortfall, with increases for repeat offenses.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No penalty for incomplete-non-contemporaneous documentation. Interest charged on penalties. Penalty relief possible for voluntary disclosure or good compliance record.
TPLimitationPeriod: No specific TP statute of limitations; general statute applies: at any time for fraud-wilful neglect-serious omission; within six years otherwise.
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes, FRCS conducts comprehensive audits based on risk profiling.
AdjustmentRegulations: Not applicable
AuditLikelihood: Manufacturing, services (banking, insurance)
APAAvailable: Yes, though not explicitly in regulations, one APA was achieved via guidelines and reviewed every five years. Legal provisions to be considered.
MAPAvailable: Yes, where a DTT is involved
ThinCapRegulations: Offshore borrowings up to FJD5 million without RBF approval. Foreign-owned companies can borrow locally if 3:1 debt-to-equity ratio maintained.

TaxAuthority: Finnish Tax Administration
TPLaw: Act on the Tax Assessment Procedure, Sections 14a to 14e, 31, 32, 75 and 89. Previous rules from 1 January 2007. Current BEPS Action 13 provisions (Master-Local Files, CbCR) from 1 January 2017 (CbCR for financial years starting on or after 1 January 2016).
TPSection: Act on the Tax Assessment Procedure, Section 14 and 31
BEPS13Overview: Finland has adopted BEPS Action 13 for TP documentation. CbCR, Master File, and Local File requirements are implemented, effective 1 January 2017 (CbCR for financial years starting on or after 1 January 2016). CbCR applies if group revenue exceeds EUR750 million. No material differences from OECD format.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation needs to be prepared annually but submitted only upon request. Local branches must comply. No contemporaneous documentation required during the tax year. Master and Local File requirements implemented.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Group employees >= 250 OR consolidated turnover >= EUR50M AND consolidated net assets >= EUR43M OR not an SME. CbCR: Group revenue > EUR750M in preceding FY. Master File: Cross-border related-party transactions > EUR500k AND general TP criteria met. Local File: General TP criteria met (less extensive if intercompany transactions < EUR500k). Economic analysis: May be omitted if intercompany transactions < EUR500k.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (Finnish, Swedish, or English accepted, translation rarely requested). No safe harbor specified. Individual testing of transactions preferred.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 April
MasterFileDeadline: 60 days upon request. Not obligated to provide earlier than six months after the end of the accounting period.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory requirement to submit annually. 60 days upon request, but not obligated to provide earlier than six months after the end of the accounting period.
LocalComparables: Preference for local or Nordic comparables. Pan-European comparables generally accepted.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear (e.g., three-year) analysis is followed.
InterquartileRange: Both EY and spreadsheet quartiles are used. Finland follows the OECD Guidelines and IQR range is preferred.
AnnualBenchmarking: No
BenchmarkingType: No preference stipulated by law. Finnish Tax Administration has used weighted average in their guidance.
CompliancePenals: A tax penalty of up to EUR25,000 can be imposed for failure to comply with TP documentation requirements, CbCR, or Master File, even if pricing is arm's length.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, a tax penalty of up to EUR25,000 for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation. Interest charged on additional tax liability (6.5% until ~10 months after FY-end, then 11.5%). Penalty relief possible if supplementary documentation supports arm's-length nature.
TPLimitationPeriod: Six years after the end of the calendar year during which the financial statement was closed. Applies to financial years that ended on or after 1 January 2017.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, a reassessment will be imposed by the tax office.
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific regulations; however, based on Supreme Administrative Court decision, any point in the interquartile range should be sufficient.
AuditLikelihood: Transactions involving transfer of intellectual property rights and business restructurings.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral, bilateral and multilateral APAs are available, but no formal APA program.
APATenure: Concluded for a fixed term, but no formal rules concerning the term.
MAPAvailable: Yes, if taxation is not in accordance with a DTT. Most DTTs permit presentation within three years from first notification. EU Arbitration Convention also allows three years.
ThinCapRegulations: No thin capitalization rules; interest limitation rules implemented. Deductibility of net financing expenses limited to 25% of adjusted taxable income (taxable EBITD) if net interest expense exceeds EUR500,000. Non-related-party net interest deductible up to EUR3 million. Amended Act on the Tax Assessment Procedure Section 31 may allow tax administration to delineate transactions based on economic substance.
PCbCRStartDate: 1 June 2024. Regulations applied to fiscal years starting from 22 June 2024.
PCbCRIncomeThreshold: EUR750 million in the reporting financial year and in the financial year immediately preceding the reporting financial year.
PCbCRDataSources: The Accounting Act, Chapter 7 b; Government Degree, TEM-2024-79.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: Within one year from the end of the financial year.
PCbCRMaxPenalties: Conditional fine for failure to register PCbCR report. If not submitted within one year, ultimate parent company or subsidiary may be placed into liquidation or removed from Trade Register. Fine for intentional or gross negligent neglect, unless a more severe penalty is provided elsewhere. No penalty for minor violation.

TaxAuthority: French tax authorities (FTA) (Direction Générale des Finances Publiques, or DGFiP; formerly, Direction Générale des Impôts, or DGI)
TPLaw: Various articles of the French Tax Code (FTC) and French Procedural Tax Code (FPTC) covering arm's-length principle, related-party declarations, CbCR, tax haven transactions, CFC, thin capitalization, and TP documentation/penalties
TPSection: FTC Article 39-12; FPTC Articles L 13 AA, L 13 AB, R 13 AA-1, L 13 B, L 10; FTC Articles 57, 223 quinquies B, 223 quinquies C, 238A, 209B, 212-I, 39-1 3, 1735 ter, 1729F
BEPS13Overview: Yes, adopted BEPS Action 13. CbCR from 1 January 2016, Master File and Local File from 1 January 2018
BEPS13PenaltyProtection: Yes, with electronic financial data and reconciliation between management and statutory accounts
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneous, prepared annually (comparable searches every 3 years with annual financial updates), submitted upon tax audit request. Applicable to local branches and requires stand-alone reports for multiple entities
MaterialityThresholds: TP Documentation: Turnover > EUR400M or Gross Assets > EUR150M (or part of group meeting this). TP Statement: Turnover > EUR50M. CbCR: Consolidated revenue > EUR750M. Master File/Local File: Until FYE 2023: EUR400M annual global income or gross assets; From FYE 2024: EUR150M annual global income or gross assets (company or group). Economic Analysis: Cross-border intragroup transactions > EUR100,000 per type of transaction
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (but translation may be requested). Safe harbor for intragroup lending (legal rate). No preference for aggregation or individual testing. Local File must include reconciliation between management and statutory accounts
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: No, but the Transfer Pricing Statement (CERFA Form 2257-SD) is submitted as part of the annual tax return, or within six months after the CIT return deadline
CbCRinTaxReturn: Yes, if UPE or SPE is not in a CbCR-adopting jurisdiction or has not signed automatic exchange protocol
TaxReturnDeadline: Generally 3 months after financial year-end; 30 April for 31 December year-end
TPReturnDeadline: With the tax return, or within 6 months after the legal deadline for submitting the tax return itself
MasterFileDeadline: Upon request during tax audit (30 days, extendable to 60 days). Should be prepared before the fiscal year could be audited
CbCRDeadline: Within 12 months after the end of the financial year
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Same time as corporate tax return (generally 3 months after FYE; end of April/beginning of May for 31 Dec FYE)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Should be ready at the time of filing the CIT return
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; upon request during tax audit (30 days, extendable to 60 days)
TPMethodPreference: Yes, CUP is preferred when applicable; other OECD methods accepted if justified
LocalComparables: Yes, French comparables preferred for French tested parties; pan-European sufficient for penalty protection
SingleYearAnalysis: No, multi-year (three years) is preferred
InterquartileRange: Spreadsheet quartile range is preferred
AnnualBenchmarking: No, full update every three years if no material changes, but annual refresh of financial information is often requested
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Independence of comparables is required (legal or factual)
CompliancePenals: TP Documentation (L 13 AA/AB): greater of EUR10,000 (pre-2024) or EUR50,000 (from 2024) per FY, 5% of additional CIT, or 0.5% of non-documented transactions. CbCR: max EUR100,000. TP Statement (2257-SD): EUR150 for non-submission, EUR15 per error (min EUR60, max EUR10,000)
PenaltiesPostAudit: Reassessment leads to deemed distribution (WHT 30-75%, plus 10% penalty for non-declaration of WHT). Willful offense: 40%; Fraudulent: 80%. Late payment interest: 0.4% per month (pre-2018), 0.2% per month (from 2018). Penalty relief possible for errors before reassessment notice (reduced interest 3.36% p.a.)
TPLimitationPeriod: Generally 3 years following the year tax is due (calendar year principle). Extended by 3 years for international tax assistance, 6 years for undeclared asset transfers, and 10 years for undeclared PEs. Carry-forward losses can be audited as long as carried forward
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, typically leads to a reassessment of the French taxable base
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific legal requirement; case law is not stabilized (some allow full IQR, others median adjustment)
AuditLikelihood: Loss situations, US-headquartered technology companies, intragroup financial transactions (especially with Luxembourg). All types of intragroup transactions are subject to scrutiny
APAAvailable: Yes, bilateral, multilateral, and unilateral APAs are available
APARollback: Yes, can be requested since 2025, assessed case-by-case
MAPAvailable: Yes, generally within 3 years from first notification of non-DTT compliant taxation
ThinCapRegulations: EU ATAD-compliant rules from 1 January 2019. Net interest deductibility limited to higher of EUR3M or 30% of adjusted taxable income (regular threshold). If debt-to-equity > 1.5:1, a portion is limited to higher of EUR1M or 10% of adjusted taxable income (strengthened threshold). Safe harbor if company's D-E ratio is not >2 percentage points higher than group's
PCbCRAuthority: Court ruling (no specific authority for sanctions yet)
PCbCRIncomeThreshold: EUR750 million turnover for two consecutive years (for independent French companies or UPEs). French subsidiaries of non-EU/EEA UPEs must report if subsidiary turnover > EUR15M for two consecutive years and UPE turnover > EUR750M for two consecutive years
PCbCRMaterialityExemptions: Yes, French independent companies without foreign PEs or those disclosing similar information under banking laws are exempt
PCbCR_BEPS13Alignment: Yes, requires similar information including company name, FY, currency, activities, employees, sales, P/L before tax, income tax due/paid, retained earnings. Temporary omission for sensitive info (max 5 years) allowed, except for EU black/gray list countries
PCbCRAggregationAllowed: No, details must be provided separately for each EU/EEA State and EU black/gray list countries
PCbCRLodgmentPossible: Yes, mandatory lodgment with the clerk of the commercial court
PCbCRLodgmentOtherJurisdiction: No (but report can be made available on foreign parent's website if French company has no website)
PCbCRLodgmentFormat: Yes, electronically, with financial data in calculable format (e.g., Excel)
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: Within 12 months after the end of FY

TaxAuthority: Georgia Revenue Service (RS)
TPLaw: Articles 126 to 129 of the Georgian Tax Code (GTC) and the Instruction on Pricing International Controlled Transactions (transfer pricing instruction)
TPSection: Article 126 and Article 129 of GTC
BEPS13Overview: Jurisdiction adopted BEPS Action 13. CbCR required for MNEs with EUR750 million annual consolidated group revenue, effective 1 January 2016, no material differences from OECD format. Master File and Local File not required.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and need to be prepared contemporaneously and annually. Local branches must comply. Stand-alone reports for multiple entities are not required. Taxpayers with turnover less than GEL8 million can update external comparables every third year if no material changes.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: No threshold. CbCR: EUR750 million annual global income. Master File: Not applicable. Local File: Not applicable. Economic analysis: No threshold.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (English accepted, but Georgian translation may be requested). Safe harbor unspecified. Individual testing of transactions is preferred. No other disclosure.
TaxReturnDeadline: Monthly, by the 15th of the following month
TPReturnDeadline: Upon request by tax authority (within 30 days)
CbCRDeadline: 31 December of the year following the reporting fiscal year
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Last day of the reporting fiscal year of MNE Group
LocalFilePrepDeadline: By tax return lodgment date (finalized by time of submission upon request)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; within 30 calendar days of tax authority's request
TPMethodPreference: Yes. CUP has first priority, followed by cost-plus, resale price, TNMM, and profit-split (last resort). Traditional methods prevail over TNMM and profit-split. Other methods allowed if approved methods fail and arm's-length principle is met.
LocalComparables: Foreign comparables are acceptable due to lack of local information, but geographic and other factors' impact needs analysis and adjustments.
SingleYearAnalysis: Generally, single-year analysis is expected. Multiyear data (up to four preceding years) allowed if current year information is unavailable.
InterquartileRange: Yes, spreadsheet quartile is used as per Georgian TP rule.
AnnualBenchmarking: Yes, or update financials of prior study. Exception: Taxpayers with turnover less than GEL8 million can update every third year if no material changes.
BenchmarkingType: No specific regulation; both simple and weighted averages may be used.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: No specific regulations. Criteria must comply with general comparability factors in Instruction 6. Independence criterion is 50% or less.
CompliancePenals: Failure to furnish CbCR: GEL400. Failure to furnish Master File: GEL400. No specific penalty for non-maintenance/incomplete documentation; standard penalty for failure to submit information (GEL400, GEL1,000 for repeated violation) applies if not submitted by deadline. TP adjustment treated as distributed profit, taxed with profit tax.
PenaltiesPostAudit: If tax authorities reassess, 50% of adjusted sum. No penalty for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation. Interest not charged on penalties, but late-payment interest of 0.05% per overdue day may apply. Penalty relief possible if tax offense caused by payer's mistake/lack of knowledge.
TPLimitationPeriod: No specific statute; general statute is three years, extended by one year if less than a year remains and a claim/return is filed.
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes, especially since 2017 with the distributed profits tax model, as non-arm's-length controlled transactions are deemed profit distribution.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, an adjustment can be a consequence.
AdjustmentRegulations: Not applicable
AuditLikelihood: Not applicable
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral APA (taxpayer and RS) available. Fee: GEL30,000.
APATenure: Up to three years (with possibility of extension)
MAPAvailable: Yes, subject to applicable tax treaty provisions.
ThinCapRegulations: Order No. 331 of the Minister of Finance of Georgia of 2 October 2024 on the Amendment to Order No. 423 "On Approval of the Instructions on the Evaluation of International Controlled Transactions". Article 141 establishes criteria for requalifying a loan as a capital contribution if at least three specified criteria are met.

TaxAuthority: German Federal Central Tax Office (Bundeszentralamt für Steuern) or German state authorities
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings, including Foreign Tax Act, Corporate Income Tax Act, Income Tax Act, Growth Opportunities Act, ATAD-Umsetzungsgesetz, Abzugsteuerentlastungsmodernisierungsgesetz, FVerlV, BsGaV, German General Tax Code (AO), GAufzV, BEG IV, Section 138a AO, European Automatic Information Exchange Directive, Income Tax Disclosure Act, Minimum Tax Directive Implementation Law, Administrative Principles for Transfer Pricing (AP TP 2024, 2023, 2021, 2020), Administrative Principles on the Profit Attribution to Permanent Establishments, Guidance note on international mutual agreement and arbitration procedures
TPStartDate: Various dates depending on the specific regulation, including 1 January 2024 (financing rules), 1 January 2022 (Section 1 Foreign Tax Act updates, FVerlV), 1 January 2013 (AOA), Fiscal Years beginning after 31 December 2014 (BsGaV), tax periods starting after 31 December 2024 (BEG IV, DAC 7), 1 January 2025 (documentation requirements), Fiscal Years beginning after 31 December 2015 (CbCR), 2024 onward (AP TP 2024 for new cases)
TPSection: Sections 1, 1a, 1(2), 1(3b), 1(3c), 1(3d), 1(3e), 1(5) Foreign Tax Act; Sections 4(1), 4(1) Sentence 2, 4(1) Sentence 8 Income Tax Act; Sections 8(3) Sentence 2, 8(3) Sentence 3 Corporate Income Tax Act; Sections 90(3), 138a, 146(2c), 162(3), 162(4), 169, 170, 171, 175a, 233a, 238(1), 238(1a), 379(2) no 1c, (5) German General Tax Code; Sections 342-342p, 342b et seq., 239(4) Sentence 2 Commercial Code; Section 4h Income Tax Act; Section 8a Corporate Income Tax Act; Section 7 Foreign Tax Act; Section 14(1) Sentence 2 UStG; Section 147(2), (3) German General Tax Code
DomesticTPObligations: Yes, but no documentation obligations. General adjustment provisions apply.
OECDGuidelines: Largely, but with some differences. OECD Guidelines are used as a reference and are an integral part of AP TP 2024, but may deviate on certain topics.
BEPS13Overview: Adopted for TP documentation (Section 90(3) German General Tax Code) effective 1 Jan 2016. Requires CbCR (EUR750m threshold, effective 1 Jan 2016, no material differences from OECD format). Requires Master File (EUR100m revenue threshold, effective for FYs starting after 31 Dec 2016, some differences from OECD template, e.g., price-setting approach documentation). Requires Local File (de minimis thresholds, effective for FYs starting after 31 Dec 2016, some differences from OECD template, e.g., price-setting approach documentation).
BEPS13PenaltyProtection: No, not officially confirmed for penalty protection, and penalties can be levied transaction-by-transaction without materiality threshold.
DocRequirements: Yes, guidelines exist (Section 90(3) German General Tax Code). Extraordinary transactions require contemporaneous documentation (within 6 months after year-end). Transaction matrix, Master File, and extraordinary transaction documentation due within 30 days of audit notification or upon request. Local File due within 30 days upon request. Local branches must comply. No strict annual update requirement, but recommended. Not required to have stand-alone reports for each entity in an MNE.
