MaterialityThresholds: TP Documentation: EUR6m for goods, EUR600k for other transactions (annual consideration). CbCR: EUR750m consolidated revenue. Master File: EUR100m revenue in preceding FY. Local File: General "de minimis" thresholds (EUR6m goods, EUR600k other). Economic Analysis: No specific threshold.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (German) required, but foreign language (e.g., English) often accepted upon application. No safe harbors, but Minimum Tax Directive Implementation Law may introduce new thresholds. No preference for aggregation, but individual testing is general rule; aggregation allowed if transactions are closely connected. Transaction Matrix and DAC 6 disclosures are required.
TPReturn: No, except for an annual "auxiliary calculation" for permanent establishments.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: No, but tax return forms may include questions relevant for TP (e.g., CFC, constructive dividends, PEs).
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, for affiliated companies in consolidated financial statements (Section 285 No. 11 HGB) and under IAS 24 IFRS.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 July of the following year (non-advised); 30 April of the subsequent year (advised by tax advisor).
TPReturnDeadline: 30 days after audit order announcement (without separate request) or 30 days upon request.
MasterFileDeadline: 30 days after audit order announcement (without separate request) or 30 days upon request (since 1 Jan 2025).
CbCRDeadline: One year after the end of the respective fiscal year.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Tax return due date for the respective fiscal year.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Within six months after year-end for extraordinary transactions; no contemporaneous requirement for ordinary transactions.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: 30 days upon request by tax auditors or after receiving a tax audit announcement (since 1 Jan 2025).
TPMethodPreference: No, the method best suitable to the comparability analysis and data availability is preferred.
LocalComparables: Yes, local benchmarks are preferred, but European benchmarks are accepted if local ones are unavailable.
SingleYearAnalysis: Yes, single-year testing is preferred, but multiyear analyses are often accepted.
InterquartileRange: Yes, the interquartile range is suggested by Section 1 (3a) Sentence 3 of the Foreign Tax Act if no other narrowing method is indicated.
AnnualBenchmarking: No legal requirement, but a fresh search is recommended every three years, and a financial update annually.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Exclude companies with common shareholder owning >=25% shares and own subsidiaries with >=25% share.
CompliancePenals: CbCR: EUR10,000. Master File: EUR5,000. Insufficient/unusable TP documentation or non-submission of transaction matrix: 5-10% of income adjustment (min EUR5,000). Late filing: up to EUR1 million (min EUR100/day). Failure to provide documents timely upon request: up to EUR250,000 (Section 146(2c) German General Tax Code).
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, for incomplete/unusable/non-contemporaneous documentation: 5-10% of income adjustment (min EUR5,000), up to EUR1 million for late filing (min EUR100/day), up to EUR250,000 for untimely document provision. Burden of proof shifts to taxpayer, allowing adjustment to most unfavorable point. Interest charged on additional tax payments (1.8% p.a. from 1 Jan 2019), not on penalties. No penalty relief, but compliant documentation before court ruling can avoid refutable assumption.
TPLimitationPeriod: Yes, Section 1 (3a) Sentence 3 Foreign Tax Act suggests using the interquartile range for narrowing. If the taxpayer's value is outside the range, the arithmetic mean is assumed to be arm's-length unless the taxpayer proves otherwise. If no or insufficient documentation, authorities can adjust to the most unfavorable point within the arm's-length range.
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes, companies with long-term losses, business restructurings, transactions with low-tax jurisdictions, or significant intercompany financing transactions.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, bilateral or multilateral APAs are available (Section 89a German General Tax Code). Unilateral APAs are generally not granted if a DTT with MAP exists. Fees apply (e.g., EUR30,000 for new TP APA).
AdjustmentRegulations: 3 to 5 years, but can be longer in practice. Process takes 18 months to several years.
AuditLikelihood: No automatic roll-back. Section 89a(1) German General Tax Code states APAs cover transactions not yet realized.
APAAvailable: Yes, available under DTTs, EU Arbitration Convention, or EU Directive on Tax Dispute Resolution Mechanisms. Request must be made within three years of first notification.
APATenure: German Zinsschranke (interest barrier rules) - Section 4h Income Tax Act and Section 8a Corporate Income Tax Act. German CFC Rules - Section 7 Foreign Tax Act.
MAPAvailable: Bundeszentralamt für Steuern (BZSt – German Federal Central Tax Office)
ThinCapRegulations: Directive (EU) 2021/2101, Sections 342-342p German Commercial Code.
PCbCRApplies: Fiscal years beginning on or after 22 June 2024.
PCbCRStartDate: Yes, consolidated sales revenues must exceed EUR750 million in two consecutive FYs. Domestic registered branches of non-EU companies have a EUR12 million sales threshold. Credit institutions are exempt if information is already disclosed.
PCbCRSection: No, EU terminology may not align with Action 13 terminology unless the group chooses to publish DAC4-corresponding information.
PCbCR_BEPS13Alignment: Yes, lodgment (retention) is possible and regulated by tax and commercial law (e.g., Section 147 German General Tax Code).
PCbCRAggregationAllowed: Yes, with permission from the competent tax authority for electronic records (Section 146(2a) German General Tax Code). Otherwise, documents generally must be kept in Germany.
PCbCRDataSources: Yes, documents must remain readable throughout the retention period. Electronic storage is allowed if it complies with proper accounting principles, ensures visual and content correspondence, and allows immediate readability and machine evaluation (Section 147(2) German General Tax Code).
PCbCRLodgmentPossible: 10-year retention period for books, records, financial statements, etc. (Section 147(2),(3) German General Tax Code). 6-year retention period for other business documents. Period begins at the end of the calendar year of creation/last entry.
PCbCRLodgmentFormat: Yes, depends on facts and circumstances.

TaxAuthority: Ghana Revenue Authority (GRA)
TPLaw: Transfer Pricing Regulations, 2020, L.I. 2412
TPSection: Section 31 and 128 of the Income Tax Act 2015, Act 896; Regulation 1 of the Transfer Pricing Regulations, 2020, L.I. 2412
BEPS13Overview: Yes, Ghana has implemented BEPS Action 13, including CbCR, Master File, and Local File. CbCR threshold is GHS2.9 billion. Local File has a specific markup for low-value services.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation must be prepared contemporaneously and annually. Local branches and MNE entities require compliance.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: USD200,000 (value of international transactions). CbCR: GHS2.9 billion (annual global income). Master File: USD200,000. Local File: USD200,000. Economic analysis: USD200,000.
SpecificRequirements: English language required. Safe harbors for transactions < USD200,000, low-value services (markup <= 3%), and registered technology transfer agreements (royalties/fees <= 2% of net profit). Individual testing preferred. Annual Transfer Pricing Return required.
TaxReturnDeadline: Four months after the end of the year of assessment (financial year)
TPReturnDeadline: Four months after the end of the year of assessment (financial year)
MasterFileDeadline: Four months after the end of the year of assessment (financial year)
CbCRDeadline: 12 months after the last day of the reporting fiscal year of the MNE group
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Not applicable, no CbCR notification is required.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Four months after the end of each basis period
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Four months after the end of each basis period. For periods prior to Nov 2020, 14 days upon request.
LocalComparables: No legal requirement, but comparables from similar economies are acceptable.
SingleYearAnalysis: Not specified, multiyear analysis commonly used.
InterquartileRange: Three-year interquartile range is preferred.
AnnualBenchmarking: No legal requirement, updated on a three-year basis in practice.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance/incomplete documentation: 75% of tax attributable (deliberate) or lesser of 75% and 250 currency points (other cases). Failure to furnish CbCR/Master File: GHS500 + GHS10/day. Late submission: GHS500 + GHS10/day. Incorrect disclosures: 100% of tax shortfall (no reasonable excuse) or 30% (other cases).
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, up to 75% of tax payable if documentation is incomplete or non-contemporaneous. Interest is charged on outstanding amounts at 125% of statutory rate. Penalty relief possible for voluntary disclosure of inadvertent errors.
TPLimitationPeriod: Six years from financial year-end; no limit for fraud, wilful default, or serious omission.
AdjustmentRegulations: Interquartile range must be considered an arm’s-length range.
AuditLikelihood: Not applicable
APARollback: Yes, where an effective double tax agreement exists.
MAPAvailable: Debt-to-equity ratio exceeds 3:1 (for interest-bearing or foreign currency-denominated debt to non-resident parent). Interest deductions/exchange losses on excess debt are disallowed.
ThinCapRegulations: No

TaxAuthority: Commissioner of Income Tax, Income Tax Office
TPLaw: Anti-avoidance provisions referring to OECD TP Guidelines; 'Artificial and fictitious' definition
TPSection: Income Tax Act 2010 Sections 40(3)(c), 74
BEPS13Overview: Gibraltar has not adopted or implemented BEPS Action 13 for TP documentation. However, CbCR is required.
DocRequirements: No
MaterialityThresholds: No materiality limit for TP documentation or economic analysis. CbCR threshold is EUR750 million annual global income.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement. Safe harbor available (deduction for non-arm's length expenses restricted to lower of 5% gross turnover or 75% net profit before expenses). No preference for aggregation or individual testing.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Generally required by applicable accounting standards, not specific tax legislation.
TaxReturnDeadline: Nine months after the end of the month in which the fiscal year ends (e.g., 30 September for December year-end)
CbCRDeadline: 12 months after the relevant financial year (e.g., 31 December for December year-end)
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Nine months after the fiscal year-end (e.g., 30 September for December year-end)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Authorities may impose a deadline of 30 days (or more) upon request.
LocalComparables: There is none specified.
SingleYearAnalysis: There is none specified.
InterquartileRange: There is none specified.
AnnualBenchmarking: There is none specified.
CompliancePenals: Initial penalty of £300 for CbCR notification-return failure, then up to £60 per day, increasing to £1,000 per day after 30 days. Up to £3,000 for inaccurate CbCR information. General tax underpayment surcharges- 10% immediately, further 20% after 90 days.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No specific penalties if documentation is deemed incomplete or non-contemporaneous. No interest charged on penalties or payable on refund. Penalty relief possible for CbCR with reasonable excuse or at Commissioner's discretion.
TPLimitationPeriod: One year from return receipt for inquiry notice. Up to six years from end of relevant accounting period for assessment upon discovery of under-assessment. 20 years for fraudulent or willful default-neglect.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Not applicable, as formal audits are very rare.
AdjustmentRegulations: There is none specified.
AuditLikelihood: There is none specified.
APAAvailable: Yes, taxpayers may request advance tax rulings under Income Tax (Tax Rulings) Rules 2018.
MAPAvailable: Yes, with the United Kingdom (Gibraltar's only DTA).
ThinCapRegulations: Interest deemed dividend if debt-to-equity exceeds 5-1 and paid to connected non-company party, or if paid to arm's-length party with loan secured by connected non-company party's assets. Interest limitation rule- exceeding interest expense deductible up to greater of 30% EBITDA or EUR3 million.

TaxAuthority: Ministry of Finance
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings, including L. 4172/2013, L. 4174/2013, Circular POL 1142/2015, Decisions 1097/2014, 1144/2014, 1107/2023, and L. 4484/2017
TPSection: Income Tax Code (L. 4172/2013, Article 2), Circular 1142/2015, Circular 1049/2019
BEPS13Overview: Greece adopted the three-tier approach (Master File, Local File, CbCR) as per BEPS Action 13, with some local specificities and differences from OECD templates
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously, annually. Local branches must comply. Stand-alone reports for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP Doc: EUR200k (turnover > EUR5m) or EUR100k (turnover < EUR5m) intercompany transactions. CbCR: EUR750m global consolidated income. Master File: Same as TP Doc. Local File: Same as TP Doc. Economic Analysis: No specific threshold, all transactions (except tax-adjusted expenses) must be documented.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Greek) required for submission and Local File. No safe harbor. Individual testing preferred.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 June
MasterFileDeadline: Within 30 days upon tax authorities’ request
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within 30 days upon tax authority request
TPMethodPreference: Yes. Traditional transaction methods are preferred; transactional profit methods are allowed only if traditional methods are ineffective due to lack of comparables, with detailed justification.
LocalComparables: Pan-European benchmarking studies are accepted; local studies advisable if Greek entity is tested party.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear analysis (weighted-average financial data of comparables for three preceding financial years) is legally required for interquartile range calculation. Tested party's results refer to one year.
InterquartileRange: Yes, the arm’s-length range is the interquartile range, calculated using the spreadsheet formula.
AnnualBenchmarking: Comparable data can be used for two consecutive financial years, but financial data must be annually updated and compliance with comparability-independence requirements examined annually.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Independence criteria (33% shareholding-subsidiary, common management control), minimum five comparables, specific quartile formula, use of reasonably available information, database restrictions, profit margins based on local tax legislation.
CompliancePenals: Failure to provide TP documentation: EUR5k (30 days), EUR10k (60 days), EUR20k (90 days-not provided). Non-filing CbCR: EUR20k. Late-inaccurate CbCR: EUR10k. Late SIT: 0.1% of transactions (min EUR500, max EUR2k). Inaccurate SIT: 0.1% of inaccurate amounts (min EUR500, max EUR2k, no penalty if <10% difference). Non-filing SIT: 0.1% of transactions (min EUR2.5k, max EUR10k).
PenaltiesPostAudit: No specific penalty for incomplete-non-contemporaneous documentation unless deemed non-submission. Interest charged on late tax payment (8.76% annually). No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Six years following year-end (for financial year 2019 and onward)
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, an adjustment to taxable profits, general income tax inaccuracy penalties (10%-50% of tax underpayment), and default interest.
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific provisions, but common practice for tax authorities to request adjustments to the median of the interquartile range.
AuditLikelihood: None specified.
APAAvailable: Yes
APARollback: Yes, retroactive effect is possible for bilateral-multilateral APAs, covering all open Fiscal Years (excluding those under tax audit).
ThinCapRegulations: GITC (L. 4172/2013, Art. 49, amended by L. 4607/2019) limits exceeding borrowing costs deduction to 30% of EBITDA, with a EUR3m full deductibility threshold. Indefinite carry-forward.
PCbCR_BEPS13Alignment: Yes, aligns with OECD BEPS Action 13, requiring disclosure of specific financial and activity data.
PCbCRDataSources: Art. 7 par. 6 of Law 5066/2023 provides for data to be reported separately and data allowed to be aggregated.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: Within 12 months of the closing date of the financial year for which the Public Report is drawn up, and remain publicly accessible indefinitely.
PCbCRMaxPenalties: Fines ranging from EUR10,000 to EUR100,000 for management, administrative bodies, and legal representatives of branches.

TaxAuthority: Tax Administration Superintendence (Superintendencia de Administración Tributaria — SAT)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings, including Articles 54-67 of LAT/TLU, Articles 37-66 of TLU Regulations, and 2016 technical guidelines.
TPSection: Articles 54 to 67 of LAT or Tax Legislation Update (TLU) (Ley de Actualización Tributaria — Decree No. 10- 2012) and Articles 37 to 66 of the TLU Regulations No. 213- 2013.
BEPS13Overview: No. It has not been formally implemented in the transfer pricing legislation. However, in October 2016, the tax authorities published transfer pricing technical guidelines that refer to BEPS initiatives such as the Master File requirement as part of the transfer pricing documentation.
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: No
SpecificRequirements: According to Article 369 of the Guatemalan Commerce Code, accounting must be kept in Spanish. In addition, even when the transfer pricing regulations do not expressly state this as mandatory, the Law of the Judicial Branch, in its Article 37, provides that all documents proceeding from abroad that have been prepared in a foreign language should be translated to be fully effective in Guatemala prior to being filed before any governmental entity. Individual testing of transactions is preferred, if possible.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes. Usually, information of type of intercompany transactions, amount and name of the related party is included in the audited financial statements. This information must be consistent with the information disclosed in the rest of the TP disclosures of information.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 March
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: The taxpayer needs to submit the transfer pricing documentation within 20 days once requested by the tax authorities.
TPMethodPreference: Yes. Acceptable transfer pricing methods are the CUP, resale price, cost-plus, profit-split, TNMM, and the imports and exports valuation method (the “sixth method”). The CUP, resale price and cost-plus methods take priority over the transactional methods. In addition, the sixth method is preferred for transactions involving imports or exports of goods with well-known prices in international markets.
LocalComparables: There is no benchmarking requirement using local comparable companies because of the lack of publicly available financial information.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear testing is preferred for the comparables; in practice, the number of years is three.
InterquartileRange: Spreadsheet quartile is preferred, as per common practice.
AnnualBenchmarking: The transfer pricing report and return must be prepared annually, updating all the information that allows a correct transfer pricing analysis. Additionally, in practice, local tax authorities expect to see the most recent comparable information and to use the most recent available financial information for the comparables and the tested party.
BenchmarkingType: The weighted average, as per common practice, is preferred.
CompliancePenals: The tax authorities can request the taxpayers to complete information by formal requests since as of today, there are no specific penalties in the Guatemalan Law for incomplete documentation. According to Article 66 of the Regulations to the TLU, penalties for failure to comply with the transfer pricing obligations correspond to the general tax penalties. According to Article 94 (13) of the Tax Code, penalties for failure to present the transfer pricing documentation upon request of the tax authority would be GTQ5,000 for the first time, GTQ10,000 for the second time and GTQ10,000 plus 1% of the taxpayer’s gross income from then on. Additionally, if the taxpayer does not comply with the submission of the requested transfer pricing information, the tax authorities generally apply the fine provided in Article 93 of the Tax Code regarding the tax offense involving refusing to cooperate with the requirements performed within a tax audit process. Penalties imposed may consist of fines or eventually lead to closure of the business. In addition, any additional tax generated by price adjustments made by the SAT is subject to surcharges and penalty interest.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, in case of incorrect compliance- A fine equivalent to 100% of the tax due- Late payment interest defined by the SAT- GTQ100 (approximately USD12.90) as a formal fine for the rectification (applicable for the transfer pricing return). Penalties can be reduced up to 85% for the failure to submit documentation (only for the first time) if the omission is corrected by the taxpayer. When the taxpayer accepts the errors in the determination of tax liability, before the tax authorities pre-grant a hearing, the taxpayer must pay the resulting tax and interest payments with a discount of 40% and penalty for late payment reduced by 80%, provided it makes the payment within the next five days from the date of issue of the administrative record (Section 145 “A” Tax Code). However, upon the letter of determination issued by the tax authorities, the fine equal to 100% of the omitted tax may be reduced as follows (Section 46 Tax Code)- If the payment is made at the administrative hearing granted by the tax authorities, a 75% discount should be granted.- If the payment is made before filing for an administrative appeal, a 50% discount should be granted.- If the payment is made before filing a claim before the Tax Court, a 25% discount should be granted. According to the local tax code, taxpayers may express their disagreement with the position taken by tax authorities. In the first stage, the administrative procedure is available prior to the judicial process.
TPLimitationPeriod: The statute of limitations on assessments is four years from the date of filing the tax return.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, in most audits where the SAT challenges either the methodology or the comparables, the possibility of an adjustment may be considered to be high.
AdjustmentRegulations: According to Article 47of the TLU Regulations, if the results of a controlled transaction fall outside the arm’s-length range, the tax authorities will perform and adjustment to the median of such range.
AuditLikelihood: Taxpayers that have not complied with previous transfer pricing obligations, experiencing losses, effective tax rate low or equal to zero, and transactions regarding the import and export of commodities are more likely to be audited.
APAAvailable: APAs are contemplated in Article 63 of the TLU. Taxpayers can request an APA for a maximum of four years. The procedures for establishing an APA are established in Articles 57 to 63 of the Regulations to the TLU.
APATenure: The term could be as long as four years.
ThinCapRegulations: Not applicable
PCbCRCriminalRisk: Not applicable / Not applicable / Not applicable / Not applicable / No

TaxAuthority: Guinean Revenue Authorities (Direction Générale des Impôts - DGI)
TPLaw: General Tax Code (GTC) Articles 117 and Article 23 of Finance Law N°L/ 2018/ 069/AN
TPSection: Title 1, Direct Taxes - Division 1 - Chapter 2 - Section 2 - Paragraph 5
BEPS13Overview: Content of TP regulations largely based on BEPS Action 13 provisions
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist, must be prepared contemporaneously and annually, local branches must comply, stand-alone reports required for multiple entities
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Turnover or gross assets > GNF250 billion. Master File/Local File: Turnover or gross assets > GNF250 billion. Economic analysis: Transactions > GNF1 billion. CbCR: Not applicable.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (French) and electronic format required. No safe harbor. No preference for aggregation/individual testing.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 April
MasterFileDeadline: No submission deadline; must be available by 31 July and provided upon request.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: By 31 July (same as Master File availability)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; 30 days upon request.
LocalComparables: Preferred, but not specified
SingleYearAnalysis: No guidance provided
InterquartileRange: No guidance provided
AnnualBenchmarking: No guidance provided
CompliancePenals: Fine of 1% of transactions (min GNF100 million) for non-availability; 10% increase on reassessed amounts if rectified.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Deemed distribution of benefit leading to CIT (25-35%) and WHT (15%) on reassessed amounts. No penalty for non-contemporaneous documentation. No interest on penalties. Penalty relief not available.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years
AdjustmentRegulations: Not specified
AuditLikelihood: Large companies in telecommunications, oil and gas, mining, financial institutions, insurance.
APAAvailable: Not applicable
ThinCapRegulations: No specific thin capitalization rules, but limitations on interest deductibility: interest rate capped to BCRG rate, fully paid share capital, loan amount not to exceed share capital (not usually applied), and under 2019 Finance Act, interest deductibility limited to 15% of restated income for related companies.
PCbCRCriminalRisk: No / No / Not applicable / Not applicable

TaxAuthority: Tax Administration of Honduras (Servicio de Administración de Rentas - SAR)
TPLaw: Various Transfer Pricing Decrees, Agreements, and Tax Code Articles
TPSection: Various Transfer Pricing Decrees, Agreements, and Tax Code Articles
DomesticTPObligations: Yes - Through Article 113 of Decree No. 170- 2016 and in effect since 2017, the obligation to document domestic related-party transactions is repealed except those transactions carried out with domestic (related or not) entities established under a special tax regime. However, domestic related-party transactions must be informed annually in the transfer pricing informative return.
OECDGuidelines: Limited - Honduras is not a member of the OECD. The OECD Guidelines can be relied upon for interpretation of the rules, as long as they do not contradict the Honduran tax system; however, local transfer pricing regulations prevail.
BEPS13Overview: No, regarding Local File and Master File; only CbCR. CbCR applies to UPEs or Constituent Entities resident in Honduras with consolidated revenue >= €750m (or equivalent in HNL as of Jan 2015), effective for reporting tax years from 1 January 2025. No material differences from OECD format. Master File and Local File are not required.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation must be prepared annually and submitted upon request. Local branches of foreign companies must comply. Stand-alone reports are required for MNEs with multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: No financial threshold. CbCR: Consolidated revenue >= €750m (or equivalent in HNL as of Jan 2015) based on annual global income. Master File/Local File/Economic analysis: Not applicable/No financial threshold.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Spanish) required. No safe harbor. Individual testing of transactions preferred.
TPReturn: Yes - An information return on the transactions conducted with related parties should be filed annually.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: Yes - Taxpayers must report on the income tax return whether they conducted transactions with related parties and disclose the total amount of such related-party transactions, indicating whether they are assets, liabilities, income or expense items. However, the transfer pricing return is a separate form from the corporate income tax return.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Usually, information of type of intercompany transactions, amount and name of the related party is included in the audited financial statements. This information must be consistent with the information disclosed in the rest of the TP disclosures of information.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 April (for fiscal years ending Dec 31); within three months after fiscal year-end (for special fiscal years).
TPReturnDeadline: 30 April (for fiscal years ending Dec 31); within three months after fiscal year-end (for special fiscal years).
CbCRDeadline: No later than 12 months from the last day of the multinational group’s reporting tax year.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: No later than 31 December of the reporting tax year of the multinational group.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Upon request of the tax authorities (within ten days).
TPMethodPreference: Yes - Application of the most appropriate method. Specified methods are CUP (including 'sixth method'), resale price, cost-plus, profit-split, TNMM, and other alternative methods (with SAR approval).
LocalComparables: No, international comparables are accepted due to lack of local financial information.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiple-year testing (up to five years) is acceptable for comparables; in practice, three years.
InterquartileRange: Yes - Interquartile range calculation using spreadsheet quartile formulas is requested by regulations.
AnnualBenchmarking: Yes - A fresh benchmarking search vs. a financial update needs to be conducted every year. Most recent comparable information and financial information for comparables and tested party are expected.
BenchmarkingType: Weighted average is preferred, as per common practice.
CompliancePenals: Failure to provide information or providing false, incomplete or inaccurate information: USD10,000. Reporting taxable income less than arm's-length: 15% on income adjustment. Failure to provide correct information AND declare correct taxable income: greater of 30% or USD20,000. Failure to comply with other TP Law provisions: USD5,000. CbCR non-submission/false/incomplete/late: USD10,000. CbCR notification non-submission/late: per Tax Code Article 160.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, penalties apply if documentation is deemed incomplete or non-contemporaneous (same penalties as 8a). Interest applies on income adjustments (3% monthly, up to 36%). Penalty relief is available (50%, 30%, 10% reductions based on rectification timing, plus 20% for small taxpayers).
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years, extendable with amended return.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes - If the margin or price is below the interquartile range, the adjustment should be made to the median of such range (Article 21 of Executive Decree No. 027- 2015).
AuditLikelihood: Any intercompany transaction, industry, and situation. Historically, SAR focused on services transactions (questioning rendering, need, allocation, benefit).
APAAvailable: Yes, contemplated but corresponding regulations not yet enacted.
ThinCapRegulations: Not applicable

TaxAuthority: Inland Revenue Department (IRD)
TPLaw: Inland Revenue (Amendment) (No. 6) Ordinance 2018, Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112), various Departmental Interpretation and Practice Notes (DIPNs)
TPStartDate: Staggered: 1 Jan 2018 (CbCR), 1 Apr 2018 (Master File, Local File), years of assessment from 1 Apr 2018 (FTPR, APAs)
TPSection: Sections 50AAC to 50AAO, Sections 58B to 58O and Schedule 17I of the IRO
BEPS13Overview: Yes, adopted OECD's recommended three-tiered documentation structure (Master File, Local File, CbCR) via the Amendment Ordinance. No material differences from OECD format.
DocRequirements: Yes, guidelines exist; documentation must be prepared contemporaneously and annually. Local branches must comply. Stand-alone reports are required for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Yes, based on business size (any two of: total revenue > HKD400m, total assets > HKD300m, avg employees > 100) OR related-party transaction volume (e.g., properties > HKD220m, financial assets > HKD110m, intangibles > HKD110m, other > HKD44m). Domestic transactions exempted. CbCR: HKD6.8 billion annual global income for Hong Kong UPEs. Master File: Refer to TP documentation thresholds. Local File: Refer to TP documentation thresholds. Economic analysis: Refer to TP documentation thresholds.
SpecificRequirements: Local language: No (English or Chinese accepted). Safe harbor: Unspecified. No safe harbor rules due to FTPR, but domestic transactions meeting certain conditions are exempted from FTPR adjustment. Aggregation: No preference, consistent with OECD Guidelines, case-by-case. Other disclosure: No.
CbCRinTaxReturn: Separately filed, but compliance confirmed in tax returns.
TaxReturnDeadline: One month from profits tax return issue date (extensions available, e.g., 15 Aug, 15 Sep, 15 Nov, 15 Dec, 31 Jan depending on accounting date).
TPReturnDeadline: One month from profits tax return issue date (for S2). Form IR 1475 within one month upon request.
MasterFileDeadline: No submission deadline. Prepared within nine months after year-end, submitted upon request.
CbCRDeadline: Within 12 months after the end of the ultimate parent entity’s accounting period.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Within three months after the end of the ultimate parent entity’s accounting period.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Nine months after the end of the Hong Kong entity’s accounting period.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Typically 30 days upon request (extensions available).
TPMethodPreference: Yes. Most appropriate method, traditional transaction methods preferred but profit methods accepted if traditional methods are not comparable or reliable.
LocalComparables: Quality over quantity. DIPN 59 suggests Hong Kong comparables first. If not applicable, overseas data from closest reference jurisdictions accepted.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiple-year data is considered useful.
InterquartileRange: Use of ranges, such as an interquartile range, would be accepted.
AnnualBenchmarking: Financials updated every year, new searches every three years.
BenchmarkingType: Weighted average data for each comparable, based on most recent three to five years.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance-non-furnishing-incomplete furnishing (Master File-Local File): Fine at level 5 (HKD50,000) - court order. Escalates to level 6 (HKD100,000) for non-compliance with court order. Failure to furnish CbCR: HKD50,000. Failure to furnish Master File: HKD50,000. Other penalties: Failure to file-notify CbCR without reasonable excuse: HKD50,000 - HKD500-day - court order; HKD100,000 for non-compliance with court order. Misleading-false-inaccurate CbCR: HKD50,000. Willful intent: HKD10,000 fine - 6 months imprisonment (summary) or HKD50,000 fine - 3 years imprisonment (indictment). Applies to directors-officers. Broader corporate tax penalties also apply.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Incomplete documentation: Yes, limited to tax undercharged. Non-contemporaneous documentation: Yes, limited to tax undercharged. Interest charged: No on penalties. May be interest on unconditional holdover of tax in dispute. Penalty relief: No, but scale depends on nature of TP treatment and effort. Documented TP treatment with reasonable efforts results in Nil penalty. Domestic objection-appeal and MAP available.
TPLimitationPeriod: Six years after the end of the assessment year. 10 years for fraud or willful evasion.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, an adjustment. Possibility of adjustment is medium to high if complex, lengthy, material, or if taxpayer fails to provide sufficient-timely information.
AdjustmentRegulations: Only upward adjustments to increase assessable profits or decrease allowable losses. Downward adjustments only under corresponding relief or MAP. No specific guidance on which data point for upward adjustment.
AuditLikelihood: Fluctuating profit margins, heavily qualified accounts, unreasonably low profits-turnover, persistent delays-omissions in filing, poor record maintenance, or unprovided information.
APAAvailable: Yes
ThinCapRegulations: No thin capitalization rule.

TaxAuthority: National Tax and Customs Administration (Nemzeti Adó- és Vámhivatal - NTCA)
TPLaw: Section 18 of the Act on Corporate Tax and Dividend Tax, Correction of Prices Applied Among Affiliated Companies
TPSection: Section 4. 23 of the Act on Corporate Tax and Dividend Tax defining 'affiliated company' and related provisions, including specific participation thresholds for certain sections
BEPS13Overview: BEPS Action 13 has been implemented for transfer pricing documentation in Hungary. CbCR, Master File, and Local File are required, effective 1 January 2018.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneous, annual, for local branches and stand-alone entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation, Master File, Local File, Economic analysis: HUF100 million (approx. EUR250,000) based on volume of intercompany transactions. CbCR: EUR750 million annual global income.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (English, German, French accepted, others require attested translation). Safe harbor for low value-added services. No preference for aggregation or individual testing.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 May
MasterFileDeadline: 31 May (if Hungarian ultimate parent); otherwise, no later than 12 months after year-end
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; upon request, no extra time is provided after CIT return deadline.
LocalComparables: Yes, preferred in APA practice and expected by tax authority. Geographic criteria can be extended to V4, then Eastern Europe and EU27 if local comparables are insufficient.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear analysis is preferred.
InterquartileRange: Yes, mandatory since 2015. No specific formula, Excel 'quartile' function accepted. Adjustment to median if outside range.
AnnualBenchmarking: New search every three years, financial update for other two years. New search for financing transactions annually.
BenchmarkingType: Simple average preferred, pooled method preferred (every data is a separate observation).
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance/non-furnishing/incomplete documentation: up to HUF5 million (repeated up to HUF10 million, further repeated 4x higher). Failure to furnish CbCR: up to HUF20 million. Failure to furnish Master File: same as documentation penalties.
PenaltiesPostAudit: If TP adjustment assessed: tax penalty (generally 50% of tax shortage) plus late payment interest (Hungarian National Bank base rate + 5 percentage points). Penalty relief possible (50% of tax penalty) if appeal waived and tax difference paid.
TPLimitationPeriod: Last day of the fifth calendar year from the tax year in which taxes should have been declared/reported/paid. Possible adjustment beyond this under Arbitration Convention.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, almost certainly includes an adjustment. NTCA challenges profitability testing, unusual conclusions, unusual methods, and unique transactions.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, from 2022, if actual return falls outside interquartile range, TP adjustment to the median must be made in CIT return.
AuditLikelihood: Automotive sector, high-risk transactions, loss-making/minimal profit routine activities. Related party loans (especially if purpose questionable, may be reclassified as equity).
APAAvailable: Yes
APATenure: Three to five years, extendable for a further three years.
ThinCapRegulations: Interest limitation rules (Council Directive (EU) 2016/1164) apply: net financing costs deductible up to higher of 30% of tax-EBITDA or HUF939,810,000 (approx. USD2.6 million). Carry forward for 5 years. Exemptions for financial institutions, etc.
PCbCRRegulations: Chapter VI/B of Act C of 2000 on Accounting
PCbCRStartDate: For financial years starting on or after 22 June 2024
PCbCRSection: Paragraph (88) of Section 177 of Act C of 2000 on Accounting
PCbCRIncomeThreshold: Hungarian-based MNEs: HUF275 billion for each of last two financial years. Non-Hungarian-based MNEs: EUR750 million for each of last two financial years.
PCbCRLodgmentPossible: Yes, for all EU 27 Member States and separately for non-cooperative jurisdictions (Annex I and II of Council conclusions).
PCbCRLodgmentFormat: Yes, common template and electronic machine-readable formats as laid down by the European Commission.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: At the same time as the consolidated annual account (for ultimate parent companies) or annual financial statements (for standalone companies).
PCbCRMaxPenalties: Not yet specified. Collective responsibility for administrative, management, and supervisory bodies.

TaxAuthority: Directorate General of Taxes (DGT)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings, notably PMK 172/2023
TPSection: Refer to section 1b.
BEPS13Overview: Yes, CbCR, Master File, Local File required. CbCR threshold EUR750M/IDR11T. Material differences from OECD format for Master/Local File.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously prepared, submitted upon request within 30 days. Required annually for local branches and stand-alone for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: Yes, gross revenues > IDR50 billion or transactions with related parties in low-tax jurisdictions. If gross revenue < IDR50 billion, then > IDR20 billion for tangible goods or > IDR5 billion for services, interest, intangibles, or other affiliated transactions.
SpecificRequirements: Yes, local language (Bahasa Indonesia) for Local/Master File. Individual testing preferred. No safe harbor.
TaxReturnDeadline: Four months after fiscal year-end (e.g., 30 April for 31 December year-end).
TPReturnDeadline: Four months after fiscal year-end (e.g., 30 April for 31 December year-end), attached to CITR.
MasterFileDeadline: Available within four months after fiscal year-end (e.g., 30 April for 31 December year-end) and needs to be submitted along with Local File upon request from tax office.
CbCRDeadline: 12 months after year-end (e.g., 31 December for 31 December year-end).
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Four months after fiscal year-end (e.g., 30 April for 31 December year-end).
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; 30 days upon tax authority request.
LocalComparables: Yes, companies in the same location as tested party.
SingleYearAnalysis: Yes, but multiyear accepted with specific support.
InterquartileRange: Yes, depends on number of comparables. Microsoft Excel calculation commonly used.
AnnualBenchmarking: Yes
BenchmarkingType: Weighted average preferred for multiyear analysis.
CompliancePenals: Deemed arm’s-length outcomes, interest penalties on unpaid taxes, administrative penalties on incorrect disclosures, secondary adjustments, VAT adjustments.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, interest rate penalties on underpayment (max 24 months, uplift factor 20% possible). Interest compensation for refunds. Penalty relief not available for primary regime.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years, extended to 10 years for tax fraud/crime.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, adjustment to any point in interquartile range; median if difficult to justify.
AuditLikelihood: No
APAAvailable: Yes
APATenure: Up to five years forward, with five-year roll-back.
ThinCapRegulations: Minister of Finance Regulation (2015) prescribes maximum debt-to-equity ratio of 4:1 (effective 2016) for Indonesian-resident companies. Non-deductibility of interest for breaches or nil/negative equity. Foreign loans must be reported; non-reporting forfeits interest deductibility. Arm's length interest rates required. Income tax law also requires arm's length debt-to-equity ratio, but no implementation regulation yet.

TaxAuthority: Revenue Commissioners (RC)
TPLaw: Taxes Consolidation Act 1997 (Part 35, Sections 835A-835HB) and 2022 OECD Transfer Pricing Guidelines
TPSection: Taxes Consolidation Act 1997, Part 35A, Sections 835A-835HB
BEPS13Overview: Ireland has adopted BEPS Action 13, implementing Master File, Local File, and CbCR requirements. Master File threshold: EUR250m consolidated revenue. Local File threshold: EUR50m consolidated revenue. CbCR threshold: EUR750m consolidated revenue. Deadlines align with corporate tax return for MF-LF, 12 months after year-end for CbCR, and year-end for CbCR notification.
BEPS13PenaltyProtection: Yes, if prepared on time, submitted within 30 days of request, and demonstrates reasonable efforts to comply.
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: SME exemption (fewer than 250 employees AND <EUR50m revenue or <EUR43m balance sheet). Local File: EUR50m group turnover. Master File: EUR250m group turnover. CbCR: EUR750m annual global income.
SpecificRequirements: Documentation in English or Irish. Safe harbor for low-value-adding services. Individual testing of transactions preferred. Other disclosures required.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, related-party disclosures are set out in financial statements outlining the related parties and intercompany transactions.
TaxReturnDeadline: 23rd day of the ninth month after year-end.
TPReturnDeadline: Not applicable. There is no separate transfer pricing return.
MasterFileDeadline: Not applicable (submission); 23rd day of the ninth month after year-end (preparation).
CbCRDeadline: One year after the year-end date.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: The last day of the financial year to which it relates.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: 23rd day of the ninth month after year-end.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; 30 days upon request.
LocalComparables: No legal requirement for local jurisdiction comparables; pan-European comparables are accepted. Common practice is to include the EU27, other countries that have access to the Single Market and the UK.
SingleYearAnalysis: Three-year testing is a common practice in Ireland for benchmarking purposes; however, the tested party will be tested upon single-year results.
InterquartileRange: The full range may be potentially acceptable under specific circumstances. However, the interquartile range is commonly used, and justification to use the full range would be expected by the Revenue Commissioners.
AnnualBenchmarking: For a TNMM benchmarking, in general, Irish Revenue will expect a full benchmarking study every three years and for the financials of the accepted comparables to be updated or refreshed on an annual basis.
BenchmarkingType: Based on experience, there is a preference for the weighted average for arm’s-length analysis.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: The usual pan-European criteria are accepted; companies with unknown ownership are generally not accepted.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance/incomplete documentation: loss of penalty protection. Failure to furnish CbCR: EUR19,045 + EUR2,535/day. Failure to furnish MF/LF upon request (30 days): EUR25,000 + EUR100/day.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Incomplete documentation: Yes (risk of fine, loss of penalty protection for careless behavior). Non-contemporaneous: Yes (loss of penalty protection). Interest: No (but interest on underpaid tax applies). Relief: Yes.
TPLimitationPeriod: Four years after the end of the tax year or the accounting period in which the return is made.
AdjustmentRegulations: The Revenue Commissioners generally accept a point within the interquartile range; however, a point within the full range may be accepted under certain circumstances.
AuditLikelihood: Relatively low people substance and principal company structures. Modifying a tax return or requiring a tax refund may also trigger an IRC query. Increase in audits across various industries.
APAAvailable: Yes
ThinCapRegulations: Irish TP rules require related-party debt interest charges to be at arm's length, considering debt capacity at the time of arrangement. Highly leveraged companies risk interest deduction disallowance.
PCbCRRegulations: S.I. No. 322/2023 - European Union (Disclosure of Income Tax Information by Certain Undertakings and Branches) regulations 2023, implementing EU Directive 2021/2101.
PCbCRStartDate: Financial years commencing on or after 22 June 2024.
PCbCRMaterialityExemptions: Yes, for small undertakings (not exceeding two of EUR7.5m balance sheet, EUR15m net turnover, 50 average employees).
PCbCRDataSources: Consolidation reporting packages, separate entity statutory financial statements, regulatory financial statements, or internal management accounts. Sources of data should be consistent between years.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: No later than 12 months after the last day of the financial year to which the report pertains.
PCbCRMaxPenalties: Class A fine (up to EUR5,000) or imprisonment up to six months, or both. Directors/officers can also be held liable.

TaxAuthority: Israeli Tax Authority (ITA)
TPLaw: Sections 85a, 85b, 85c of the Israeli Tax Ordinance (ITO) and related regulations
TPSection: Section 76d of the ITO
BEPS13Overview: Adopted BEPS Action 13 in 2022 (Sections 85b and 85c). Requires CbCR (ILS3.4bn threshold, effective 1 Jan 2022), Master File (aligns with OECD, effective Tax year 2022), and Local File (aligns with OECD, effective Tax year 2022). No material differences from OECD formats.
DocRequirements: Yes, prepared contemporaneously and annually. Applies to local branches of foreign companies. No stand-alone reports for multiple entities in jurisdiction.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: No threshold. CbCR: ILS3.4 billion annual global income. Master File: ILS150 million annual global income. Local File: No threshold. Economic analysis: No threshold.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement. Safe harbors available for low-level services (5% markup), marketing services (10%-12% markup), and low-risk distribution (3%-4% operating margin). No preference for aggregation or individual testing. Form 1585 for CbCR notification required.
TPReturn: Yes, Form 1385 (amended Dec 2022), Form 1485, and Form 1585.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 May (extensions common)
CbCRDeadline: 31 December (one year from end of tax year)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Annually, by tax return lodgment date (31 May, with extensions)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; 30 days upon tax authority request.
TPMethodPreference: Yes, in order of preference: CUP-CUT, Comparable profitability, Cost-plus-Resale price, CPM-TNMM, Profit-split, Other methods.
LocalComparables: Yes, local comparables are expected.
SingleYearAnalysis: Single-year analysis for tested party vs. three years for comparables.
InterquartileRange: Yes, interquartile range using spreadsheet quartile formulas is acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: Yes, a fresh benchmarking study is required every year.
CompliancePenals: No TP-specific penalties, but general tax penalties apply. Failure to furnish CbCR is noncompliance under Ordinance Section 131. No specific penalty for Master File. Tax assessor may make adjustments based on estimations if TP study is missing or inadequate.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No specific penalty for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation. General tax penalties (15%-30% of deficit if taxable income is 50%+ higher). Interest charged on penalties (linked to index, 4% interest). No penalty relief regime.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years (or four if extended by commissionaire) from end of Fiscal Year in which tax return was filed.
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes, common practice, especially for international transactions, foreign subsidiaries, and in areas like restructuring, stock options, digital economy, financial transactions, IP migrations, and business restructurings.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, adjustment is to the median.
AuditLikelihood: No specific transactions-industries; ITA challenges all.
APAAvailable: Yes, bilateral and multilateral APAs are available.

TaxAuthority: Italian Revenue Agency (Agenzia delle Entrate - AdE)
TPLaw: Article 110(7) of the Italian Income Tax Code (IITC), Ministerial Decree of 14 May 2018, Law Decree of 24 April 2017, No. 50, Decision of the Commissioner of the Italian Revenue Agency prot. n. 0360494 (New Instructions), Circular Letter of 26 November 2021
TPSection: Article 110(7) of the IITC
BEPS13Overview: Yes - Italy has adopted BEPS Action 13, requiring CbCR (from FY 2016), Master File, and Local File (from FY 2020). CbCR has no material differences from OECD format. Master File and Local File have material differences, requiring a specific format.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation needs to be prepared contemporaneously and submitted within 20 days upon request. Local branches of foreign companies must comply. Documentation must be prepared annually. Stand-alone reports are required for each entity in an MNE.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: No financial or other threshold. CbCR: EUR750 million annual global income. Master File: No financial or other threshold. Local File: No financial or other threshold. Economic analysis: No financial or other threshold, but marginal transactions (not exceeding 5% of total intercompany transactions) must be analyzed thoroughly. Small and medium-sized enterprises (turnover not exceeding EUR50 million) are not required to update benchmarking analysis for two fiscal years if comparability factors do not change significantly.
SpecificRequirements: Local language required for TP documentation, Master File may be in English. Safe harbor available for low-value-adding intercompany services (5% markup). No preference for aggregation or individual testing, but tax authority tends to apply transaction-by-transaction. DAC 6 rules implemented for cross-border arrangements.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, Italian companies must officially communicate whether they are managed and controlled by another company, as well as the name of the related company (Article 2497-bis of the Italian Civil Code). Financial statements should include essential data from the managing or controlling company’s financial statements and relations with related parties (Articles 2424, 2427, 2428 and 2497-bis of the Italian Civil Code).
CbCRinTaxReturn: Yes, the information is provided in Section RS 268 of the annual income tax return.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 October for companies with fiscal year ended 31 December. Generally, by the end of the 10th month following the fiscal year-end.
MasterFileDeadline: 20 days upon request during a tax audit. Contemporaneous preparation by tax return lodgment date.
CbCRDeadline: 31 December (for calendar-year fiscal years, for FY 2016 it was 9 February 2018; for subsequent FYs, generally end of the following fiscal year).
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. 20 days upon request from tax auditors.
TPMethodPreference: Yes. Traditional methods (CUP, resale price, cost-plus) are preferred over profit-based methods. Explanation required if a profit method is chosen when a traditional method could be applied, or if a method other than CUP is chosen when CUP could be applied. The five methods identified by Article 4 of the Decree correspond to OECD Guidelines: CUP, RPM, CPM, TNMM, PSM.
LocalComparables: There are no explicit benchmarking requirements for local comparables.
SingleYearAnalysis: The use of multiple-year data for testing a single year of the taxpayer is the common standard used when testing an arm’s-length analysis.
InterquartileRange: Interquartile range calculation using spreadsheet quartile formulas is acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: Not explicitly clarified, but financial updates for a limited number of years (e.g., two) are generally accepted. For small and medium-sized companies (turnover < EUR50 million), updates are on a three-year basis if comparability factors don't change.
BenchmarkingType: The weighted average is preferred for testing arm’s-length analysis.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: The independence criterion is generally set at 50%.
CompliancePenals: Penalty for failure to furnish CbCR: EUR10,000 to EUR50,000. Incomplete documentation (e.g., incomplete Local File or absence of Master File) jeopardizes penalty protection regime, leading to ordinary administrative penalties. Higher penalties may apply if documentation is not deemed complete and appropriate.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Penalty applicable if documentation is deemed incomplete: Yes. Penalty applicable if documentation is deemed non-contemporaneous: Yes. Interest charged on penalties or payable on a refund: No. Penalty relief can be obtained (e.g., reduced through settlement procedure).
TPLimitationPeriod: No specific statute of limitations for TP. General statute of limitations applies: Up to FY 2015, 4 years (5 if omitted-null tax return). From FY 2016, 5 years (7 for failure to file). Doubling of statute of limitations for criminal tax investigations repealed by 2016 Budget Law.
AdjustmentRegulations: Italian Revenue Agency Circular Letter no. 16-E of May 2022 provides guidelines. Interquartile range is preferred. If price-margin is not within the interquartile range, adjustment is generally to the median, unless proven otherwise.
AuditLikelihood: Generally, all intercompany relationships are deeply scrutinized. Recently, specific areas of attention: management fees, intellectual property-related transactions, financial transactions, and service provider structures.
APAAvailable: Yes, Advance Tax Agreements are available for transfer pricing, cross-border flows, PE attribution, PE existence, asset bases for migrations, and blacklist costs for CCP participants. Fees apply based on group turnover: EUR10,000 (<EUR100M), EUR30,000 (EUR100M-EUR750M), EUR50,000 (>EUR750M). Fees halved for renewal.
APATenure: Five years (from the year signed and the following four), provided underlying factual and legal circumstances remain unchanged.
APARollback: Available. Unilateral APA: up to the year of filing the APA request. Bilateral and multilateral APA: based on related terms and conditions. Extended roll-back for previous fiscal years possible if circumstances apply and no investigations started.
MAPAvailable: Yes. Taxpayers rely on MAP provisions under double taxation treaties or the European Arbitration Convention (EAC). New procedure allows unilateral downward adjustment within 180 days after foreign TP adjustment. EU Directive 2017-1852 implemented via Legislative Decree No. 49 of 10 June 2020.
ThinCapRegulations: Italy does not have specific regulations or rulings. It follows OECD principles. Legislative Decree No. 142 of 29 November 2018 replaced Article 96 of the IITC, aligning interest limitation rule with ATAD.
PCbCRAuthority: Company’s Register (Registro delle Imprese in Italian) of the Italian Chamber of Commerce.
PCbCRRegulations: Legislative Decree No. 128 of 4 September 2024, implementing EU Public Country-by-Country Reporting Directive.
PCbCRStartDate: Reporting periods starting on or after 22 June 2024.
PCbCRSection: Legislative Decree No. 128 of 4 September 2024 (the Decree), specifically Article 3 (applicability date), Article 1, lett. c) amending Legislative Decree No. 139-2015 and introducing Article 5-sexies (publication, accessibility, language).
PCbCRIncomeThreshold: Total consolidated (group) revenues exceeding EUR750 million for each of the last two consecutive financial years.
PCbCRMaterialityExemptions: Yes. Reporting obligation applies to Italian parents, stand-alone Italian companies exceeding threshold, Italian companies in non-EU consolidated groups exceeding threshold, and Italian PEs with revenues exceeding Article 2435-bis of Italian Civil Code threshold.
PCbCR_BEPS13Alignment: Yes, required content is consistent with the Directive, but more limited than BEPS Action 13 CbCR. Italian reporting entity can opt for methodologies in implementing Decree or CbCR methodologies. Safeguard clause not adopted.
PCbCRAggregationAllowed: Yes, for jurisdictions other than EU Member States, EEA countries, and EU blacklist/gray list jurisdictions.
PCbCRDataSources: Italian reporting entity can opt for methodologies provided in the implementing Decree or CbCR methodologies-implementing rules (Article 4 of Ministerial Decree of 23 February 2017, and subsequent CbCR implementing provisions).
PCbCRLodgmentOtherJurisdiction: Yes, under certain conditions, if non-EU UPE voluntarily publishes its PCbCR on its website and appoints the reporting entity to publish it according to the Decree.
PCbCRLodgmentFormat: Yes. EU regulation adopted on 29 November 2024 applies to reports for financial years starting on or after 1 January 2025. Italy has not yet issued specific implementing provisions.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: Within 12 months from the end of the reporting financial year.
PCbCRMaxPenalties: Directors of Reporting Entities failing to comply are subject to administrative penalties ranging from EUR10,000 to EUR50,000. These may be halved or doubled under certain circumstances, reaching EUR100,000.

TaxAuthority: National Tax Agency (Kokuzei-chō - NTA)
TPLaw: Special Taxation Measures Law (STML) and related Enforcement Orders, Ministerial Orders, and Circulars; Commissioner’s Directives on transfer pricing administration and mutual agreement procedures.
TPSection: STML Articles 66-4 to 66-4-5; STML Enforcement Order Articles 39-12 to 39-12-4; STML Ministerial Order Articles 22-10 to 22-10-5, 22-74, 22-75; STML Circulars; Commissioner’s Directives Chapters 1-8 and 1-6.
BEPS13Overview: Japan has adopted BEPS Action 13 for TP documentation in local laws and regulations.
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: No financial threshold. CbCR: JPY100 billion annual global income. Master File: JPY100 billion annual global income. Local File: JPY5 billion total international related-party transactions with a single overseas entity, or JPY300 million intangible transactions with a single overseas counterparty.
SpecificRequirements: Local File not required in local language, but translation may be requested. CbCR in English. Master File in English or Japanese. No safe harbor. No preference for aggregation or individual testing. No other disclosure or compliance requirement.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, under Japan Accounting Standard Paragraph 6 for consolidated financial statements.
TaxReturnDeadline: Within three months after year-end (including extension)
TPReturnDeadline: Within three months after year-end (including extension)
MasterFileDeadline: Within one year of the ultimate parent's fiscal year-end
CbCRDeadline: Within one year of the ultimate parent's fiscal year-end
CbCRNotificationDeadline: By the end of the ultimate parent's fiscal year-end
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. 45 days (contemporaneous Local File) or 60 days (exempt from contemporaneous) upon tax authority request.
LocalComparables: Yes, local comparables are preferred and often required in practice.
SingleYearAnalysis: Single-year for TP assessment; multi-year common for Local File or APAs.
InterquartileRange: Yes, recognized in Administrative Guidelines and commonly used in Local Files and APAs.
AnnualBenchmarking: TP examiners match years for assessment. Taxpayers use most up-to-date info for Local File due to data availability.
BenchmarkingType: Weighted average preferred for Local File or APAs.
CompliancePenals: No specific penalty for non-maintenance-non-furnishing-incomplete furnishing of documentation. JPY300,000 for failure to furnish CbCR. JPY300,000 for failure to furnish Master File. Fine up to JPY300,000 for failure to submit CbCR or Master File by deadline. No separate penalty for Local File.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No
TPLimitationPeriod: No
AdjustmentRegulations: Seven years from the deadline for filing tax returns for a fiscal year (effective 1 April 2020).
AuditLikelihood: Yes
APAAvailable: Adjustment
APATenure: Administrative Guidelines allow average, median, or any point in interquartile range if it provides a reasonable arm’s-length result.
APARollback: Yes, e.g., local entity losses/low profits, high foreign related-party profits, income shifting, compliance issues, multilevel transactions, or inappropriate TP corrections.
ThinCapRegulations: Up to five years
PCbCRApplies: Yes, up to six years for bilateral APAs (three years common); not for unilateral.
PCbCRRegulations: Thin capitalization rules (STML Article 66-5(1)) restrict interest deductibility for foreign related loans exceeding 3:1 debt-to-equity ratio. Earnings stripping rules (STML Article 66-5(2)) restrict interest deductibility if net foreign interest expense exceeds 20% of adjusted taxable income. Both rules apply, disallowing the higher amount.

TaxAuthority: Income and Sales Tax Department (ISTD)
TPLaw: Regulation No. (40) of 2021 (Transfer Pricing or TP Regulations) and its Executive Instructions No. (3) of 2021 (Executive Instructions)
TPSection: Various Income Tax Acts and Transfer Pricing Regulations and Executive Instructions
BEPS13Overview: Jordan adopted BEPS Action 13, requiring CbCR, Master File, and Local File. CbCR threshold: JOD600M consolidated revenue. MF/LF threshold: JOD500k annual related-party transactions.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and need to be prepared contemporaneously.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Controlled transactions > JOD500,000 annually. CbCR: Consolidated revenue > JOD600 million. Master File: Controlled transactions > JOD500,000 annually. Local File: Controlled transactions > JOD500,000 annually.
SpecificRequirements: Local language not specified but ISTD typically requests Arabic. Safe harbor unspecified. Aggregation of transactions is preferred.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Jordan follows IFRS, which requires related-party disclosure. Audited financial statements form part of the corporate income tax filing.
CbCRinTaxReturn: Yes, a CbCR notification in the ISTD format is submitted with the annual income tax return.
OtherRequiredDocs: A disclosure from a chartered accountant detailing compliance with group's transfer pricing policy.
TaxReturnDeadline: Four months from the end of the fiscal year of the taxpayer
TPReturnDeadline: Within four months after the end of the fiscal year of the taxpayer
MasterFileDeadline: Within 12 months following the end of the tax reporting period
CbCRDeadline: Within 12 months of the annual reporting year of the MNE group
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Within four months after the end of the fiscal year of the taxpayer
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Within 12 months following the end of the tax reporting year of the taxpayer
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Yes, within 12 months following the end of the tax reporting year of the taxpayer
LocalComparables: Local comparables are preferred over foreign comparables.
SingleYearAnalysis: Not specified.
InterquartileRange: Not specified.
AnnualBenchmarking: Not specified.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance-non-furnishing-incomplete furnishing of documentation: JOD300-JOD1,000. Late filing: JOD300-JOD1,000.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No penalty for incomplete-non-contemporaneous documentation. No interest on penalties-refunds. Penalty relief not available.
TPLimitationPeriod: Four years, starting from the date of submission of the return.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, the department may adjust the transfer pricing to a point within the arm’s-length range that best reflects the facts and circumstances of the case.
AuditLikelihood: Not applicable.
APAAvailable: No
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization rule is 3:1 debt-to-equity ratio for related-party debt. Interest on exceeding debt is not deductible.

TaxAuthority: State Revenue Committee of the Ministry of Finance
TPLaw: Transfer Pricing Law No. 67-IV (2008) and various subordinate legal acts and rules
TPSection: Article 11 of the Transfer Pricing Law
BEPS13Overview: Three-tier reporting (CbCR, Master File, Local File) and MNE group notification implemented.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and must be prepared contemporaneously. Local branches and MNE entities require stand-alone reports. Annual preparation is required.
MaterialityThresholds: No general TP documentation threshold. CbCR and Master File: EUR750 million consolidated group revenue. Local File: Company revenue > 5 million monthly calculation index (approx. USD35 million) AND total income/expenses/liabilities > 250,000 monthly calculation index (approx. USD1.8 million).
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Kazakh or Russian) required. Safe harbor available for agricultural goods (10% deviation) and specific government-approved methodologies. Individual testing of transactions preferred.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 March (may extend to 30 April)
MasterFileDeadline: Within 12 months following the reporting year (upon request, within 30 days)
CbCRDeadline: 31 December (within 12 months following reporting period or upon request)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Local File: 31 December. Other TP documentation: upon request, within 90 calendar days (or 30 business days during audit).
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Local File: 31 December. Other TP documentation: upon request, within 90 calendar days (or 30 business days during audit).
TPMethodPreference: Yes, CUP, cost-plus, resale price, profit-split, TNMM in that order.
LocalComparables: Not specified
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear analysis (three years preceding reporting year)
InterquartileRange: Yes, 25th to 75th percentiles.
AnnualBenchmarking: Not specified
CompliancePenals: Incomplete CbCR, Master File, Local File: max 500 monthly calculation index (approx. USD3,870). Failure to comply with monitoring or provide documents: max 350 monthly calculation index (approx. USD2,700). Non-submission of CbCR, Master File, Local File: max 500 monthly calculation index (approx. USD3,870).
PenaltiesPostAudit: Up to 80% of unpaid tax for TP adjustment. Criminal investigation if understatement exceeds 10% of annual taxes or 50,000-75,000 monthly calculation index (approx. USD380k-USD580k). Interest for late payment: 1.25x National Bank refinancing rate (approx. 9.5%).
TPLimitationPeriod: 3 years, extendable to 7 years for TP in certain cases.
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes, especially for export of commodities.
AdjustmentRegulations: Not explicitly stated, but in certain cases, adjustment to median point.
AuditLikelihood: Exports of commodities.
APAAvailable: Yes, bilateral and unilateral.
ThinCapRegulations: Interest deduction limited by a complex formula (thin capitalization rule) with marginal coefficients (7 for financial institutions, 4 for others).

TaxAuthority: Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and Income Tax (Transfer Pricing) Rules
TPSection: Section 18 (3), 18A, 18B-F, 18D (1-3), 18 (6) of the ITA and Income Tax (Transfer Pricing) Rules, 2006 (amended rules 2012), Paragraph 10 of the Income Tax (Transfer Pricing) Rules
DomesticTPObligations: Yes. Applicable when a resident transacts with a related resident in a preferential tax regime, or a resident transacts with a PE of a nonresident in Kenya where the nonresident is in a preferential tax regime.
OECDGuidelines: Limited. KRA refers to OECD Guidelines for guidance as best practice.
BEPS13Overview: Kenya has adopted BEPS Action 13. CbCR, Master File, and Local File requirements are implemented under the Income Tax Act, effective 1 July 2022, for MNEs with KES95 billion consolidated turnover. No material differences from OECD format.
DocRequirements: Yes, guidelines exist. Prepared contemporaneously, but submission upon request unless CbCR applies (then contemporaneous submission). Local branches must comply. Not required annually, but annual submissions of Master File and Local File required where CbCR applies. Stand-alone reports required for each entity.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: No limit. CbCR: KES95 billion consolidated turnover. Master File: KES95 billion consolidated turnover. Local File: KES95 billion consolidated turnover. Economic analysis: No limit.
SpecificRequirements: Local language: No (English required). Safe harbor: Unspecified. Aggregation: Individual testing. Other: No.
TaxReturnDeadline: End of the sixth month following the company’s financial year-end
MasterFileDeadline: Six months after the last day of the group’s fiscal year-end
CbCRDeadline: Twelve months from the group’s fiscal year-end
CbCRNotificationDeadline: On or before the last day of the group’s fiscal year-end
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Six months after the last day of the group’s fiscal year-end
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Statutory deadline: Yes, six months after the last day of the group’s fiscal year-end. Upon request: No specific timeline provided.
TPMethodPreference: No. Most appropriate method based on facts and circumstances is applied.
LocalComparables: No legal requirement for local comparables; regional comparables can be used.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear analysis is preferred.
InterquartileRange: Interquartile range is acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: No legal requirement; update considered after three years in practice.
CompliancePenals: Failure to keep a document: 10% of tax payable (minimum KES100,000). Failure to furnish CbCR: Fine up to KES1 million, prison up to three years, or both. Additional corporate tax, penalties, and interest on adjustments. Deemed dividend distribution with WHT implications.
PenaltiesPostAudit: If documentation incomplete: No specific penalty, but adjustments attract late payment penalty (5% of tax due - 1% interest per month). Tax avoidance penalty (double avoided tax) may apply. If documentation non-contemporaneous: No. Interest on penalties: Interest charged on principal tax liability, subject to in duplum rule. Penalty relief: No.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years. No time limit for fraud, evasion, or gross-willful neglect.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, can include an adjustment leading to additional assessment.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes. Tax authority can adjust to arm’s-length pricing if documentation not maintained or pricing outside interquartile range. Secondary adjustments for deemed dividends possible.
AuditLikelihood: All related-party transactions are viable; intragroup services and intangibles are common areas of scrutiny.
APAAvailable: Not applicable
MAPAvailable: Yes, through double taxation treaty agreements.
ThinCapRegulations: Section 16 (2)(j) of the ITA restricts interest tax deductible, capped at 30% of EBITDA.

TaxAuthority: Tax Administration of Kosovo (Administrata Tatimore e Kosovës - TAK)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings
BEPS13Overview: No, jurisdiction has not adopted BEPS Action 13 and does not require CbCR, Master File, or Local File.
DocRequirements: Yes, guidelines exist. Not required contemporaneously but advisable by CIT return date. Local branches must comply. Required annually. Stand-alone reports for each entity.
MaterialityThresholds: Yes, for TP documentation based on value of international transactions (e.g., aggregate value > EUR300,000 for Annual Controlled Transaction Notice). No materiality threshold for economic analysis. CbCR, Master File, Local File are not applicable.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Albanian or Serbian) required, English possible in consultation. No safe harbor, but simplified approach for low-value-adding intragroup services (7% markup). No preference for aggregation or individual testing.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 March
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within 30 days upon tax authority request.
TPMethodPreference: Yes, CUP first, then resale price and cost-plus. TNMM and profit-split in certain circumstances.
LocalComparables: Yes, local first, then Balkans, Eastern Europe, EU. Foreign comparables recognized with adjustments.
SingleYearAnalysis: Preference for same-year comparables, but previous-year allowed. EY practice uses multiyear.
InterquartileRange: Not specifically, but tax authorities adjust to median. EY practice uses interquartile range (Q1 to Q3).
AnnualBenchmarking: No, database searches updated every three years, financial updates annually.
BenchmarkingType: No specific provision, simple average used in examples. EY practice uses both weighted and simple average.
CompliancePenals: Failure to prepare-submit TP documentation or fulfill requirements: EUR125-EUR2,500. Failure to file Annual Controlled Transaction Notice: EUR125-EUR2,500.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No specific penalties for incomplete-non-contemporaneous documentation. General tax penalties apply for understatement (15% or 25% of undeclared tax) and late payment (1% per month, capped at 12%). No interest on penalties. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Six years from CIT return filing due date (31 March of following year).
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: No, tax administration unlikely to challenge methodology, should use taxpayer's method if most appropriate.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, if profit-level indicator falls below interquartile range, adjusted to median.
AuditLikelihood: No differences.
APAAvailable: No
MAPAvailable: Yes, under double tax treaties. Instruction on MAPs introduced in November 2022.
ThinCapRegulations: No thin capitalization rules.

TaxAuthority: Department of Inspections and Tax Claims (DIT)
TPLaw: Executive Bylaws of Law No. 2/ 2008 and Executive Rules and Instructions of Kuwait Income Tax Decree No. 3 of 1955, as amended by Law No. 2/ 2008
TPSection: Executive Rule No. 49 of Law No. 2/ 2008 specifically refers to the treatment of related companies.
BEPS13Overview: No
DocRequirements: No
MaterialityThresholds: No
SpecificRequirements: None specified
RelatedPartyFinancials: Related-party disclosures are included in the taxpayer’s financial statements.
TaxReturnDeadline: The 15th day of the fourth month from the end of the fiscal year
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: If TP documentation is requested by the tax authorities, based on the practice, taxpayers may be given one to two weeks to submit it.
LocalComparables: Local comparables are typically preferred over regional comparables in the event of a tax authority audit. A regional search covering countries in the Gulf Cooperation Council or the Middle East and North Africa region is likely to be more acceptable.
SingleYearAnalysis: There is none specified.
InterquartileRange: There is none specified.
AnnualBenchmarking: There is no specific requirement to conduct a fresh benchmarking search every year. However, it is recommended to conduct a fresh search once every three years and update financial data for the years in between.
CompliancePenals: None specified
PenaltiesPostAudit: Penalty interest (1% per month) is imposed in the case of transfer pricing adjustments resulting in an assessment of additional income.
TPLimitationPeriod: Law No. 2 of 2008 provides a statute-of-limitations period of five years, generally calculated from the date the annual tax return is filed, unless a tolling or discovery rule applies.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Adjustment through additional assessment is possible.
AdjustmentRegulations: Not applicable
AuditLikelihood: There is none specified.
APAAvailable: No
ThinCapRegulations: There are no such formal rules in Kuwait.

TaxAuthority: State Revenue Service (Valsts Ieņēmumu Dienests - SRS)
TPLaw: Corporate Income Tax (CIT) law (Article 4), Law on Taxes and Duties (Article 15.2), Cabinet Regulation No. 677, Cabinet Regulation No. 802
TPSection: Section 1, paragraph 18 of the Law on Taxes and Duties
BEPS13Overview: CbCR, Master File, and Local File are required
DocRequirements: Yes, guidelines exist; documentation must be prepared contemporaneously and annually; applicable to local branches; stand-alone reports required for each entity
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: based on intercompany cross-border transaction amounts. CbCR: EUR750 million annual global income. Master File: EUR15 million or EUR50 million turnover and EUR5 million total international related-party transactions.
