Local File: EUR5 million or EUR250,000 total international related-party transactions. Economic analysis: EUR20,000 annually per cross-border related-party transaction if TP documentation threshold met.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Latvian for Local File, Master File can be English with translation on request); Safe harbor for low value-adding intragroup services; Individual testing of transactions
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, for significant transactions not conforming to normal market conditions, if company exceeds certain balance sheet, turnover, or employee thresholds
TaxReturnDeadline: 20th date of the following month for the last month's CIT return
MasterFileDeadline: Within 12 months following the end of the respective financial year or within 30 days upon tax authority request
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Within 12 months following the end of the relevant financial year
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within 12 months after year-end (without request) if annual controlled transaction amount exceeds EUR5 million. Within 30 days after request if annual controlled transaction amount exceeds EUR250,000 but not EUR5 million. For local transactions closely linked to cross-border, 90 days after request (extendable by 30 days).
LocalComparables: Domestic comparables, if available, are preferred. However, in practice, foreign comparables are used in combination with domestic comparables.
SingleYearAnalysis: Both are acceptable, while the application of single or multiple year analysis should be justified.
InterquartileRange: No specific guidance, but accepted.
AnnualBenchmarking: Yes, if total cross-border controlled transactions exceed EUR5 million. Rollforward with financial updates accepted if transactions are between EUR250,000 and EUR5 million, with a new study every three years.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Companies with ownership share >= 20% are considered related parties and excluded from comparables search.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance/non-furnishing/incomplete furnishing of documentation: up to 1% of total controlled transactions, max EUR100,000. Failure to furnish Master File: EUR100,000.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Penalty for incomplete documentation (not linked to arm's-length principle). No penalty for non-contemporaneous documentation. No interest charged. No specific penalty relief, but can be reduced by 50% per ordinary procedure.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years after the submission of the annual financial statement for the respective financial year.
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific regulations
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral and bilateral APAs for cross-border transactions exceeding EUR1.43 million.
APATenure: Up to five years from the date of conclusion.
APARollback: Yes, a five-year period with roll-back is available.
MAPAvailable: Yes, in accordance with international treaties (e.g., 90/436/EEC).
ThinCapRegulations: CIT taxable base includes interest payments if average debt exceeds 4x equity (4:1 ratio) or if interest expenses exceed EUR3 million and 30% of EBITDA. Exemptions for loans from credit institutions/specialized finance institutions.
PCbCRRegulations: Law on Disclosure of Information on Revenue and Income Taxes
PCbCRSection: Law on Disclosure of Information on Revenue and Income Taxes
PCbCRMaterialityExemptions: Yes, if net turnover for two consecutive years is below EUR8 million.
PCbCRAggregationAllowed: Yes, but not for EU Member States, non-cooperative jurisdictions, and jurisdictions cooperating for good tax management principles.
PCbCRDataSources: Law on Disclosure of Information on Revenue and Income Taxes Section 17, Paragraph two, Clause 2

TaxAuthority: Ministry of Finance, State Tax Inspectorate (Valstybine Mokesciu Inspekcija — VMI)
TPLaw: Article 40 of the Law on Corporate Income Tax of Lithuania- Order of the Minister of Finance No. 1K- 123 as of 9 April 2004 (1 January 2021 version) regarding rules for the implementation of Article 40 (2) of the Law on Corporate Income Tax (CIT) and Article 15 (2) of the law on personal income tax (PIT)- Order of the Head of the State Tax Inspectorate No. VA-27 as of 22 March 2005 on the associated-party transaction disclosure in the annual CIT return
BEPS13Overview: Adopted BEPS Action 13 for TP documentation. CbCR, Master File, and Local File are required. CbCR effective 1 Jan 2019, no material differences. Master File effective 1 Jan 2019, material differences (supply chain description for top 5 products/services and >5% turnover products/services). Local File effective 1 Jan 2019, material differences (include preparation and update dates).
DocRequirements: Yes, TP rules are in place. Documentation must be submitted upon request and updated annually regarding actual pricing. Benchmarking study updated every three years. Local branch of foreign company must comply. Stand-alone reports for multiple entities in jurisdiction not required.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Local File if turnover > EUR3M or specific financial/insurance entities/PEs. Master File if turnover > EUR15M. CbCR: Global consolidated income > EUR750M. Local File: Turnover > EUR3M AND related party transactions > EUR90,000. Economic analysis: Single transaction > EUR90,000.
SpecificRequirements: Local language requirement (translation may be requested). Safe harbor available for low-value-adding services. Individual testing of transactions preferred, aggregation requires documented reasoning.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Names, activities and controlled party of the parent company or companies that may have a significant impact on the company must be disclosed in the company’s annual financial statement explanatory notes. General information about subsidiaries, associates, joint ventures, and its shareholders or partners that may have a significant influence over the entity.
OtherRequiredDocs: Disclosures related to TP (Form FR0528 for declaring transactions with related parties) must be submitted to the tax authorities with the annual CIT return.
TaxReturnDeadline: 15 July
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Submitted within 30 days from notice by tax authorities.
LocalComparables: Yes
SingleYearAnalysis: No
InterquartileRange: Yes
AnnualBenchmarking: No
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance/non-furnishing/incomplete furnishing of documentation: EUR1,820 to EUR5,590 (repeatedly: EUR3,770 to EUR6,000).
PenaltiesPostAudit: General tax penalties of 10% to 100% of additional tax apply for taxable income adjustments. No direct penalty for incomplete/non-contemporaneous documentation. No interest charged on penalties/refunds. Penalty relief possible (up to 10% reduction for cooperation).
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years prior to the year in which the assessment takes place.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes
AuditLikelihood: None specified.
APAAvailable: Yes
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization rules (4:1 debt-to-equity ratio for controlling entities). Interest deduction limitation rules (up to 30% of EBITDA or EUR3M, with exemptions for consolidated groups). Nondeductible interest can be carried forward indefinitely.
PCbCRAuthority: Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Lithuania
PCbCRRegulations: Order of the Minister of Finance No. 1K-233 as of 15 July 2023 regarding approving the description of the procedure for drawing up the report on income tax information
PCbCRStartDate: For financial years starting on or after 22 June 2024
PCbCRSection: Order of the Minister of Finance No. 1K-233

TaxAuthority: Luxembourg Tax Authority (Administration des Contributions Directes - ACD)
TPLaw: Luxembourg Income Tax Law (ITL) Articles 56, 56bis, 164(3); Circular LIR No. 56/1-56bis/1; Law of 23 December 2016 on CbCR rules
TPSection: Article 56 of the ITL defines related parties as: “When an enterprise participates, directly or indirectly, in the management, control or capital of another enterprise, or where the same persons participate, directly or indirectly, in the management, control or capital of two enterprises.”
BEPS13Overview: Adopted for CbCR only. CbCR required for groups with EUR750m+ consolidated turnover, effective for fiscal years starting on or after 1 Jan 2016, no material differences from OECD format. Master File and Local File not required.
DocRequirements: General documentation requirements under Section 171 of the General Tax Law apply. No specific TP documentation regulations. Contemporaneous documentation expected. Local branches must comply. Not required annually or per entity.
MaterialityThresholds: No specific materiality limit for TP documentation or economic analysis. CbCR threshold is EUR750 million consolidated annual group turnover. Master File and Local File not applicable.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (English acceptable). Safe harbors available for intermediary financing activities (2% after-tax return on assets) and certain regulated entities (10% return on equity). Individual transaction testing preferred.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, it is in line with local accounting requirements.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 May
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Upon tax authority request, typically within 14 days (extendable).
LocalComparables: OECD guidance should be followed.
SingleYearAnalysis: OECD guidance should be followed.
InterquartileRange: OECD guidance should be followed.
AnnualBenchmarking: OECD guidance should be followed.
CompliancePenals: Fines for intentionally incomplete or inexact tax returns or non-declaration. Administrative penalties for failure to deliver general documentation. Tax authority may reassess/adjust taxable result if arm's-length standard not respected.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Fines of 5%-25% of taxes avoided for incomplete/inexact tax returns. CbCR non-compliance (failure to file, late filing, incomplete/inexact info) can result in penalties up to EUR250,000. No penalty for non-contemporaneous documentation. No interest charged. Penalty relief possible via appeal.
TPLimitationPeriod: In principle, five years starting from 1 January of the calendar year following the relevant tax year. Extended to 10 years for no/incomplete tax return or fraud.
AdjustmentRegulations: OECD guidance should be followed.
AuditLikelihood: There is none specified.
APAAvailable: Yes
APARollback: Roll-back to prior years is available on a case-by-case basis.
ThinCapRegulations: No specific local transfer pricing regulations at this stage, but further developments after the issuance of the OECD transfer pricing guidance on financial transactions are to be monitored. Debt-to-equity ratio and commercial rationale need to be supported by appropriate documentation.
PCbCRStartDate: Financial years starting on or after 22 June 2024. For calendar financial year, first reporting obligation for financial year 2025.
PCbCRIncomeThreshold: EUR750 million consolidated revenue for ultimate parent/stand-alone undertakings for two consecutive years. EUR8.8 million net turnover for branches of non-EU undertakings, provided the ultimate parent/stand-alone undertaking exceeds EUR750 million consolidated turnover for two consecutive years.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: Within 12 months of the balance sheet date of the financial year for which the report is drawn up
PCbCRMaxPenalties: Fines between €500 and €25,000 for management or administrative bodies.

TaxAuthority: Inland Revenue Board (IRB) of Malaysia (Lembaga Hasil Dalam Negeri Malaysia - IRB)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts, Labuan Business Activity Act, Malaysia Transfer Pricing Rules 2012, 2023, and Malaysia Transfer Pricing Guidelines 2017, 2024.
TPStartDate: 1 January 2009 and the Malaysia Transfer Pricing Rules 2023 and Malaysia TP Guidelines 2024 have effect from 2023 and subsequent years.
TPSection: Various Income Tax Acts, Labuan Business Activity Tax Act, Transfer Pricing Rules, APA Rules, and CbCR Rules.
BEPS13Overview: Malaysia adopted and implemented BEPS Action 13 effective from 1 January 2017 for CbCR in its local regulations. CbCR applies to MNEs with consolidated revenue of at least MYR3 billion. No material differences from OECD format for CbCR. No separate Master File requirement effective 2023, but information mirroring OECD Master File is required as part of CTPD. Local File is required, effective 1 January 2009, but disclosures are more detailed and extensive compared to BEPS Action 13 requirements.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and need to be prepared contemporaneously. A local branch of a foreign company needs to comply. Preparation is required annually, but comparable searches can be updated every three years if operational conditions are unchanged, with annual review of financial data. Stand-alone reports are required for MNEs with multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Yes, Turnover. Other threshold: Gross income less than MYR 30 million AND cross-border related party transactions less than MYR 10 million OR provide-receive financial assistance exceeding RM50 million. CbCR: MYR3 billion, Annual global income. No other threshold. Master File: Not applicable effective 2023. Not applicable. No other threshold. Local File: Persons not required to prepare CTPD include individuals not carrying on a business, individuals carrying on a business (including partnerships) who only engage in domestic controlled transactions, persons with controlled transactions not more than RM1 million, or persons with solely domestic controlled transactions where both parties do not enjoy tax incentives, are taxed at the same headline tax rate, or do not suffer losses for two consecutive years prior to the controlled transactions. Financial metric: Other (total amount of controlled transactions, tax incentives, tax rate, losses). No other threshold. Economic analysis: No. Not applicable. No.
SpecificRequirements: No. Can be submitted in English or Bahasa Malaysia. Yes, for low value added services (LVAS) if conditions are met. No preference. Ideally transaction-by-transaction, but aggregation allowed if transactions are closely linked or continuous. No.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Taxpayers are required to disclose all related-party transactions in their financial statements. However, the auditor applies specific thresholds on which related party transactions must be disclosed; therefore, sometimes not all related party transactions are disclosed in the financial statements.
CbCRinTaxReturn: Starting YA 2021, constituent entities can now furnish the CbCR notification using the Form C. Constituent entities filing other forms should continue furnishing the notification using the existing method.
OtherRequiredDocs: CbCR notification filed as a reporting entity or non-reporting entity
TaxReturnDeadline: Seven or eight months after the fiscal year-end of an entity (e.g., 31 July for 31 Dec year-end, with a one-month grace period for e-filing).
TPReturnDeadline: By the time of filing of the tax return, seven or eight months after the fiscal year-end of an entity.
CbCRDeadline: 12 months after the last day of the reporting fiscal year of the MNE Group.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Similar to the filing of the tax return, seven or eight months after the fiscal year-end of an entity (when furnished using Form C). Otherwise, on or before the due date to file Form C.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: By tax return lodgment date (prior to the due date for furnishing a return).
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No. Within 14 days upon request of the tax authorities.
LocalComparables: The IRB prefers using a local benchmarking study (i.e., local Malaysian comparable companies). Foreign comparables can be considered if sufficient and verifiable information is provided.
SingleYearAnalysis: Yes, single-year analysis is preferred. Multiple-year data is only used to assist in the selection of comparables, not for multi-year averages.
InterquartileRange: Yes, the arm’s-length range is tightened to the 37.5th percentile to the 62.5th percentile. If the price is outside this range, the arm’s-length price shall be taken to be the median.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, comparable searches in databases should be updated every three years, but financial data and suitability of existing comparables should be reviewed and updated annually.
BenchmarkingType: The Malaysian TP Guidelines and 2023 TP Rules do not advocate using weighted average.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: The IRB prefers local comparables. Guidelines require selection of comparables aligning with economically relevant characteristics, providing qualitative (functional comparability, product portfolio, business strategies, geographical markets, business activities) and quantitative criteria (size, intangible-related, export sales, inventories, exclusion of special circumstances like start-ups).
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance-non-furnishing-incomplete documentation: Fine not less than RM20,000 and not more than RM100,000 or imprisonment for not more than six months or both (Section 113B of ITA). Penalty concession may apply for accounting periods before 29 May 2023. Failure to furnish CbCR: Fine not less than RM20,000 and not more than RM100,000 or imprisonment for not more than six months or both (Section 113A or 112A of ITA). Under Labuan Regulations, fine not exceeding RM1,000,000 or imprisonment for not exceeding two years or both. Failure to furnish Master File: Not applicable. Other penalties: Surcharge of up to 5% on the amount of any increase in income or reduction in any deduction or loss arising from a transfer pricing adjustment (Section 140A (3C) of ITA), effective for audits commencing on or after January 1, 2021.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Incomplete documentation: Yes, fine not less than RM20,000 and not more than RM100,000 or imprisonment for not more than six months or both. Non-contemporaneous documentation: Yes, fine not less than RM20,000 and not more than RM100,000 or imprisonment for not more than six months or both. Interest charged on penalties or payable on a refund: No. Penalty relief: Yes, concession for accounting periods before 29 May 2023, voluntary disclosure (0% to 4% surcharge), or appeal via Form Q.
TPLimitationPeriod: Seven-year statute of limitations for additional assessments. No statute of limitations in instances of fraud, willful default or negligence.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, an adjustment. Risk reduced by contemporaneous TP documentation.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, the arm’s-length range is 37.5th percentile to 62.5th percentile. If outside, the arm’s-length price shall be taken to be the median. IRB may adjust to median or any point above due to unquantifiable comparability defects.
AuditLikelihood: Yes, companies with high value of related-party transactions, significant intragroup transactions (royalties, management fees, technical services, commission), companies reporting losses with related-party transactions, and related-party transactions between two Malaysian entities where one has tax incentives or reports losses.
APAAvailable: Yes
APATenure: Minimum of three years and a maximum of five years.
APARollback: Yes, for not more than three years of assessment immediately preceding the covered period, if facts and circumstances are substantially the same.
ThinCapRegulations: Earning stripping rules (ESR) introduced from 1 January 2019 to restrict deductibility of interest expenses on financial assistance in controlled cross-border transactions. Relevant regulations: Section 140C of the ITA, Income tax (restriction on deductibility of interest) rules 2019, and Restriction on deductibility of interest guidelines.

TaxAuthority: State Tax Service of the Republic of Moldova - Ministry of Finance of the Republica of Moldova - National Bureau of Statistics of the Republic of Moldova
TPLaw: Tax Code approved by Law No. 1163-XIII of 24 April 1997, with subsequent amendments - Order of the Ministry of Finance No. 9 of 16 September 2024 regarding the approval of the rules for the implementation of transfer pricing - Accounting and Financial Reporting Law No. 287/2017, with subsequent amendments
TPStartDate: 1 January 2024 for transfer pricing regulations - 1 January 2025 for Advance Pricing Agreement (APA) regulations - 1 January 2025 for Public CbCR regulations
TPSection: Various Tax Code, Ministry of Finance Order, and Accounting and Financial Reporting Law references
BEPS13Overview: Jurisdiction has not adopted BEPS Action 13. CbCR and Master File are not required. Local File is required, although a three-tiered documentation format as per BEPS Action 13 has not been formally prescribed. Local File requirements are based on specific transaction value thresholds (MDL20 million for preparation upon request, MDL50 million for annual submission). Effective date for Local File is 1 January 2024.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation needs to be submitted or prepared contemporaneously. Taxpayers with annual transaction value of at least MDL20 million (but less than MDL50 million) prepare and present upon request within 60 days. Taxpayers with at least MDL50 million annually prepare and submit within six months from end of tax period. Local branch of a foreign company needs to comply. Annual preparation is required for taxpayers above certain thresholds. Stand-alone reports for each entity are required for MNEs with multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Yes, Other (total value of transactions refers to revenues and/or expenses recognized in statutory books from in-scope transactions with all related parties). CbCR: Not applicable. Master File: Not applicable. Local File: Total transaction value, Other (total value of transactions refers to revenues and/or expenses recognized in statutory books from in-scope transactions with all related parties). Economic analysis: No.
SpecificRequirements: Yes, local language (Romanian) is required. English or Russian are accepted without certified translation for agreements/contracts, information, legal documents. Safe harbor is unspecified. No preference for aggregation or individual testing. Yes, other disclosure or compliance requirement.
TPReturn: Yes, Transfer Pricing Information form for taxpayers with annual transaction value of at least MDL20 million.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, for statutory accounting reporting purposes.
TaxReturnDeadline: By 25th of the third month following the end of the tax period (e.g., 25 March for calendar tax year).
TPReturnDeadline: By 25th of the third month following the end of the tax period.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: For MDL20-50 million transactions: upon request within 60 days. For at least MDL50 million transactions: annually prepare and submit within six months from the end of the tax period.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Yes, statutory deadline. For taxpayers not exceeding mandatory thresholds for annual submission, within 60 days upon tax authority request. For those exceeding MDL50 million, within six months from the end of the tax period.
TPMethodPreference: Yes, the law lists comparable uncontrolled prices, resale price, cost-plus, transactional net margin, profit split, and any other method recognized under OECD TP Guidelines. Criteria for method selection are provided.
LocalComparables: Yes, geographical criterion of the market where related parties conduct transactions-activities is prioritized. If a different geographical criterion is selected, the taxpayer must support this selection.
SingleYearAnalysis: No specific indication
InterquartileRange: Yes, prescribed for transfer pricing analyses.
AnnualBenchmarking: No specific indication. Roll-forward or update of financial results of a prior study might be acceptable depending on circumstances, considering reference to OECD TP Guidelines.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Search strategy should incorporate independence criteria as per Moldovan legislation (e.g., 25% voting shares or effective control for related parties).
CompliancePenals: Late submission of TP information report: MDL30,000 to MDL50,000. Failure to submit TP information report: MDL100,000 to MDL150,000. Failure to submit TP file: MDL300,000 to MDL500,000. Filing TP Information report with untruthful information leading to understatement/evasion: MDL60,000 to MDL90,000 (for fiscal periods starting with 2028). Filing TP File with untruthful information leading to understatement/evasion: MDL150,000 to MDL200,000 (for fiscal periods starting with 2028).
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, if documentation is deemed incomplete. Tax authority may adjust to the median, triggering 12% profits tax, late-payment interest (currently 9% annual), and a fine from 20% to 30% of understated tax liability (80% to 100% for tax evasion). Yes, if documentation is deemed non-contemporaneous (fines for late/failure to submit TP Report). Penalty relief can be obtained (50% reduction if paid within three days).
TPLimitationPeriod: Normally four years, extended to six years if no tax return filed or tax refund applied for.
MethodologyScrutiny: No, as 2024 is the first year for TP documentation requirements, no tax audit practice yet.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, adjustment by tax authority using other TP methods provided under regulations.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, tax authority may adjust or estimate to the level considered to reflect the central tendency of the market (i.e., median).
AuditLikelihood: No
APAAvailable: Yes, introduced starting 1 January 2025. Unilateral, bilateral/multilateral APAs available for ongoing or future transactions (up to five fiscal periods) and can roll back for the last two fiscal periods. Fees apply.
MAPAvailable: No specific Moldovan MAP application procedure, but double tax treaties generally comprise relevant articles.
ThinCapRegulations: Not applicable
PCbCRAuthority: National Bureau of Statistics of Republic of Moldova - Ministry of Finance of Republic of Moldova
PCbCRRegulations: Accounting and Financial Reporting Law No. 287/2017, with subsequent amendments
PCbCRSection: Accounting and Financial Reporting Law No. 287/2017, with subsequent amendments
PCbCRIncomeThreshold: MDL15,750,000,000, for the last two financial years
PCbCRMaterialityExemptions: Yes, applicable to stand-alone entities, large and medium subsidiaries, and branches in Moldova exceeding the global consolidated income threshold, with sales revenues above MDL127,200,000 in the last two financial years. Simplified requirements for local entities meeting certain conditions.
PCbCRAggregationAllowed: No, information needs to be presented separately for each group entity.
PCbCRDataSources: Accounting and Financial Reporting Law No. 287/2017, with subsequent amendments
PCbCRLodgmentFormat: No, PCbCR information to be included in the management report attached to financial statements; no specific format was yet issued.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: For public interest entities: 120 days from the end date of the reporting period. For other entities: 150 days from the end date of the reporting period.
PCbCRMaxPenalties: No specific PCbCR penalties. Penalties between MDL1,000 and MDL3,500 may apply for noncompliance with rules of preparation and submission of management report and financial statements.

TaxAuthority: General Department of National Taxation (GDNT)
TPLaw: Articles 27 and 37-40 of General Taxation Law (GTL) and article 27 of Corporate Income Tax (CIT) law.
TPSection: Definition of related parties based on direct/indirect participation (20% share/profit/voting rights), common control, family relationships, group membership, branches, or arrangements to reduce taxable income.
BEPS13Overview: Jurisdiction adopted BEPS Action 13, requiring CbCR (EUR750m threshold), Master File (MNT6bn threshold), and Local File (MNT6bn threshold) from 1 Jan 2020. No material differences from OECD format. CbCR expected to commence upon MCAA signing.
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: Small and medium-size enterprise group companies under MNT6 billion annual turnover are exempt from certain TP documentation requirements (Local File and Master File).
SpecificRequirements: Yes (local language - Mongolian, English translation for reference)
RelatedPartyFinancials: Taxpayers may be required to disclose related-party transactions in the financial statements if the applicable accounting standards require to do so.
TaxReturnDeadline: Not applicable
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Yes
TPMethodPreference: 10 February; 5-10 working days upon tax authority request
LocalComparables: Yes
SingleYearAnalysis: Local comparables are preferable in the first instance. In absence of availability of local comparables, comparables of pan-Asia-Pacific may be applied.
InterquartileRange: Single year and multiyear analyses are both acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: Calculation using spreadsheet quartile is acceptable.
BenchmarkingType: Yes, a fresh benchmarking is required every year.
CompliancePenals: A 20% independence threshold is required.
PenaltiesPostAudit: 2%-4% of related-party transaction value for non-maintenance/non-furnishing/incomplete furnishing of documentation. CbCR: 4% of transaction value. Master File: 3% of transaction value. Transfer Pricing Transactional Report: 2% of transaction value. Local File: 3% of transaction value.
TPLimitationPeriod: No (for incomplete/non-contemporaneous documentation, but TP adjustments are subject to 30%-50% penalty of due tax). No (for interest on penalties, but daily interest charged on TP adjustments). No (penalty relief).
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes
AuditLikelihood: If the price of the controlled transaction falls outside the interquartile range, adjustments will be made by the difference between the price of the controlled transaction and the median of the interquartile range.
APAAvailable: No
ThinCapRegulations: Not applicable
PCbCRApplies: Thin capitalization arises when investor’s debt-to-equity ratio exceeds 3:1. Any interest attributable to the debt exceeding the ratio is nondeductible. Related-party loan interest shall not exceed 30% of EBITDA.

TaxAuthority: Tax Administration of Montenegro
TPLaw: CIT Law Article 38 and Instructions on detailed method of determining transfer pricing
TPSection: CIT Law Article 38 Paragraph 2, Law on Tax Administration Article 15
BEPS13Overview: Jurisdiction has not adopted BEPS Action 13. CbCR is required from 1 January 2024, with no material differences from OECD format. Master File and Local File are not required.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously, annually, and for each entity. Local branch of a foreign company must comply.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: EUR75,000 turnover for abbreviated form (not large taxpayers). CbCR: EUR750 million annual global income. Master File: Not applicable. Local File: Not specified. Economic analysis: EUR75,000 for abbreviated form (not large taxpayers).
SpecificRequirements: Local language required. Safe harbor available for interest rates on intercompany loans. No preference for aggregation or individual testing. Documentation should be in local currency (EUR) and consistent with financial statements.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 March
TPReturnDeadline: Large taxpayers: along with tax return (31 March). Other taxpayers: possess at filing (31 March). Exceptionally, deferred to 30 June until 2027 for non-large taxpayers.
CbCRDeadline: 31 December (within 12 months from end of MNE group’s reporting financial year).
CbCRNotificationDeadline: No later than on the day of filing of the income tax return for the preceding fiscal year.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Large taxpayers: along with tax return (31 March). Other taxpayers: possess at filing (31 March). Exceptionally, deferred to 30 June until 2027 for non-large taxpayers.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Large taxpayers: along with tax return (31 March). Other taxpayers: upon 45 days from request (starting 2028). Exceptionally, deferred to 30 June until 2027 for non-large taxpayers.
LocalComparables: Foreign comparables are accepted if no local comparables can be identified.
SingleYearAnalysis: Use of a multiyear analysis is mandatory.
InterquartileRange: Use of the interquartile range is mandatory.
AnnualBenchmarking: Not explicitly prescribed. Some taxpayers prepare roll-forward, some fresh. No practice in disputing approaches yet. Financials of taxpayer should be updated annually.
BenchmarkingType: Application of the weighted average for arm’s-length analysis is mandatory.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Independence evaluated by related-party rules (25% shares or votes). Closely related persons also considered related.
CompliancePenals: Penalties for omitting to file or possess TP documentation: EUR1,000 to EUR20,000 for legal entity, EUR500 to EUR2,000 for responsible person.
PenaltiesPostAudit: If CIT base not calculated per law: EUR1,000-EUR20,000. No specific penalties for incomplete-non-contemporaneous documentation. Interest charged at 0.03% daily rate. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years, starting at the beginning of the year following the year in which the respective tax liability is to be assessed.
AdjustmentRegulations: No
AuditLikelihood: Management and consulting services. Large taxpayers are audited more frequently.
APAAvailable: No
MAPAvailable: Yes, through double tax treaties. No elaborate practice.
ThinCapRegulations: No thin capitalization provisions in place.
PCbCRDataSources: Article 4 of the Instructions on the more detailed method of determining transfer pricing of transactions

TaxAuthority: Tax Authority of Mozambique (Autoridade Tributária de Moçambique)
TPLaw: Transfer Pricing Regime (Regime de Preços de Transferência), effective from 1 January 2018
TPSection: Decree no. 70/ 2017, dated 6 December
BEPS13Overview: Not adopted BEPS Action 13; no CbCR, Master File, or Local File requirements as per BEPS Action 13
DocRequirements: Yes (documentation needs to be prepared within six months after year-end, annually, and stand-alone for each entity)
MaterialityThresholds: Yes, for TP documentation: annual net turnover and other income equal to, or exceeds, MZN2.5 million in the previous year. No specific threshold for Local File, Master File, CbCR.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Portuguese) required; Individual testing preferred
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 May or fifth month after year-end
TPReturnDeadline: 30 June or sixth month after year-end
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; upon request, tax authorities provide five to 15 days
LocalComparables: Not applicable
SingleYearAnalysis: The tested party’s single-year results are usually tested against multiple-year interquartile ranges.
InterquartileRange: Yes
AnnualBenchmarking: No clear requirement; financial update may fulfill.
CompliancePenals: No specific penalties for non-maintenance/non-furnishing/incomplete furnishing of documentation. General penalties from MZN6,000 to MZN600,000 (nonexistence) or MZN13,000 to MZN700,000 (omissions/inaccuracies).
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, if documentation is deemed incomplete (penalties and interest). Interest charged on penalties and, in theory, payable on refund. Penalty relief only with voluntary disclosure.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years
AdjustmentRegulations: Not applicable
AuditLikelihood: Yes, mining and oil and gas sectors
APAAvailable: Not applicable
MAPAvailable: Only if available in the specific context of a convention to avoid double taxation
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization rules are generally applicable to credits and loans granted by a related nonresident entity to a Mozambican taxpayer. Established by Article 52 of the CIT code, with a debt-to-equity ratio of 2:1. Interest on excess portion not allowed as a cost for tax purposes.

TaxAuthority: Namibia Revenue Agency (NamRA)
TPLaw: Section 95A of the Income Tax Act 24 of 1981 (Income Tax Act)
TPSection: Section 95A of the Income Tax Act 24 of 1981. Connected person definition effective from years of assessment commencing on or after 1 January 2024.
BEPS13Overview: Namibia joined the BEPS Inclusive Framework on 9 August 2019. BEPS Action 13 has not been implemented in local regulations. CbCR, Master File, and Local File are not required.
DocRequirements: No formal guidelines or rules, but preparation is advised by Income Tax Practice Note 2/2006. Local branches of foreign companies must comply. Stand-alone reports are required for MNEs with multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: No filing thresholds have been communicated to date for TP documentation, CbCR, Master File, Local File, or Economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: Documentation must be in English. No safe harbor specified. No preference for aggregation or individual testing of transactions. Other disclosures are required in the corporate income tax return.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, in accordance with IAS 24, Related Party Disclosures, of the IFRS.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 July (seven months from year-end, extensions available)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Upon tax authority request, within 30 days.
TPMethodPreference: No. NamRA accepts OECD methods (CUP, resale price, cost-plus, TNMM, profit-split). Method selection depends on facts and circumstances.
LocalComparables: No legal requirement for local comparables; global and regional comparables acceptable, subject to adjustments.
SingleYearAnalysis: Generally, testing every three years is acceptable.
InterquartileRange: Yes, interquartile range calculation using spreadsheet quartile formulas is acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, financial updates should be acceptable.
CompliancePenals: Not applicable
PenaltiesPostAudit: No specific penalties for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation. Interest of 20% per year charged on late payment of tax. No interest on refunds. Formal penalty relief not available, but sound documentation may mitigate a 200% penalty on tax adjustments.
TPLimitationPeriod: Namibia does not have a statute of limitations; reviews and audits may be indefinite. Records must be maintained for five years.
AdjustmentRegulations: None
AuditLikelihood: None specified.
APAAvailable: No
ThinCapRegulations: Tax law limits connected person's tax-deductible net interest expense to 30% of tax EBITDA. Fixed 3:1 debt to equity ratio deleted.

TaxAuthority: Dutch Tax and Customs Administration (Belastingdienst - DTCA)
TPLaw: Corporate Income Tax Act 1969 (Articles 8b(3), 29b-29h); Dutch TP decree
TPSection: Article 8b (1) and (2) of the Corporate Income Tax Act 1969 (related party); Articles 29b to 29h of the Corporate Income Tax Act 1969 (supplementary documentation)
BEPS13Overview: Adopted BEPS Action 13 (Articles 29b-29h CIT Act 1969) for CbCR, Master File, Local File. Applicable from 1 Jan 2016. No material differences from OECD. CbCR threshold EUR750M, MF/LF threshold EUR50M.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneous and annual preparation. Applies to local branches. MF/LF not submitted unless requested. CbCR required for applicable taxpayers.
MaterialityThresholds: TP Doc: No threshold. CbCR: EUR750M global income. MF/LF: EUR50M global income. Economic analysis: No threshold.
SpecificRequirements: No local language (English accepted). Safe harbor unspecified. Individual testing preferred, aggregation allowed for similar transactions. No other disclosures.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 May (extensions possible)
MasterFileDeadline: 31 May (must be available in records by this date)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Documentation expected to be available upon request. For non-29b to 29h entities, 4 weeks (extendable to 3 months) upon request.
LocalComparables: Pan-European benchmarks are accepted.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiple-year analysis is preferred, as per common practice.
InterquartileRange: Interquartile range is preferred, as per common practice. Full range can be applied if comparables are highly comparable.
AnnualBenchmarking: New benchmarking search every three years, with financial update in the other two years.
BenchmarkingType: The weighted average is preferred, as per common practice.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Independence (best practice), Industry classification, Financial data (Turnover criterion, Availability operating profit or loss, Rejection of company if consolidated data is available, Active or inactive).
CompliancePenals: MF/LF noncompliance: criminal offense, fines up to EUR10,300 or 6 months detention; shifts burden of proof. CbCR failure: up to EUR1,030,000, potential criminal prosecution (imprisonment up to 4-6 years, fines up to EUR25,750-EUR103,000).
PenaltiesPostAudit: No penalty for incomplete/non-contemporaneous documentation unless purely intentional. Tax interest on extra tax. Penalties unlikely with proper documentation. Dispute resolution options available.
TPLimitationPeriod: 3 years from FY end (extended by filing extension). Additional assessments up to 5 years (12 for foreign income) for new facts/bad faith. 2 years for mistakes (if taxpayer should have known, 30% difference).
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, an adjustment will be made if compensation falls outside annual and multiple-year ranges.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, Dutch TP Decree provides guidance: adjustment to any point within range if highly reliable comparables; adjustment to median if comparables not highly reliable.
AuditLikelihood: Head-office activities, economic substance, intangibles, business reorganizations, centralized purchasing, captive insurance, financial transactions (loans, guarantees). Focus on low-tax jurisdictions and recurring losses.
APAAvailable: Unilateral, bilateral, multilateral APAs available. Efficient process with pre-filing, case management. Specific options for financial services. New policy (post-July 2019) requires transparency, International Fiscal Security Board approval, economic nexus, UBO insight. No rulings for tax avoidance or non-cooperative-low-tax jurisdictions.
APATenure: Maximum five years, up to 10 years for exceptions (e.g., long-term contracts) with a 50% term evaluation.
ThinCapRegulations: Dutch TP decree (2022-16685), Section 9, focusing on financial transactions in line with OECD Chapter X.
PCbCRRegulations: Implementing Law of 6 Dec 2023 and Implementing Decree of 14 Feb 2024 (EU Public CbCR Directive implementation).
PCbCRStartDate: Reporting periods starting on or after 22 June 2024.
PCbCRSection: Book 2 of Dutch Civil Code (delegation bases). Implementing Decree (Articles 15 par. 2, 11 par. 1-3).
PCbCRIncomeThreshold: EUR750 million in each of the last two consecutive financial years.
PCbCRMaterialityExemptions: Yes. Exemptions for: purely domestic entities, banks-investment firms already reporting, and non-EU UPEs voluntarily publishing and appointing an EU entity.
PCbCR_BEPS13Alignment: Yes, but with more limited information than BEPS Action 13 CbCR.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: Within 12 months from the end of the reporting financial year.

TaxAuthority: Inland Revenue (Te Tari Taake — IR)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings
TPSection: Various sections of ITA
BEPS13Overview: Yes
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: No materiality limit for TP documentation, Master File, Local File, or Economic analysis. CbCR threshold: EUR750 million (NZ$1.3 billion) annual global income.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (English expected). No formal safe harbors, but administrative practices for low-value services, small-value loans, small wholesale distributors. No preference for aggregation/individual testing. BEPS disclosure form required for hybrid/branch mismatches, thin capitalization, restricted TP rules.
RelatedPartyFinancials: It is in accordance with the financial reporting disclosure standards.
CbCRinTaxReturn: No CbCR notification is required in New Zealand.
TaxReturnDeadline: 7 July (for October to March balance dates)/seventh day of fourth month following balance date (for April to September balance dates). Extension to 31 March for tax agency clients.
MasterFileDeadline: Master File should be maintained by the tax return lodgment date. Submitted upon request.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Submitted upon request, typically within 20 working days.
LocalComparables: Local benchmarking is preferred (Australian comparables are generally the best option if New Zealand benchmarks are not available); however, reliable benchmarks based on other jurisdictions (the UK or North America) are also acceptable. Asia-Pacific (APAC) benchmarks are not accepted by IR based on the dissimilarity of the market compared to New Zealand.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear benchmarks are acceptable and generally preferred to single year benchmarks.
InterquartileRange: IR will typically apply a standard interquartile range when testing a taxpayer’s transfer pricing position.
AnnualBenchmarking: No. Best practice in New Zealand is to conduct a fresh search every three years, with financial updates in the interim years.
BenchmarkingType: Generally, weighted average results are used for constructing an arm’s-length range. Pooled results are typically not accepted by IR.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Benchmarks should be independent. Comparability is a key aspect when completing benchmarking analysis, and IR endorses OECD guidance related to this.
CompliancePenals: Incomplete or inadequate documentation could result in shortfall penalties (20-150%). Failure to provide information or documentation when requested can constitute an offense. No specific penalties for CbCR/Master File failure to furnish.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Penalty applicable if documentation deemed non-contemporaneous. Interest charged on penalties/payable on refunds. Penalty relief possible via voluntary disclosure (100% or 75% reduction before investigation, 40% after notification, plus 50% for good compliance records).
TPLimitationPeriod: Four years from end of tax year for general assessments, extended to seven years for TP if audit commenced within four years.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: If a methodology has been challenged, there is a high risk that an adjustment will be proposed and a dispute process will commence. Disputes have typically been resolved through settlement before litigation.
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific regulations on TP adjustments. Generally, it should be to a point within the interquartile range.
AuditLikelihood: Unexplained tax losses returned by foreign-owned groups, loans in excess of NZ$10 million principal and guarantee fees, payment of unsustainable levels of royalties and service charges, material associated-party transactions with no- or low-tax jurisdictions (including the use of offshore hubs for marketing, logistics and procurement services), appropriate booking of income arising from e-commerce transactions, supply chain restructures involving the shifting of any major functions, assets or risks away from New Zealand, any unusual arrangements or outcomes that may be identified in controlled foreign company disclosures.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral (binding ruling) and bilateral/multilateral (via MAP). No formal process, pre-application conferences encouraged. Unilateral APAs more common and actively encouraged.
APARollback: No for unilateral APAs, possible for bilateral APAs. Unilateral APA can apply to a tax year in which a tax return has not yet been assessed.
MAPAvailable: Yes, for treaty partners. Taxpayers can request MAP and seek domestic remedies concurrently.
ThinCapRegulations: New Zealand’s thin capitalization rules limit the amount of debt principle a company can have (NZ debt to assets not to exceed greater of 60% and 110% of worldwide debt to assets). Restricted transfer pricing rules apply to intercompany financing, restricting interest deductions, and do not align with OECD Guidelines.

TaxAuthority: Tax Administration of Nicaragua (Dirección General de Ingresos - DGI)
TPLaw: Law No. 822 (Articles 93-106)
TPSection: Articles 93-106 of Law No. 822
DomesticTPObligations: Yes, specifically for related-party transactions between a tax resident under a regular tax regime and an entity operating under a free zone tax regime.
BEPS13Overview: Not adopted BEPS Action 13. No CbCR, Master File. Local File not as part of BEPS Action 13, but documentation is required.
DocRequirements: Yes, regulations in Law No. 822 (effective 30 June 2017). Prepared annually, submitted upon request. Local branches must comply. Stand-alone reports for each entity.
MaterialityThresholds: No financial or other thresholds for TP documentation, CbCR, Master File, Local File, or Economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Spanish) required, or translated by public deed. No safe harbor. Individual testing of transactions preferred. No other disclosure requirements.
TaxReturnDeadline: 28 February (for Dec year-end); two months after fiscal year-end for special periods.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; submitted upon request within 10 days.
TPMethodPreference: No, most appropriate method. Specified methods: CUP, resale price, cost-plus, profit-split, TNMM.
LocalComparables: International comparables accepted due to lack of local financial information.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiple-year testing (three years) applicable for comparables only.
InterquartileRange: No specific guidance, but spreadsheet interquartile range is common practice.
AnnualBenchmarking: Yes, fresh search or financial update required annually.
CompliancePenals: Not specified for non-maintenance-non-furnishing-incomplete furnishing of documentation, CbCR, Master File. Other penalties: 70-90 fine units (US$1 per unit), business closure, loss of tax benefits (Articles 124, 127 NTC).
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, 25% of omitted taxable income if documentation incomplete. No, if non-contemporaneous. Interest on omitted taxable income, not penalties. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Four years, extendable by two additional years for omitted information.
AdjustmentRegulations: None specified.
AuditLikelihood: None specified.
APAAvailable: Yes, an APA program exists, but regulations are not yet enacted.
ThinCapRegulations: No thin capitalization provisions.

TaxAuthority: Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS)
TPLaw: The Income Tax (Transfer Pricing) Regulations, 2018 (new Regulations)
TPSection: Regulation 12 of the Nigerian TP Regulations
BEPS13Overview: The new regulations incorporate the Master File and Local File as recommended under BEPS Action 13 on TP documentation. Also, there are CbCR Regulations enacted in 2018.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation needs to be prepared contemporaneously. It is submitted upon request (within 21 days, or 90 days for transactions below NGN300 million). Local branches-PEs must comply. Documentation is required annually. Stand-alone reports for multiple entities in jurisdiction are not required.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: NGN300 million total intercompany transactions (exemption from contemporaneous documentation, but must prepare within 90 days if requested). CbCR: NGN160 billion for Nigerian-headquartered groups, EUR750 million for MNEs with constituent entities in Nigeria (annual global income-group consolidated turnover). Master File: Not specified. Local File: NGN300 million total controlled transactions (exemption from contemporaneous documentation, but must prepare within 90 days if requested).
SpecificRequirements: English is the official language. No safe harbor. Individual testing is usually preferred, but aggregation is allowed if transactions are closely linked.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, using annual financial statements prepared in accordance with IFRS - IAS 24.
OtherRequiredDocs: TP Disclosure form, TP Declaration form, corporate income tax return (with audited financial statements, income tax computation, E-self-assessment form, and evidence of tax payment).
TaxReturnDeadline: Six months after company's year-end (existing company); six months after year-end or 18 months after incorporation (new company), whichever is earlier.
TPReturnDeadline: Six months after company's year-end (existing company); six months after year-end or 18 months after incorporation (new company), whichever is earlier.
MasterFileDeadline: 21 days upon request (90 days for transactions below NGN300 million). Must be in place prior to TP returns due date.
CbCRDeadline: 12 months after the last day of the MNE group’s accounting year-end.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: No later than the last day of the MNE’s accounting year-end.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Contemporaneously with transactions, prior to the due date of filing the TP returns.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline for submission. Submitted within 21 days upon request (90 days for transactions below NGN300 million).
TPMethodPreference: Yes, traditional methods are preferred over transactional profit methods if reliable information is available.
LocalComparables: FIRS prefers comparables from comparable economies (developing countries of Africa, Middle East, Asia excluding Japan, Hong Kong, China Mainland, and Singapore) due to lack of local data.
SingleYearAnalysis: No specific requirement, but single-year for tested party and multi-year for comparables is common.
InterquartileRange: Yes, interquartile range calculation using spreadsheet quartile formulas is acceptable and considered the arm’s-length range.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, roll over with financial updates for two subsequent years is common, then a fresh search is required.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Comparables must be independent entities, with no shareholder owning more than 25% of the share capital.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance-non-furnishing-incomplete furnishing of documentation: NGN10 million or 1% of controlled transactions (whichever is higher) + NGN10,000 per day. Failure to furnish CbCR: NGN10 million (first instance) + NGN1 million per month. Failure to furnish Master File: NGN10 million or 1% of controlled transactions (whichever is higher) + NGN10,000 per day. Other: Failure to submit TP declaration-notification: NGN10 million + NGN10,000 per day. Failure to update TP declaration: NGN25,000 per day. Failure to make TP disclosure: NGN10 million or 1% of undisclosed controlled transactions (whichever is higher) + NGN10,000 per day. Filing incorrect disclosure: NGN10 million or 1% of incorrectly disclosed controlled transactions (whichever is higher). Failure to comply with notice: NGN10 million or 1% of controlled transactions (whichever is higher) + NGN10,000 per day. Failure to furnish information-document: 1% of value of each controlled transaction + NGN10,000 per day.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No specific penalties for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation. Interest is charged on unpaid taxes, not penalties. Penalty relief is possible via FIRS Board waiver for good cause.
TPLimitationPeriod: Six years. No statute of limitations for criminal tendencies (fraud, negligence, willful default).
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, an adjustment will be proposed based on a different TP methodology.
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific regulations. FIRS usually seeks to adjust to a range between the median and upper quartile.
AuditLikelihood: Yes. Cross-border receipts of services, payments for intangibles, purchases of goods, receipt of loans. Industries: fast-moving consumer goods, shipping, manufacturing, oil and gas exploration, oil servicing, commercial trading. Key transactions: Procurement, intercompany loans, intangibles, shared services, cost contribution arrangements, intragroup services.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral, bilateral, or multilateral APAs are available. Guidelines issued on 27 November 2024, effective 1 January 2025.
APATenure: Three years, renewable for another three years.
APARollback: Yes, up to three years preceding the APA start date, if specific conditions are met.
MAPAvailable: Yes, FIRS issued updated MAP guidelines on 23 May 2023. Accessible to taxpayers and PEs within treaty scope.
ThinCapRegulations: Finance Act 2019 restricts interest deductibility on foreign connected person debt to 30% of EBITDA. Excess interest can be carried forward for five years.

TaxAuthority: Public Revenue Office
TPLaw: Corporate Income Tax (CIT) Law and transfer pricing rulebook
TPSection: Article 16 of the local CIT Law
BEPS13Overview: No
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: Annual turnover of MKD300 million (approx. EUR4.8 million) for documentation; MKD10 million (approx. EUR162,000) for short vs. detailed report.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Macedonian) required. Safe harbor available for intercompany financing arrangements.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, separate note that includes related party transactions is disclosed in the financial statements and annual report.
TaxReturnDeadline: 15 March the following year
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within 15 days of tax authority request
LocalComparables: Yes, local comparables preferred initially, then geographic region expanded.
SingleYearAnalysis: No specific preference, but reason for multiyear must be disclosed.
InterquartileRange: Yes, interquartile range between 25% and 75%.
AnnualBenchmarking: No specific requirements, but practice aligns with OECD guidelines.
CompliancePenals: Penalties for not retaining documentation, failing to provide documentation upon request, and failing to submit the transfer pricing form within the prescribed deadline.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Default daily interest of 0.03% on additional tax liability for each day of delay.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years from the year following the expiration of the statutory term for filing CIT returns. 10 years for tax evasion.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, median value considered market price if transfer price is outside interquartile range.
AuditLikelihood: None specified.
APAAvailable: No
ThinCapRegulations: Interest expense on loans from shareholders (holding >=20% capital) is nondeductible if total loan exceeds three times the shareholder's interest. Does not apply to financial institutions.

TaxAuthority: Norwegian Tax Administration (Skatteetaten - NTA)
TPLaw: General Tax Act (1999) Section 13-1, Tax Assessment Act (2017) Sections 8-11 and 8-12, regulations 8-11-1 to 8-11-16
TPSection: Taxation Act Section 13-1 and Tax Administration Act (2017) Sections 8-11 and 8-12
BEPS13Overview: BEPS Action 13 not formally adopted. CbCR required (NOK6.5bn threshold, effective 2016-01-01, no material differences from OECD). Master File not required. Local File required, OECD format accepted if aligned with Norwegian regulations, with additional specific information (group operational model, history, industry, 3-year financials, service benefit-cost allocation, two-sided FAR, immaterial transactions list, material changes, relevant agreements).
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and need to be prepared contemporaneously, but submitted only upon request. Local branches of foreign companies must comply. Documentation must be prepared annually and retained for 10 years. Stand-alone reports for each entity in an MNE with multiple entities are not required.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Yes, other. Controlled transactions < NOK10 million AND intergroup outstanding values < NOK25 million. Exemption for smaller groups (<250 employees AND (group revenue <= NOK400 million OR balance sheet total <= NOK350 million)).-CbCR: NOK6.5 billion, Annual global income.-Master File: Not applicable.-Local File: Materiality threshold: controlled transactions < NOK10 million AND intergroup outstanding values < NOK25 million. Exemption for smaller groups (<250 employees AND (group revenue <= NOK400 million OR balance sheet total <= NOK350 million)). Metric: Other.-Economic analysis: No financial threshold.
SpecificRequirements: Local language: No (Norwegian, Swedish, Danish or English accepted). Safe harbor: Unspecified. Aggregation: No preference. Other disclosure: No.
CbCRinTaxReturn: Yes. Norwegian entities have to fill in the required CbCR (notification) information about the fiscal year integrated with the tax return before May 31 of the year after the completion of the accounts.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 May
CbCRDeadline: 31 December (12 months after the close of the fiscal year)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Within 45 days upon request (documentation must be prepared contemporaneously)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. 45 days from date of request by NTA.
TPMethodPreference: Yes. Traditional transactional methods (CUP, resale price, cost-plus) generally preferred over profit-based methods (TNMM, profit-split). No specified priority under Norwegian tax law, but methods providing arm's-length results are allowed.
LocalComparables: NTA tends to prefer local or Nordic comparables. Pan-European benchmarks are accepted but often challenged. Secret comparables have been used but not common practice.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear testing, as per common practice, is applicable.
InterquartileRange: No specific requirement, but practice tends toward acceptance of the interquartile range.
AnnualBenchmarking: No need to conduct a fresh search every year, but can be requested. Normal practice is three years with financial update for the two years between.
BenchmarkingType: Weighted average, as per common practice, is applicable.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance-non-furnishing-incomplete documentation: 20% surtax of tax on adjusted amount; additional 20% or 40% for gross negligence. Failure to furnish CbCR: Daily fines of maximum NOK65,700. Failure to furnish Master File: Not applicable. Other penalties: Surtax for incomplete-insufficient information (20%, plus 20-40% for gross negligence). Enforcement fine for not filing CbCR and CbCR notifications.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Incomplete documentation: Yes, surtax (20%, plus 20-40% for gross negligence). Non-contemporaneous documentation: No (penalty only based on adjustment itself). Interest charged: Nondeductible interest is applied. Penalty relief: No (risk reduced by proper documentation; disclosure in tax return may relieve penalties).
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years (general statute of limitations). Documentation must be retained for 10 years.
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific requirement, but practice tends toward the median being most acceptable.
AuditLikelihood: Companies with low-negative margin transacting with foreign related parties, business restructurings, IP transfers, management fees, financial transactions. NTA selects based on tax return info and CbCR.
APAAvailable: Yes, only bilateral APAs, concluded with reference to tax treaty. Procedure follows MAP. Gas sale transactions may be covered under Petroleum Tax Act Section 6 (5) (1).
ThinCapRegulations: No statutory thin capitalization rules. Interest deduction may be denied based on arm's-length principle if equity is insufficient. Interest limitation rules apply. Case law allows interest-free shareholder loans under commercial sound reasons.

TaxAuthority: Oman Tax Authority (OTA)
TPLaw: Income Tax Law (Royal Decree 28-2009, amended by Royal Decree 9-2017, Articles 126-128); Tax Authority Decision 79-2020 (CbCR rules)
TPSection: Income Tax Law (Royal Decree 28-2009, amended by Royal Decree 9-2017), Articles 126-128
BEPS13Overview: Oman has adopted BEPS Action 13 only to the extent of introducing CbCR compliance. Oman has not yet introduced other TP documentation requirements.
DocRequirements: No
MaterialityThresholds: At least OMR300 million consolidated group revenue in the preceding year
SpecificRequirements: Documentation in English is acceptable, but an Arabic version may be requested. Tax returns include some disclosures around related-party transactions.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Largely sourced from financial statements for tax return disclosures.
TaxReturnDeadline: Four months from end of the accounting period
CbCRDeadline: 31 December (no later than 12 months after the last day of the reporting fiscal year)
CbCRNotificationDeadline: 31 December (last day of the reporting period)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: No statutory deadline. Prepared and maintained contemporaneously for submission if requested.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline for submission. Upon tax authority request, within 30 days or as agreed.
LocalComparables: Local comparables are preferred over regional comparables.
SingleYearAnalysis: None specified.
InterquartileRange: None specified.
AnnualBenchmarking: No specific requirement to conduct a fresh benchmarking search every year. Recommended every three years with annual financial updates.
BenchmarkingType: Not specified. Weighted average may be preferred over simple average.
CompliancePenals: No specific penalties for CbCR. General penalties for noncompliance (maximum OMR5,000) could apply for non-submission of CbCR.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No specific penalties for incomplete/non-contemporaneous documentation. Interest not specified. Penalty relief not available.
TPLimitationPeriod: General rules apply: three years from the end of the financial year, or five years in cases of fraud or deception.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Adjustment if deemed not meeting the arm’s-length concept.
AdjustmentRegulations: Not applicable
AuditLikelihood: None specified.
APAAvailable: No
ThinCapRegulations: Interest paid on related-party loans may be deductible if loans do not exceed twice the value of shareholder’s equity (debt-equity ratio 2:1).
PCbCRCriminalRisk: From a minimum of OMR 200 to a maximum of OMR 5,000 / No

TaxAuthority: Federal Board of Revenue (FBR)
TPLaw: Section 108 of 2001 Income Tax Ordinance and 2002 Income Tax Rules (Chapter VIA)
TPSection: Section 108 of 2001 Income Tax Ordinance; Rules 27A-27Q of 2002 Income Tax Rules (Chapter VIA)
BEPS13Overview: Adopted BEPS Action 13, including CbCR, Master File, and Local File requirements.
DocRequirements: Yes, guidelines exist. Master File maintained, Local File prepared contemporaneously and annually. Local branches and multiple entities must comply. Submission upon request.
MaterialityThresholds: Local File: PKR50 million; CbCR: EUR750 million; Master File: PKR100 million (local entity turnover); Economic analysis: No threshold.
SpecificRequirements: No local language; Safe harbor unspecified; No preference for aggregation; No other disclosure.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, in accordance with IFRS or local GAAP.
CbCRinTaxReturn: No, filed along with but not part of the return.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 December (for January to June FY-end)- 30 September (for July to December FY-end)
CbCRDeadline: 12 months after the last day of the reporting fiscal year of the MNE group
CbCRNotificationDeadline: On or before the tax return filing deadline
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within 30 days from the date of the request
TPMethodPreference: Yes, CUP, Resale Price, Cost-plus preferred; Profit-split as a last resort.
LocalComparables: Yes, local comparables are preferred over regional comparables.
SingleYearAnalysis: There is none specified.
InterquartileRange: There is none specified.
AnnualBenchmarking: No specific requirement to conduct a fresh benchmarking search every year. Recommended once every three years, with financial data updated annually.
CompliancePenals: CbCR: PKR2,000-day (min PKR25,000); Master File: PKR25,000 (1st), PKR50,000 (subsequent); Local File: 1% of transaction value. Also Section 182 penalties.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Incomplete documentation: No penalty. Non-contemporaneous: 1% of transaction value. Interest charged on penalties (12% or KIBOR+3%), payable on refunds (KIBOR+0.5%). No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years
AdjustmentRegulations: No such regulations are in place in local tax law.
AuditLikelihood: There is none specified.
APAAvailable: No opportunity to conclude an APA. However, an advance ruling is possible.
MAPAvailable: May be available depending on treaty provisions
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization rules (3:1 foreign debt-to-equity ratio). Section 106A of 2001 Income Tax Ordinance restricts foreign profit on debt deduction to 15% of taxable income (PKR10m de minimis). Higher of 106 or 106A disallowed amount applies. 3-year carry forward for excess.

TaxAuthority: Tax Administration of Panama (Dirección General de Ingresos - DGI)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and Executive Decrees, including Articles 762-A to 762-K of the Tax Fiscal Code and Executive Decree 390.
TPSection: Articles 762-A to 762-K and 762-L of the Tax Fiscal Code, and Articles 1 to 14 of Executive Decree 390.
DomesticTPObligations: Yes, for transactions where one counterparty operates in a preferential tax regime, free zones or special economic areas.
BEPS13Overview: Yes, regarding the Master File and CbC report and notification.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist, must be prepared contemporaneously and annually, applies to local branches, and requires stand-alone reports for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: CbCR: EUR750 million global consolidated gross revenues. No specific financial threshold for TP documentation, Master File, Local File, or Economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Spanish) required. No safe harbor. Individual testing of transactions preferred.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes. Usually, information of type of intercompany transactions, amount and name of the related party is included in the audited financial statements.
TaxReturnDeadline: Within three months of the close of the fiscal year; one-month extension possible. E.g., 31 March (extension possible for 30 April) for fiscal years ending in December.
TPReturnDeadline: Within six months of the close of the Fiscal Year (Form 930).
MasterFileDeadline: Upon request of the Panamanian Tax Administration. Generally, 45 days if requested.
CbCRDeadline: Annually within 12 months of the tax year-end.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Within 12 months of the tax year-end of the multinational group.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: By transfer pricing informative return lodgment date (i.e., within six months of fiscal year-end).
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Upon Tax Authority’s request, within 45 days.
LocalComparables: Under current regulations, local comparables prevail over international comparables. However, due to a lack of information on local comparables, international comparables are well accepted by the tax authorities.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiple-year testing is accepted for the comparables only; in practice, the number of years is three.
InterquartileRange: Yes, the interquartile range calculation with spreadsheet quartile formulas is used.
AnnualBenchmarking: Yes, fresh benchmarking search every year.
BenchmarkingType: Weighted average is common in practice.
CompliancePenals: Failure to file TP return: 1% of total intercompany transactions (max USD1M). Non-maintenance-incomplete documentation (including Master File): USD1,000-USD5,000 and business closure (2-15 days for repeated-persistent failure). Failure to furnish CbCR: USD100,000 plus daily fines; inconsistent-wrong info: USD25,000; maliciously altered: up to USD500,000.
PenaltiesPostAudit: TP income adjustments result in 10% penalty over unpaid taxes, plus 0.8% monthly interest. No specific penalty for incomplete-non-contemporaneous documentation itself, but it leads to adjustments. No penalty relief regime.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years from the date of filing the income tax return. Extended with amended return.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, if the margin or price falls outside the interquartile range, the adjustment should be made to the median of such range (Article 762-F of the Panamanian Tax Code).
AuditLikelihood: None specified.
APAAvailable: Currently, no APA program has been established.
ThinCapRegulations: Not applicable
PCbCRCriminalRisk: Not applicable / Not applicable / Not applicable / Not applicable

TaxAuthority: Internal Revenue Commission (IRC)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings, including Division 15 and 16A of the ITA, and IRC Taxation Circular No. 2011-2
TPStartDate: No date specified for general TP rules; CbCR effective 1 January 2017
TPSection: Section 197D, Division 15
BEPS13Overview: Adopted BEPS Action 13 for CbCR (Articles 3 and 4), including notification and submission. No Master File or Local File requirement.
DocRequirements: Yes, guidelines exist. Not required to be submitted contemporaneously, but recommended. Local branches must comply. No annual preparation requirement, but proper records needed. No stand-alone reports for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: No specific materiality limits for TP documentation or economic analysis, but compliance costs should be proportionate. CbCR threshold is PGK2.3 billion consolidated group revenue.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (English for reports). No safe harbor. No preference for aggregation or individual testing. No other specific disclosure.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Disclosure required in accordance with International Accounting Standard (IAS) 24.
TaxReturnDeadline: 28 February (extensions available)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Upon request (14 days). Exception- management fees exceeding statutory limit must be filed with annual income tax return.
LocalComparables: Because limited local data is available, the use of regional data would be acceptable with appropriate adjustments for local conditions if relevant.
SingleYearAnalysis: As per the circular, multiple-year data analysis should be used.
InterquartileRange: As per the circular, the interquartile range may be used to enhance reliability of the analysis.
AnnualBenchmarking: There is no specific guidance provided. Per the OECD Guidelines, prior-year data may be used, provided it is reasonable to conclude that conditions have not changed.
BenchmarkingType: There is none specified; it depends on the reliability of data.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance-incomplete documentation may lead to penalties if adjustment made. Failure to furnish CbCR- fine up to PGK2 million. Other failures (returns-info)- fines PGK500-PGK5,000 + PGK50-day. Incorrect return- additional tax (double difference), fines PGK1,000-PGK50,000, potential court order for double avoided tax.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No specific penalties for incomplete-non-contemporaneous documentation (general provisions apply). No interest on penalties-refunds. Penalty relief available at Commissioner General's discretion.
TPLimitationPeriod: There generally is no statute of limitations with respect to TP adjustments.
AdjustmentRegulations: There are no specific regulations.
AuditLikelihood: Transactions involving an associated entity resident in a jurisdiction with lower tax rates than PNG, especially if PNG entity has ongoing tax losses.
APAAvailable: The Commissioner General supports having an APA program operating in PNG, but no current APA program exists.
MAPAvailable: MAP opportunities are available under the relevant double tax agreements.
ThinCapRegulations: Where total debt exceeds twice the amount of equity, the interest on the excess debt to the extent it is paid to overseas lenders is non-deductible. The allowable debt-to-equity ratio is 3:1 for resource companies that have fiscal stability agreements.

TaxAuthority: Dirección Nacional de Ingresos Tributarios
TPLaw: "Normas Especiales de Valoración de Operaciones" (Paraguayan Tax Law No. 6380/19, Decree No. 4644/20, and related regulations)
TPSection: Paraguayan Tax Law No. 6380/19, articles 35-39, and regulations
BEPS13Overview: No, but requires Local File following OECD standards with additional content. CbCR and Master File not required.
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: PYG10 billion (approx. USD1.3 million) turnover or operations with tax haven residents. Local File: PYG10 billion annual global income.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Spanish) required. Individual testing preferred. Rejection of comparables with operational losses. Limits on multi-year data for benchmarking. Clarification of related parties based on functional influence. Specific valuation method for agricultural commodities with monthly reporting.
CbCRinTaxReturn: The Paraguayan TP Return includes a section for the CbCR notification.
OtherRequiredDocs: Working papers detailing the analysis and information in the TP Technical Study Report.
TaxReturnDeadline: In April according to the Tax ID number (fourth month after fiscal year-end).
TPReturnDeadline: In July according to the Tax ID number, along with the TP Local File (seventh month after fiscal year-end).
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Along with the TP Local File submission, as part of the TP Return.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: During the seventh month after year-end, depending on the Tax ID Number.
TPMethodPreference: Yes (specific method for agricultural commodities; best method rule applies, but CUP preferred for others).
LocalComparables: Both comparables are allowed.
SingleYearAnalysis: Single year (the one under analysis) is mandatory.
InterquartileRange: Yes
AnnualBenchmarking: Roll-forward of comparable companies and update of the financials using information of the fiscal year under analysis are preferred.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Comparables showing losses in the fiscal year under analysis will be rejected.
CompliancePenals: Formal penalty of up to approximately USD300. Any taxable base amendment is subjected to general fines regime.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation. Interest is charged. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years.
MethodologyScrutiny: No (unknown due to newness of rules).
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: No (possibility considered low due to newness of rules).
AdjustmentRegulations: If the results of the tested party are outside of the interquartile range, the adjustment is to the median of the range.
AuditLikelihood: Agribusiness sector.
APAAvailable: No, but binding consultations are available.
MAPAvailable: Yes (all six double tax treaties include a MAP clause).
ThinCapRegulations: Not applicable

TaxAuthority: National Superintendency of Customs and Tax Administration (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y Administración Tributaria, or SUNAT)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings
TPSection: Article 32 (Item 4) and Article 32-A of the Peruvian Income Tax Law (PITL) and Article 24 and Chapter XIX (Articles 108 to 119) of the PITL
BEPS13Overview: Peru introduced a three-tiered transfer pricing documentation structure (Local File, Master File, CbCR) in December 2016 via Legislative Decree 1312, effective 1 January 2017, aligning with BEPS Action 13.
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: Varies by report type: CbCR PEN2.7bn; Master File PEN107m revenue and PEN2.14m related-party transactions; Local File PEN12.3m revenue and PEN535k-PEN2.1m related-party transactions.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Spanish) required; individual testing of transactions preferred; specific requirements for service deduction (benefit test, supporting documentation, 5% margin for low value-added services); notification for commodity exporters/importers.
RelatedPartyFinancials: In accordance with Peruvian GAAP requirements.
OtherRequiredDocs: Informative Declaration for commodity exporters/importers with each export or import.
TaxReturnDeadline: Mid-June
LocalFilePrepDeadline: June, varies by tax ID number
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: June, varies by tax ID number
LocalComparables: No specific preference; local, regional, and global accepted.
SingleYearAnalysis: Single-year analysis preferred for interquartile range and adjustments.
InterquartileRange: Yes, mandatory for two or more comparable operations.
AnnualBenchmarking: Not explicitly required by regulation, but good practice to update financials annually and conduct fresh searches every two years.
BenchmarkingType: Simple one year results are preferred.
