CompliancePenals: Noncompliance with documentation, CbCR, Master File, or Local File informative return is penalized with a fine of 0.6% of the company’s net income for the previous year, with a minimum of 10% of a tax unit and a maximum of 25 tax units.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Adjustments to annual taxable income are subject to additional penalties of up to 50% of the resulting tax deficiency (income misstatement penalties). Interest is charged on underpayment (10.8% annual) and paid on overpayment (5.04% annual). Penalty relief is available (100%, 80-90%, 50-80% reductions depending on timing).
TPLimitationPeriod: Four years after 1 January of the year that follows the year the annual income tax return is due (generally, 31 March) and six years if returns were never filed.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, transactions outside the interquartile range will be adjusted to the median.
AuditLikelihood: Yes, mining industry.
APAAvailable: Yes
APARollback: Since 1 January 2025, roll-back provisions are available only in bilateral APAs.
MAPAvailable: Yes, under DTTs; no specific domestic provisions.
ThinCapRegulations: PITL limits interest deduction. Up to 31 Dec 2020: 3:1 debt-to-equity ratio. From 1 Jan 2021: interest exceeding 30% of EBITDA is not deductible, with a four-year carry-forward.

TaxAuthority: Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings, including RR No. 2-2013 (TP Guidelines) and RR No. 34-2020
BEPS13Overview: Not adopted BEPS Action 13. CbCR and Master File not required. Local File required.
DocRequirements: Yes, prepared contemporaneously. Applicable to local branches. Not strictly annual, updates sufficient. No stand-alone reports for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: Annual gross sales > PHP150M AND total RPTs > PHP90M; OR tangible goods sales > PHP60M; OR services, interest, intangibles RPTs > PHP15M; OR TPD required in prior year.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement. No preference for aggregation/individual testing. Safe harbor unspecified.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, in notes to audited financial statements. Non-filers of RPT Form must disclose non-coverage.
OtherRequiredDocs: TP documentation and supporting documents, upon request during audit (within 30 days, non-extendible).
TaxReturnDeadline: 15th day of the 4th month following close of taxable year (e.g., April 15 for calendar year)
TPReturnDeadline: 15th day of the 4th month following close of taxable year (e.g., April 15 for calendar year); eFPS filers within 15 days from statutory due date or actual e-filing of ITR, whichever is later.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within 30 calendar days from receipt of request during a tax audit (non-extendible).
TPMethodPreference: No, most appropriate method used (OECD methods adopted).
LocalComparables: No legal requirement, but local comparables preferred by BIR. Asia-Pacific acceptable if no local available.
SingleYearAnalysis: Regulations silent, but Audit Guidelines suggest multi-year data.
InterquartileRange: Suggested by Audit Guidelines to enhance reliability.
AnnualBenchmarking: Not strictly required annually; updates of financials sufficient if operating conditions unchanged.
BenchmarkingType: Not specified; simple or weighted average may be used.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Audit Guidelines provide selection criteria (e.g., independence, revenue level).
CompliancePenals: Non-submission of TPD upon request: fine PHP5,000-PHP10,000 and 1-2 years imprisonment. General Tax Code penalties apply for non-compliance.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No specific penalty for incomplete documentation. Deficiency assessment incurs 25% surcharge (50% for fraud) and 12% interest p.a.
TPLimitationPeriod: 3 years from filing return; 10 years from discovery of fraud.
AdjustmentRegulations: None specified.
AuditLikelihood: None specified.
APAAvailable: Available in principle, but no specific guidelines issued yet.
APATenure: Not applicable. APA guidelines have not been issued.
APARollback: Not applicable. APA guidelines have not been issued.
MAPAvailable: Yes, guidelines issued via RR No. 10-2022.
ThinCapRegulations: No formal thin capitalization rules. TP Audit Guidelines test arm's-length nature of debt-to-equity ratio and interest rates for intragroup loans.

TaxAuthority: Tax Inspection Department in the Ministry of Finance, National Revenue Administration (Krajowa Administracja Skarbowa - KAS)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts, Tax Ordinance Act, APA Act, and numerous Minister of Finance Decrees and Information on TP documentation, methods, and harmful tax competition.
TPSection: Tax Ordinance Act, dated 29 August 1997: Article 58a-c; Corporate Income Tax (CIT) Act, dated 15 February 1992: Article 11a - 11t; Personal Income Tax (PIT) Act, dated 26 July 1991: Article 23m - 23zf; Act on the settlement of disputes regarding double taxation and the conclusion of APAs, dated 16 October 2019: Article 61 - 71 and 81 - 107
DomesticTPObligations: Yes - In 2019, domestic transactions are excluded as long as they fulfill the requirements listed in Article 11n of the CIT Act.
OECDGuidelines: Largely - Poland is a member of the OECD. The Polish tax authorities sometimes refer to the OECD Guidelines when applying transfer pricing principles. The transfer pricing methods presented in the Polish rules are based on the authorized OECD approach.
BEPS13Overview: Poland has adopted and implemented Action 13, with some specific and more extensive local requirements. CbCR is mandatory for groups with consolidated revenues-costs > EUR750M (effective 2017), no material differences from OECD. Master File is mandatory for groups with consolidated revenues > PLN200M (approx. USD50M) (effective 2017), with additional detailed content requirements. Local File is mandatory for controlled transactions exceeding specific thresholds (effective 2017), with material differences including a new TPR-C form requiring financial data, benchmarking comparison, and management board confirmation of arm's length prices and correct preparation, plus more detailed content requirements.
BEPS13PenaltyProtection: No - BEPS Action 13 does not fully cover explicit Local File requirements based on tax authority’s practice, e.g., Master File requires detailed seat or place of management address.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and must be prepared contemporaneously (Local File within 10 months, Master File within 12 months of fiscal year-end). Local branches must comply. Documentation must be updated annually (benchmarking every 3 years). Stand-alone reports are required per entity and per fiscal year.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Yes, based on value of international transactions. CbCR: EUR750M consolidated revenues-costs. Master File: PLN200M consolidated revenues (approx. USD50M), plus other conditions. Local File: PLN10M (commodity-financial), PLN2M (services, branches, immaterial values, other), PLN2.5M (financial with tax havens), PLN0.5M (other with tax havens). Economic analysis: Yes, mandatory for transactions meeting Local File threshold.
SpecificRequirements: Local File in Polish (Master File upon request with 30 days for translation). Safe harbors for low-value-added services (5% markup-markdown) and loans (specific base rates + 2.0% min lender margin, 2.6% max borrower margin). Individual testing of transactions, but compensation between transactions with the same related party is allowed.
TPReturn: Yes - A new TPR-C form was introduced in 2019, to be filed electronically within 11 months from year-end, including detailed transaction information, benchmarking results, and a management board statement confirming correct Local File preparation and arm's-length prices.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: Yes - Information about related-party transactions is part of the annual income tax return. Taxpayers must disclose if TP documentation was required, report agreements with non-residents (ORD-U form, repealed if TPR-C filed), provide IFT-2-IFT-2 form for payments to non-residents, and submit APA-C progress reports if an APA is obtained.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes - According to the Polish Accounting Act, information regarding transactions with related entities must be presented in note 7 of the financial statement.
CbCRinTaxReturn: No - CbCR notification is a separate document.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 March if financial year is the same as calendar year (three months from fiscal year-end).
TPReturnDeadline: 30 November if financial year is the same as calendar year (11 months from fiscal year-end for TPR-C form).
MasterFileDeadline: Not applicable - Master File must be prepared within 12 months from fiscal year-end, not submitted.
CbCRDeadline: 31 December if financial year is the same as calendar year (12 months from fiscal year-end).
CbCRNotificationDeadline: 31 March if financial year is the same as calendar year (three months from fiscal year-end).
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Within 10 months after year-end (for FY 2022 and following years).
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No - Must be provided within seven-14 days upon tax authority request.
TPMethodPreference: No - Taxpayers can choose the most appropriate method from CUP, resale price, cost-plus, profit-split, TNMM, or other valuation methods if these are not possible. The division of methods into two groups was terminated in 2019.
LocalComparables: Since 1 January 2019, there is no indication that benchmarking analysis should cover local entities. However, in paneuropean samples the tax authorities seek for Polish comparables.
SingleYearAnalysis: There is a preference for multiyear testing although not expressed in the regulations. EY Poland usually provides a three-year or five-year analysis.
InterquartileRange: There is no formal requirement to determine a particular point in the range, but generally, the interquartile range is a starting point to consider the arm’s-length price.
AnnualBenchmarking: Fresh benchmarking does not need to be conducted every year, but financial data for the final sample is recommended to be updated annually. A fresh benchmark is required every three years or in case of significant change in the economic environment.
BenchmarkingType: There is a preference for the weighted average for arm’s-length analysis (not mentioned in the regulations).
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Taxpayers should present financial indicators both accepted and rejected during the preparation of benchmarking analysis. Taxpayers are obligated to present part of the information used for benchmarking analysis in electronic form.
CompliancePenals: Penalties for non-maintenance-non-furnishing-incomplete-false-late documentation or statements: fine up to 720 daily rates (approx. EUR9.9M) or 240 daily rates (approx. EUR3.3M) depending on specific offense (KKS Articles 56c, 80, 80d, 80e, 84). Additional penalty tax rate of 10% (doubled-tripled under certain conditions) on understated profit-overstated loss (Tax Ordinance Act Article 58b). Risk of personal penal responsibility for board members-tax representatives.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes - Penalties for incomplete-non-contemporaneous documentation (treated as unreliable-false) can be up to 720 daily rates (approx. EUR9.9M). Interest charged on penalties (currently 15%). Penalty relief available if documentation is supplemented within 14 days of request.
TPLimitationPeriod: The general statute of limitations for tax assessment applies: five years from the end of the calendar year in which the tax falls due (Tax Ordinance Act, Article 70 Section 1).
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes - TP methodologies are highly scrutinized, especially for large taxpayers with specific financial positions (e.g., losses, low profitability). Tax authorities use the Orbis database and TPR-C forms to identify audit targets. The 2019 rules allow recharacterization or non-existence declaration of transactions.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes - Consequences can include an adjustment, recharacterization of a transaction, or declaring a transaction nonexistent.
AdjustmentRegulations: There is no specific regulation on transfer pricing adjustment to any point in the market range; however, the key aspect is to remain within the market range and be able to justify any targeted point within that range.
AuditLikelihood: No particular industry focus. Authorities use an automated approach, reviewing TPR-C forms to find loss makers, limited risk companies with variable results, high spending on intragroup services, free-of-charge guarantees-sureties, fluctuating net results, significant revenue decreases, new material transactions, and changes in TP models.
APAAvailable: Yes - Unilateral, bilateral, and multilateral APAs are available with no transaction value limits. Fees range from PLN5,000 to PLN200,000. Unilateral APAs are issued within 6 months, bilateral within 12 months, and multilateral within 18 months.
APATenure: No longer than five years, extendable for another five years.
APARollback: Yes - An APA may cover the year the APA application is submitted.
MAPAvailable: Yes - Taxpayers may request a MAP if taxation is not in accordance with a DTT, to be submitted no later than three years from delivery of control protocol or tax decision.
ThinCapRegulations: Taxpayers must confirm arm's-length conditions for prices, including interest rates. New regulations (from 2019) allow tax authorities to recharacterize transactions (e.g., debt to equity) if unrelated parties would not have concluded them, based on Article 11c of the CIT Act. This necessitates debt capacity analysis.
PCbCRRegulations: Polish Accounting Act, dated 29 September 1994 (Journal of Laws 2023, Item 120, as amended)
PCbCRSection: Articles 63l-o of the Polish Accounting Act
PCbCRMaterialityExemptions: No - Applicability depends on specific thresholds for Polish parent companies, subsidiaries, or branches based on consolidated revenues and EEA presence.
PCbCRLodgmentPossible: Yes - PCbCR may be prepared by a highest-level parent company.
PCbCRLodgmentFormat: Yes - The PCbCR report is prepared in Polish, but this is not required if the highest-level parent entity's report is available free of charge in electronic, machine-readable format on its website in an official EEA language for at least five years.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: Within 12 months from the year-end date.
PCbCRMaxPenalties: Penalty of fine (even up to PLN2 million) and/or deprivation of liberty.
PCbCRCriminalRisk: Yes - A manager may face imprisonment for up to two years for infringement of PCbCR obligations.

TaxAuthority: Portuguese Tax and Customs Authority (Autoridade Tributária e Aduaneira)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and Decree-Rulings (e.g., CIT Code Articles 63, 130, 121-A, 121-B, 138; Law No. 119/2019; Decree-Ruling 268/2021; Decree-Ruling 267/2021)
TPStartDate: Law No. 119/2019 (18 September 2019); Decree-Ruling 268/2021 (27 November 2021); Decree-Ruling 267/2021 (27 November 2021)
TPSection: Article 63(4) of the Corporate Income Tax Code (CITC) defines "special relationship" for applicability.
BEPS13Overview: Yes, adopted BEPS Action 13, requiring CbCR, Master File, and Local File.
DocRequirements: Yes, guidelines exist; documentation must be prepared contemporaneously and annually; local branches must comply; stand-alone reports required for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: EUR10 million total annual income (with exemptions for transactions under EUR100,000 per counterparty and EUR500,000 total). CbCR: EUR750 million annual global income. Master File/Local File: EUR10 million total annual income.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Portuguese) required, but foreign language submission can be requested. Safe harbor for transactions under EUR100,000 per counterparty and EUR500,000 total if EUR10M income threshold is met. Individual testing preferred. Third-party statement of responsibility for technical studies.
TPReturn: Yes, via annexes (A, B, C, H) of the Annual Tax and Accounting Information Return (IES).
CbCRinTaxReturn: No, but submitted on the same date as the corporate tax return.
TaxReturnDeadline: Last day of the fifth month following tax year-end (e.g., 31 May for calendar year-end).
TPReturnDeadline: 15th day of the seventh month after the end of the fiscal year (e.g., 15 July for calendar year-end).
MasterFileDeadline: 15th day of the seventh month after the end of the fiscal year (for Large Taxpayers Unit).
CbCRDeadline: End of the 12th month following the fiscal year-end (e.g., 31 December for calendar year-end).
CbCRNotificationDeadline: End of the fifth month following the fiscal year-end (e.g., 31 May for calendar year-end).
LocalFilePrepDeadline: 15th day of the seventh month following the fiscal year-end.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: 15th day of the seventh month after the end of the fiscal year (for Large Taxpayers Unit); 10 days upon tax authority request.
LocalComparables: Yes, local comparables preferred, then Iberian, then European.
SingleYearAnalysis: Tested party's single-year results against multiple-year interquartile ranges.
InterquartileRange: Yes, spreadsheet interquartile range calculations are used.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, valid for three years with financial updates, provided facts and circumstances haven't materially changed and 20% independence threshold is met annually.
CompliancePenals: Failure to comply with documentation shifts burden of proof and allows secret comparables. CbCR-Master File-TP documentation non-submission: EUR500-EUR20,000 fine + 5% daily interest. Other penalties under RGIT: late delivery (up to EUR20,000), omission-lack of evidence in IES (up to EUR45,000), improper fulfillment (up to EUR75,000), refusal to submit (up to EUR150,000).
PenaltiesPostAudit: No penalty for incomplete documentation (but general tax penalty regime applies to adjustments, plus late-payment interest). Yes for non-contemporaneous documentation. Interest charged on penalties (5% daily interest for late submission). No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Four years after the end of the assessment year.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, adjustments are typically to the median.
AuditLikelihood: Yes, recurrent loss-making companies with cross-border transactions, contradictions in IES, low profitability-high public exposure companies, financial transactions (cash pooling, guarantees), restructuring operations.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral, bilateral, and multilateral APAs are available.
APARollback: Yes, up to two years under certain conditions.
MAPAvailable: Yes, under double tax treaties and EU Arbitration Convention.
ThinCapRegulations: Debt/equity rules according to OECD Transfer Pricing Guidance on Financial Transactions.
PCbCRAuthority: Portuguese Tax and Customs Authority (Autoridade Tributária e Aduaneira)
PCbCRStartDate: Financial years starting on or after 22 June 2024
PCbCRIncomeThreshold: EUR750 million or more in each of the last two financial years.
PCbCRMaterialityExemptions: No, but exemption if non-EU UPE publishes an equivalent report.
PCbCRAggregationAllowed: Yes, partly. Disaggregated for EU Member States and non-EU non-cooperative jurisdictions; aggregated for other jurisdictions.
PCbCRLodgmentPossible: Yes, by publishing on the website of the ultimate parent (or subsidiary/branch).
PCbCRLodgmentOtherJurisdiction: Yes, if UPE files on its website using EU Directive format.
PCbCRLodgmentFormat: No, but must be in machine-readable electronic format on the company's website.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: Within 12 months after the balance sheet date of the fiscal year to which the report relates.

TaxAuthority: Puerto Rico Department of the Treasury (Departamento de Hacienda de Puerto Rico)
TPLaw: Regulations under Section 1047 of the Puerto Rico Internal Revenue Code of 1994 (1994 Code), continuing under the 2011 Code.
TPSection: Articles 1047-1 through 1047-4 of the 1994 Code Regulations, regulating Section 1040.09 of the 2011 Code.
BEPS13Overview: Not adopted BEPS Action 13; CbCR, Master File, and Local File are not required.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and must be prepared contemporaneously. Local branches must comply. Annual preparation is not strictly required if facts haven't substantially changed, but Form AS 6175 must be filed annually.
MaterialityThresholds: No specific financial thresholds for TP documentation, CbCR, Master File, Local File, or Economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (English or Spanish accepted). Safe harbor unspecified. No preference for aggregation or individual testing. No other specific disclosure.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: No, but group identification number and general information about related parties are required in the corporate tax return.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, in footnotes to audited financial statements if business volume is USD10 million or more (group combined).
TaxReturnDeadline: 15 April for calendar year-end; 15th day of the fourth month following fiscal year-end. Six-month extension available.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: By corporate tax return submission deadline.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Form AS 6175 filed with tax return; TP study issued by tax return due date. If requested, within 30 calendar days.
LocalComparables: Not specified, reference to US Code Section 482.
SingleYearAnalysis: Not specified, reference to US Code Section 482.
InterquartileRange: Not specified, reference to US Code Section 482.
AnnualBenchmarking: Not specified, reference to US Code Section 482.
BenchmarkingType: Not specified, reference to US Code Section 482.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Not specified, reference to US Code Section 482.
CompliancePenals: Non-deductibility of intercompany expenses if Form AS 6175 not filed. Penalties of 20% or 40% for gross valuation misstatements, 100% for fraud.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation. No interest on penalties. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Four years after filing income tax return, or six years if 25% or more of income is omitted.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, adjustments can be proposed, though uncommon.
AdjustmentRegulations: None specified.
AuditLikelihood: Large taxpayers and entities under special tax regimes, but general audit risk is low.
APAAvailable: Not applicable
ThinCapRegulations: None, but US rules and jurisprudence may be used as persuasive evidence.

TaxAuthority: Tax Administration of Serbia
TPLaw: CIT Law Articles 59-62 and Transfer Pricing Rulebook
TPSection: Article 59 of the CIT Law
BEPS13Overview: Not adopted BEPS Action 13, but requires CbCR (FY 2020, EUR750M threshold, OECD format). Master File and Local File not required.
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: RSD8 million (approx EUR68,000) turnover for abbreviated report. CbCR: EUR750 million annual global income.
SpecificRequirements: Local language requirement: Yes. Safe harbor available: Yes (for intercompany loans). Aggregation or individual testing: No preference.
TaxReturnDeadline: 180 days from the date of expiration of the period for which the tax is assessed.
TPReturnDeadline: Same as corporate income tax return (180 days from period expiration)
CbCRDeadline: 12 months from the end of the MNE group’s reporting financial year
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: With corporate income tax return (180 days from period expiration)
LocalComparables: Foreign comparables are accepted for the purpose of a benchmark analysis if no local comparables can be identified.
SingleYearAnalysis: Use of a multiyear analysis is mandatory.
InterquartileRange: Use of the interquartile range is mandatory for TNMM and for R- and C+ when external comparables are used.
AnnualBenchmarking: Not explicitly prescribed; roll-forward or fresh searches accepted in practice.
BenchmarkingType: Application of the weighted average for arm’s-length analysis is mandatory.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Independence of a company is evaluated by related-party rules stating that an entity shall be considered a related party if it has 25% of shares or votes of the taxpayer. Also, a related party is considered to be a person closely related to the taxpayer or an entity registered in a tax haven.
CompliancePenals: Penalties for failure to submit TP documentation upon official request (30-90 days deadline) range from RSD100,000 to RSD2 million for legal entities, and up to RSD100,000 for individuals. No immediate penalties for incomplete documentation.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Possible adjustment of taxable income may result in a penalty of up to 30% of understated tax liabilities and increased interest for late tax payments. Interest is charged at yearly rate set by National Bank of Serbia + 10%. Penalty relief not available.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years, starting from the beginning of the year following the year in which the respective tax liability arose.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, if margin is outside market range, adjustment to median value of the range.
AuditLikelihood: Management and consulting services; large taxpayers.
APAAvailable: No
ThinCapRegulations: Article 62 of the CIT Law. Debt-to-equity ratio of 4:1 (10:1 for financial institutions). Interest on debt exceeding this ratio is non-deductible.

TaxAuthority: National Agency for Fiscal Administration (ANAF), part of the Ministry of Public Finance
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts, Government Decisions, ANAF Orders, and Fiscal Procedure Code, including specific orders for TP documentation, APAs, CbCR, and PCbCR implementation.
TPSection: Law 227/ 2015 regarding the Fiscal Code; Government Decision 1/ 2016; ANAF Order 442/ 2016; ANAF Order 3737/ 2015; ANAF Order 3735/ 2015; ANAF Order 3736/ 2015; Law 207/ 2015; ANAF Order 3049/ 2017; Order 2048/ 2022; Order 1730/ 2023.
BEPS13Overview: Romania has adopted BEPS Action 13. Regulations were amended in 2016 to align with Master File and Local File content recommendations. CbCR is required for MNE groups with consolidated income exceeding EUR750 million, effective 1 January 2016. Master File and Local File content requirements are aligned with BEPS Action 13, though no specific format is prescribed.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation must be prepared contemporaneously by large taxpayers, annually for certain thresholds, and upon request for others. Local branches must comply. Stand-alone reports are required for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Yes, thresholds for intercompany transactions (cumulative annual value, excluding VAT): EUR50,000 for financial services interest, EUR50,000 for services, EUR100,000 for tangible/intangible asset acquisitions-sales. CbCR: EUR750 million consolidated income. Master File: Same thresholds as TP documentation. Local File: Same thresholds as TP documentation. Economic analysis: No specific financial threshold.
SpecificRequirements: Yes, local language (Romanian) is required for documentation and appendices. Unspecified safe harbor. Individual testing of transactions is preferred. No other specific disclosure or compliance requirements.
RelatedPartyFinancials: For statutory accounting reporting purposes, Romanian companies are required to disclose the transactions undertaken with related parties in financial statements.
CbCRinTaxReturn: No. A dedicated CbCR notification form is required to be separately submitted.
OtherRequiredDocs: Disclosure of transactions with non-residents subject to withholding tax; disclosure-registration of contracts with non-residents that may trigger PE; disclosure of long-term financing with non-residents.
TaxReturnDeadline: 25 March (or 25th day of the sixth month after tax year-end for 2021-2025)
CbCRDeadline: 31 December (within 12 months from the last day of the reporting fiscal year)
CbCRNotificationDeadline: 25 March (no later than the last day of filing the annual corporate income tax return for the preceding year)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: By tax return lodgment date (for large taxpayers with annual documentation obligation); otherwise, upon request (30-60 days, extendable by 30 days).
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No
TPMethodPreference: Upon request: within 10 calendar days for annual documentation by large taxpayers; 30-60 days (extendable by 30 days) for other cases.
LocalComparables: Yes
SingleYearAnalysis: Yes. Local, then EU, then pan-European, then international.
InterquartileRange: Yes. Single-year testing is preferred; multiyear analysis might be acceptable if properly justified.
AnnualBenchmarking: Yes. Interquartile range is prescribed.
BenchmarkingType: A fresh benchmarking search is required periodically; a roll-forward or update of financial results of a prior study might also be acceptable for a certain period, depending on the circumstances.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: No preference is indicated. Both simple-average and weighted-average methods have been accepted in case of multiyear analyses.
CompliancePenals: Search strategy should incorporate independence criteria as per Romanian legislation (e.g., no known shareholder controlling-owning directly-indirectly more than 25% interest in both accepted company and another company).
PenaltiesPostAudit: Non-submission-incomplete documentation: RON25,000-RON27,000 (approx. EUR5,000-EUR5,400) for large taxpayers outside audit; RON12,000-RON14,000 (approx. EUR2,400-EUR2,800) for large-medium taxpayers during audit; RON2,000-RON3,500 (approx. EUR400-EUR700) for small taxpayers during audit. Failure to furnish CbCR: RON30,000-RON50,000 (approx. EUR6,000-EUR10,000) for late-incorrect-incomplete submission; RON70,000-RON100,000 (approx. EUR14,000-EUR20,000) for non-submission. Master File: Not applicable (not formally separated). Other penalties: General penalties for not filing required information (EUR110-EUR3,100).
TPLimitationPeriod: Yes, if documentation is deemed incomplete, tax authority may adjust to median. This triggers 16% profits tax, 0.02% daily late-payment interest, and 0.01% daily late-payment penalties (or 0.08% daily penalty for undeclared-incorrectly declared tax liabilities, reduced by 75% if paid promptly, increased by 100% for tax evasion). Yes, if documentation is deemed non-contemporaneous, penalties as per 8a apply for large taxpayers. No, interest is not charged on penalties or payable on a refund. No, penalty relief cannot be obtained, but decisions can be challenged or MAP initiated.
MethodologyScrutiny: Five years (or 10 years in case of fiscal evasion or fraud).
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes
AuditLikelihood: Yes, adjustments are made to the median of the interquartile range; for a set of up to three comparables, the simple average is used.
APAAvailable: Management or group fees, royalties, loss-situations or deemed low return taxpayers, business restructuring cases.
APATenure: Yes, comprehensive APA procedures available since June 2007 (unilateral, bilateral, multilateral). Fees apply (EUR20,000-EUR10,000 for issuance, EUR15,000-EUR6,000 for amendment).
APARollback: Up to five years, extendable in certain cases.
ThinCapRegulations: Yes, MAP is available under Romanian Tax Procedure Code, based on DTTs, EU Arbitration Convention, or EU Tax Dispute Resolution Directive. Application deadline is stipulated by relevant instrument.
PCbCRApplies: Exceeding borrowing costs (exceeding interest revenues) are deductible up to 30% of adjusted EBITDA, with a EUR1 million annual threshold. Non-deductible costs can be carried forward indefinitely. For related party financing, a new limitation rule from 2024 sets a deductible threshold of up to EUR500,000 for exceeding borrowing costs not financing asset acquisition-production.
PCbCRStartDate: Accounting Regulations (Order 1802/2016, Order 2844/2016, as amended by Order 2048/2022 and Order 1730/2023).
PCbCRIncomeThreshold: Chapter 131 of Order 1802/2016; Chapter 81 of Order 2844/2016.
PCbCRMaterialityExemptions: RON3,700 million (for non-EU-EEA headquartered MNEs, for each of the last two financial years).
PCbCRDataSources: Yes, information is disclosed separately for EU-EEA and EU non-cooperative jurisdictions; aggregated data for all other jurisdictions. Romania allows deferral of commercially sensitive information for up to five years, except for blacklisted jurisdictions.
PCbCRLodgmentPossible: Accounting Regulations in Romania and additional public communications from the Romanian authorities.
PCbCRLodgmentOtherJurisdiction: Yes, lodgment with the Trade Registry and publication on the reporting entity's website are required. A new form (S1079) for lodgment was issued by ANAF in 2025, but instructions are pending.
PCbCRLodgmentFormat: Yes, an exemption from lodgment in Romania is possible if PCbCR is published by a non-EU-EEA ultimate parent on its website in a machine-readable format and an EU official language, and identifies a single EU subsidiary-branch that has published it.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: No, but information must be disclosed using a common template and machine-readable electronic formats established by the European Commission (Regulation 2024/2952, applicable from 1 January 2025).
PCbCRMaxPenalties: Within 12 months from the date of the consolidated financial statement for the financial year subject to reporting. First publication by 31 December 2024 for groups with calendar financial year ended 31 December 2023.
PCbCRCriminalRisk: Not applicable. No specific provisions on penalties for noncompliance with PCbCR rules at this stage. Implications are of a different nature (e.g., note in financial auditor's report, management liability). / No

TaxAuthority: Rwanda Revenue Authority (RRA)
TPLaw: Article 32 of the Rwanda Income Tax Act and the Rwanda Ministerial Order Establishing General Rules on Transfer Pricing (transfer pricing rules) enacted 14 December 2020
TPSection: Related people are defined under Article 3 of the Rwanda Income Tax Act.
BEPS13Overview: Jurisdiction has not adopted BEPS Action 13 but requires CbCR (effective 14 Dec 2020, no material differences from OECD format). Master File and Local File are not required.
BEPS13PenaltyProtection: Yes. Additional information is, however, required based on the transfer pricing rules.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously prepared, submitted upon request (7 days). Annual requirement, prior to income tax declaration deadline. Stand-alone reports for MNEs with multiple entities. Local branches must comply.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Yes, turnover below RWF600 million exempt from documentation preparation. CbCR: Applicable where ultimate parent prepares report. Master File/Local File: Not applicable/Not specified.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (English, French, Kinyarwanda acceptable, English in practice). Individual transaction testing preferred. Safe harbor unspecified. No other disclosure.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 March
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Upon request, within seven days.
LocalComparables: There is a preference for local comparables; however, it is not mandatory.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multi-year (weighted average) preferred
InterquartileRange: Interquartile range calculation using spreadsheet quartile formulas is acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: A fresh benchmarking search is needed every year.
BenchmarkingType: There is a preference for the weighted average for arm’s-length analysis.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: If the relevant financial indicator falls outside the arm’s-length range, the taxable profit is computed on the basis that the relevant financial indicator is the median of the arm’s-length range.
CompliancePenals: No specific penalties prescribed.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No penalty for incomplete/non-contemporaneous documentation. No interest on penalties/refunds. Penalty relief not available.
TPLimitationPeriod: A general rule of five years from the date of filing the tax return applies. The tax authorities can ignore the five-year limitation when they suspect fraud or the intention to evade the payment of tax.
AdjustmentRegulations: Not applicable
AuditLikelihood: No active TP audits yet, but recent tax procedure introduced TP audits.
APAAvailable: APAs are not available.
MAPAvailable: Yes, in the context of double tax treaties.
ThinCapRegulations: Interest and realized foreign exchange losses arising from loans between related parties either paid or due on a total loan that is greater than four times the amount of equity is nondeductible.
PCbCR_BEPS13Alignment: Yes. Rwanda is implementing PCbCR as part of BEPS Action 13, requiring public disclosure of global tax activities.
PCbCRLodgmentPossible: Yes. Annex showing total value of each type of transaction purchased from or sold to related party must be filled annually.
PCbCRLodgmentFormat: Yes. Annex showing total value of each type of transaction purchased from or sold to related party must be filed annually.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: End of three months after end of accounting period

TaxAuthority: Zakat, Tax and Customs Authority (ZATCA)
TPLaw: KSA Income Tax Law (ITL), Zakat Bylaws, and Transfer Pricing Bylaws (issued 31 January 2019)
TPSection: Article 63 of the KSA ITL, Article 10 of Zakat Bylaws and the transfer pricing bylaws issued on 15 February 2019
BEPS13Overview: The transfer pricing bylaws have introduced transfer pricing documentation (Master File, Local File) and CbCR requirements. It is worth highlighting that KSA LF requirements are more detailed than OECD’s Action 13 approach for LF.
DocRequirements: Yes, guidelines exist. Documentation must be prepared contemporaneously and submitted within 30 days upon ZATCA's request. Local branches must comply. Annual preparation is required. Stand-alone reports for multiple entities in jurisdiction are not required.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: No financial threshold, but advisable for all RPTs. CbCR: Global consolidated revenue > SAR3.2 billion (approx. EUR750 million). Master File/Local File: Total RPTs > SAR6 million (tax entities) or > SAR100 million (100% Zakat entities).
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (Arabic recommended). No safe harbor. Aggregation of transactions allowed if economically linked. Dual CbCR notification required (disclosure form and AEOI portal) within 120 days of year-end.
OtherRequiredDocs: An annual affidavit signed by a licensed auditor certifying consistent application of the MNE group's transfer pricing policy.
TaxReturnDeadline: 120 days of the end of the financial year
TPReturnDeadline: 120 days of the end of the financial year
MasterFileDeadline: 30 days upon request by tax authorities
CbCRDeadline: Within 12 months from the end of the reporting year of the MNE group
CbCRNotificationDeadline: 120 days of the end of the financial year
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within 30 days upon request by tax authorities
LocalComparables: Yes, local comparables are preferred. Foreign comparables can be used if domestic ones are absent, with adjustments for geographic and other factors.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiple-year analysis for comparable companies is acceptable (preferably three years).
InterquartileRange: The interquartile range is considered to be the appropriate approach for determining the arm’s-length range.
AnnualBenchmarking: Comparability analyses required on a three-year basis if no change in conditions; financial update of analysis required annually.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Secret comparables cannot be used. Comparable persons should not report losses. Full range is not acceptable.
CompliancePenals: No specific TP penalties; general ITL penalties apply for non-maintenance/non-furnishing/incomplete documentation, CbCR, and Master File.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No specific penalty for incomplete documentation, but general ITL penalties apply. Penalty applicable if documentation is non-contemporaneous (general ITL penalties apply). No interest charged on penalties/refunds. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: General statute of limitations is five years from the tax declaration deadline. Ten years if tax return not filed, or incomplete/incorrect with intent of tax evasion.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, with high risk if documentation is inadequate.
AdjustmentRegulations: Median is preferred.
AuditLikelihood: Corporate taxpayers with high amounts of related-party transactions and loss-making scenarios.
APAAvailable: Yes, effective for tax/Zakat years beginning on or after 01/01/2024.
ThinCapRegulations: Interest deduction ceiling rule in KSA corporate tax law, limiting deductibility to the lower of interest charged and income from loan fees plus 50% of (Income subject to tax less interest income - Expenses allowable for tax purposes less interest expense). This is an overall deduction rule, not specific to related-party transactions.

TaxAuthority: The General Directorate of Taxes and Domains (Direction Générale des Impôts et Domaine - DGID)
TPLaw: Various articles of the Senegal General Tax Code (Articles 17, 31bis, 31ter, 638, 639, 9-2, 667-III.a, 667-III.c, 667-III.b)
TPSection: Book 1: Direct and assimilated taxes, Title 1: Income taxes, Chapter 1: Taxes on the profits of companies and other legal entities, Section 2: Taxable Profits, Subsection 2 Transfer Pricing
BEPS13Overview: Senegal has adopted BEPS Action 13 for transfer pricing documentation (TP return, CbCR, Master File, Local File). No material differences from OECD format specified.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist. Not submitted contemporaneously, but upon request (20-day period). Local branches must comply. Not required annually, but prepared contemporaneously. Stand-alone reports for each entity in an MNE.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation, Master File, Local File: Turnover or gross assets >= XOF5 billion. CbCR: Annual global income >= XOF492 billion. No specific threshold for economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: Local language requirement: French. Safe harbor: Unspecified. Aggregation or individual testing: No preference. No other disclosure or compliance requirement.
CbCRinTaxReturn: Yes, if the Senegalese entity is not the ultimate parent entity (UPE) or surrogate parent entity (SPE)
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 April
MasterFileDeadline: By time of tax audit (prepared contemporaneously, submitted upon request)
CbCRNotificationDeadline: 31 December (by the last day of the MNE’s fiscal year)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: By time of tax audit (should be available)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. 20 days following tax auditor’s request.
LocalComparables: There is no specific indication. However, local comparables would be preferred.
SingleYearAnalysis: There is no guidance provided.
InterquartileRange: Yes, there are requirements.
AnnualBenchmarking: There is no guidance provided.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance/incomplete documentation: 0.5% of undocumented transaction volume. Failure to furnish CbCR: XOF25 million. Failure/delay to submit TP return: XOF10 million. Incomplete/inaccurate TP return: XOF200,000 per instance (max XOF1 million).
PenaltiesPostAudit: No direct penalty for incomplete/non-contemporaneous documentation. Reassessment leads to deemed distribution of profit, entailing 25% CIT penalty and 50% WHT penalty on deemed distributed profits. No interest charged. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Four years
AdjustmentRegulations: Not applicable
AuditLikelihood: No specific transactions or industries targeted. Local entity as subsidiary or branch of a foreign one is likely to undergo TP audit.
APAAvailable: Unilateral and bilateral APAs are available.
ThinCapRegulations: Limitations on interest paid to related foreign parties, including interest rate caps (central bank rate + 3%), fully paid-up capital requirement, limits on interest paid to individuals, and debt-to-equity (1.5x share capital) and interest-to-profit (15% of ordinary profits) ratios for companies and groups.

TaxAuthority: Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS)
TPLaw: Income Tax (Transfer Pricing Documentation) Rules 2018 (TPD rules) under the Singapore Income Tax Act (ITA), and the 2024 Singapore Transfer Pricing Guidelines
TPSection: Various sections of the Singapore Income Tax Act (ITA)
BEPS13Overview: Singapore has adopted BEPS Action 13. CbCR is required for MNE groups with consolidated revenues of at least SGD1.125 billion for financial years beginning on or after 1 January 2017. Master File and Local File concepts are not adopted as separate documents, but information requirements for Singapore TP documentation are largely aligned with OECD approaches, requiring both group and entity-level details.
DocRequirements: Compulsory from YA 2019; must be prepared contemporaneously and annually. Local branches must comply. Documentation can be refreshed every three years if it qualifies as past documentation.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Gross revenue > SGD10 million OR required in previous period. Exemptions for certain domestic transactions, safe harbor for routine services (5% cost markup), indicative margin for related-party loans, APA-covered transactions, and transactions below specific values (SGD15 million for goods, SGD15 million for loans, SGD1 million for other categories). CbCR: SGD1.125 billion annual global income. Master File: Not specified. Local File: Not specified. Economic analysis: No financial threshold specified.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement, but documentation must be in English; translation may be requested. Safe harbor available for routine services and related-party loans. Individual testing of transactions preferred.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: No, but a Related-Party Transactions Form must be submitted with Form C if the value of related-party transactions in audited accounts exceeds SGD15 million.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Required to disclose related-party transactions in the annual financial statement; may not be presented as a separate note.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 November
TPReturnDeadline: 30 November (for Related-Party Transactions Form, if applicable)
CbCRDeadline: 31 December (within 12 months from the end of the financial year)
CbCRNotificationDeadline: 31 December (within three months from the end of FY, for FY beginning on or after 1 January 2022)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline for submission; must be submitted within 30 days upon request.
LocalComparables: Yes, local comparables preferred; if insufficient, regional (pan-Asian) comparables may be used.
SingleYearAnalysis: Single-year results of the tested party compared with multiple-year results of the comparables.
InterquartileRange: Interquartile range calculation is acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, a roll forward of comparable companies and update of financials is accepted if past qualifying TP documentation is not relied upon. Benchmarking set with no financial update can be used in the second and third year of the TP documentation cycle. Update required at least once every three years or when material changes occur.
BenchmarkingType: Preference for weighted average for arm’s-length analysis.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: No preference for commercial database, use publicly available information, exclude comparables with weighted average loss for the tested period or loss for more than half of the tested period.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance/non-furnishing/incomplete furnishing of documentation: Fines not more than SGD10,000. Failure to furnish CbCR: SGD5,000. Failure to furnish Master File: Not applicable. Other penalties: SGD1,000 for failing to retain CbCR records; up to SGD10,000 for filing false/misleading CbCR information.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Incomplete documentation: Yes, fines not more than SGD10,000. Non-contemporaneous documentation: Yes, fines not more than SGD10,000. Interest charged: Yes, 5% surcharge on TP adjustment plus interest. Penalty relief: Yes, adequate and contemporaneous TP documentation helps mitigate penalties.
TPLimitationPeriod: Four years from the end of the year of assessment.
AdjustmentRegulations: Not applicable
AuditLikelihood: None specified.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral, bilateral, and multilateral APAs are available.
APARollback: Yes, generally up to two financial years immediately prior to the covered period for bilateral or multilateral APAs.
ThinCapRegulations: There are no thin capitalization rules in Singapore.

TaxAuthority: Slovak Financial Directorate, local tax authorities and Ministry of Finance
TPLaw: Income Tax Act, Act on Tax Administration (Tax Code), Guidance of the Ministry of Finance on the content of the transfer pricing documentation (Slovak TP Guidance), OECD Guidelines (as interpretation tool)
TPSection: Sections 2, 17 (5, 6, 7) and 18 of the Income Tax Act; relevant sections of the Act on Tax Administration (Tax Code); Slovak TP Guidance
BEPS13Overview: CbCR, Master File, and Local File required from 2018, no material differences from OECD format. BEPS Action 13 not adopted directly, but components implemented.
BEPS13PenaltyProtection: Yes, but local review is recommended due to potential missing details.
DocRequirements: Yes, prepared annually and contemporaneously, submitted upon request. Applies to local branches and requires stand-alone reports for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP Documentation: Cross-border transactions > EUR10M (full) or > EUR1M (basic); Taxpayers with revenues > EUR8M (basic). CbCR: Annual global income (threshold not specified here, but EUR750M in 14a). Master File: Not applicable. Local File: Volume of IC transaction/turnover. Economic analysis: Transactions > EUR10M.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (translation may be requested). Safe harbor available for transactions not exceeding EUR10,000 (or loans not exceeding EUR50,000 principal). No preference for aggregation or individual testing. No other specific requirements.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: Yes, summary table in corporate income tax return.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, in financial statements (specific rows and notes).
TaxReturnDeadline: 3 months after fiscal year-end (e.g., 31 March for calendar year), with possible 3-month extension.
TPReturnDeadline: Not applicable (information submitted with CIT return)
CbCRDeadline: 12 months after the end of fiscal year
CbCRNotificationDeadline: 3 months after the end of fiscal year (annual submission not required unless changes)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: 15 days upon tax authority request
LocalComparables: Regional searches are acceptable and preferred.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiple-year analysis is acceptable.
InterquartileRange: Interquartile range calculation using Excel quartile formulas is acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: Update financials annually; brand-new benchmarks every three years.
BenchmarkingType: None specified, weighted average usually preferred.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Comparables with not more than 25% ownership (upward/downward), relations through individuals observed.
CompliancePenals: Up to EUR3,000 for non-maintenance/non-furnishing/incomplete documentation, CbCR, Master File (can be assessed repeatedly).
PenaltiesPostAudit: Penalties for incomplete/non-contemporaneous documentation. Additional tax at 21% plus penalty of 10% p.a. or 3x ECB base rate (whichever is higher) on adjusted amount. Double penalty increase possible if anti-abuse rules breached. Penalty relief possible by submitting supplementary tax return within 15 days of audit start (reduced penalty of 7% p.a. or 2x ECB base rate).
TPLimitationPeriod: 10 years from the end of the year in which the tax return is filed (for double tax treaty cases).
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, if prices fall outside interquartile range, median value is used for adjustment (from 2023).
AuditLikelihood: Royalties, services, financial transactions, and limited-risk manufacturers.
APAAvailable: Yes
APARollback: No for unilateral APAs. Yes for bilateral/multilateral APAs from 2023 (retrospective application possible).
MAPAvailable: Yes, under tax treaties and EU Arbitration Convention.
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization rules restrict tax-deductible interest on related-party loans to 25% of taxpayer’s EBITDA.

TaxAuthority: Financial Administration of the Republic of Slovenia (Finančna Uprava Republike Slovenije - FURS)
TPLaw: Various Corporate Income Tax Acts, Rules on Transfer Prices, Tax Procedure Acts, Financial Administration Act, Rules on Recognized Interest Rate, Companies Act, and Minimum Tax Act.
TPSection: Articles 16, 17, 18 and 19 of the Corporate Income Tax Act
BEPS13Overview: Slovenia has implemented BEPS Action 13 into its legislation. The CbCR requirement, as well as the Master File and Local File concepts, are incorporated in national tax regulations.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and must be prepared contemporaneously (within three months of year-end) and annually. Local branches must comply. Stand-alone reports are required for each entity in an MNE.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: No materiality limit. CbCR: EUR750 million annual global income. Master File: No materiality limit. Local File: No materiality limit. Economic analysis: No statutory materiality limit, but smaller transactions (few thousand euros) may not need detailed elaboration.
SpecificRequirements: Documentation in Slovenian (translation upon request with 60 days). Safe harbor for related-party loans (administratively determined interest rate). No preference for aggregation. Disclosure of related-party turnover exceeding EUR50,000 required with corporate income tax return.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes. A separated related party report should be prepared for entities subject to statutory audit.
CbCRinTaxReturn: CbCR notification should be filed as an appendix to the corporate income tax return.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 March
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline for TP documentation/Local File (apart from CbCR). Submission upon tax authority request (during audit), with up to 90 days extension (or 60 days for translation if not in Slovenian). CbCR is 12 months after fiscal year-end.
LocalComparables: Pan-European benchmarks are acceptable in Slovenia.
SingleYearAnalysis: There are no specific rules on this; it should be examined on a case-by-case basis. As the tax authorities usually review multiple periods, it is possible to apply a multiyear analysis (usually a three-year period is accepted by the tax authority).
InterquartileRange: An interquartile range is determined in such a way that 25% of the lower values and 25% of the upper values are eliminated from the total observed range of comparable market prices.
AnnualBenchmarking: A benchmarking study may be updated by a refresh of the financials in the study. There is no legal requirement to perform a new benchmarking study each year. Updating it at least every three years is required.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: When establishing comparable market prices, the conditions from related transactions must be compared with the conditions, in identical, or comparable transactions between unrelated parties.
CompliancePenals: Up to EUR30,000 for taxpayer and EUR4,000 for responsible person for non-submission/incomplete documentation, CbCR, or Master File.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Penalty for incomplete documentation: Yes, up to EUR30,000 for taxpayer and EUR4,000 for responsible person. No penalty for non-contemporaneous documentation. No interest on penalties, but late-payment interest on tax underpayment. Penalty relief possible via voluntary disclosure.
TPLimitationPeriod: The statute of limitations on corporate income tax assessments is generally five years. If the tax authorities intervene with any official action against the taxpayer with a purpose to assess or collect tax, the relevant period is reset, without taking into account any previous lapse of time. Nevertheless, the right of the tax authorities to assess and collect tax will cease after 10 years. The transfer pricing documentation must be archived for 10 years.
AdjustmentRegulations: Currently, Slovenia does not impose a fixed requirement for adjustments to the median or any specific point in the in the interquartile range.
AuditLikelihood: Yes, mainly MNEs. Increased scrutiny on: limited function/risk entities with tax losses, intragroup services, intangibles (royalties/licensing), financial transactions (loans/cash pooling). Other risk factors: profitability, restructurings, volume of related-party transactions, prior audit issues, media info.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral, bilateral, or multilateral APAs available since 2017, subject to conditions (feasibility, economic substance, genuine intention, agreement, long-term transaction). Fees: EUR15,000 for first, EUR7,500 for extension.
APATenure: The maximum duration is five years, with the possibility of an extension.
ThinCapRegulations: Interest Limitation Rule (ILR) applicable from 1 Jan 2024, limiting borrowing costs to 30% of EBITDA or EUR1 million (EUR3 million after 1 Jan 2025), whichever is higher. Thin capitalization rule abolished from 2025 but may still be tested under general anti-avoidance rules.
PCbCRAuthority: Financial Administration of the Republic of Slovenia (Finančna Uprava Republike Slovenije - FURS)
PCbCRStartDate: For financial years starting on 22 June 2024 or after
PCbCRSection: Articles 70.e through 70.l of the Companies Act (ZGD-1). These articles were introduced to implement Directive (EU) 2021/2101
PCbCRIncomeThreshold: EUR750 million in two consecutive financial years
PCbCRDataSources: Yes. Guidance is expected to be issued by the Financial Administration of Slovenia and the Ministry of Finance.
PCbCRLodgmentOtherJurisdiction: Yes, if the ultimate parent company files a public CbCR in another EU jurisdiction
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: 12 months after the end of the first financial year starting on-after 22 June 2024
PCbCRMaxPenalties: A penalty of EUR30,000 is imposed if the report is not filed in time and accordance with provisions of the corresponding law. Additionally, a fine up to EUR2,500 may be issued to responsible company representative.

TaxAuthority: South African Revenue Service (SARS)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings
TPSection: Section 31 of Income Tax Act No. 58 of 1962; Section 1 of the Act; Sections 210(1) and 211 of Tax Administration Act, 2011
BEPS13Overview: CbCR, Master File, and Local File required, but jurisdiction has not adopted BEPS Action 13 generally
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously, annually, for local branches, and stand-alone reports for multiple entities
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: ZAR100m (turnover for filing); CbCR: ZAR10bn-EUR750m (global income); Master File: ZAR100m (international related-party transactions for filing); Local File: ZAR100m (international related-party transactions for filing); Economic analysis: advisable for transactions > ZAR5m
SpecificRequirements: English language preferred; no safe harbor; individual testing of transactions preferred (for transactions > ZAR5m if threshold met)
TaxReturnDeadline: 12 months after the financial year-end
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: 12 months after the financial year-end, or within 21 business days of SARS request
LocalComparables: No specific legislation, but OECD Guidelines are consulted
SingleYearAnalysis: No specific preference, follows OECD Guidelines
InterquartileRange: Yes, follows OECD Guidelines
AnnualBenchmarking: No, every three years, with annual financial updates
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Related parties (ownership > 20%) excluded, except for financial services
CompliancePenals: Administrative penalty up to ZAR16,000 per month for outstanding documentation. Fixed amount penalty ZAR250 to ZAR16,000 per month for CbCR noncompliance.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Understatement penalty up to 200% of shortfall; interest charged; penalty relief possible for bona fide errors or substantial understatement with disclosure and opinion
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years for self-assessment provisions (TP is self-assessment), three years for normal assessments. Can be extended-removed for fraud-misrepresentation.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, adjustment is possible and likely
AdjustmentRegulations: None specified
AuditLikelihood: None specified
APAAvailable: Not yet available, but draft legislation and model proposed; legislative framework proposed in 2023 budget
ThinCapRegulations: Interpretation Note 127 (IN 127) on intragroup loans (Jan 2023), largely mirrors OECD's Transfer Pricing Guidance on Financial Transactions

TaxAuthority: National Tax Service (NTS)
TPLaw: Adjustment of International Taxes Act (AITA), Enforcement Decree (ED) of the AITA, Enforcement Regulations of the AITA, Basic Rulings of the AITA
TPSection: AITA, Article 2 (1) 3; ED of the AITA, Article 2
BEPS13Overview: Adopted BEPS Action 13, implemented Consolidated Reports on International Transaction Information (CRIT) comprising CbCR, Master File, and Local File. Format specified by NTS, not exactly same as BEPS Action 13.
DocRequirements: Yes, prepared contemporaneously with CITR filing, submitted within 30 days upon NTS request. Local branches must comply. Prepared annually. Stand-alone reports for each entity.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation- Not specified; CbCR- KRW1 trillion or EUR750 million consolidated group revenue; Master File- KRW100 billion revenue AND KRW50 billion cross-border related-party transactions; Local File- KRW100 billion revenue AND KRW50 billion cross-border related-party transactions.
SpecificRequirements: Local File and Master File must be in Korean (Master File can be English initially, then Korean within one month). No safe harbor specified. No preference for aggregation or individual testing. Master and Local File submitted electronically via Hometax.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: No, but specific disclosure forms are required within six months from fiscal year-end, with various exemption thresholds.
TaxReturnDeadline: Three months from fiscal year-end (e.g., March 31 for December year-end)
TPReturnDeadline: Six months from fiscal year-end (e.g., June 30 for December year-end)
MasterFileDeadline: 12 months from fiscal year-end (e.g., December 31 for December year-end)
CbCRDeadline: 12 months from fiscal year-end (e.g., December 31 for December year-end)
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Six months from fiscal year-end (e.g., June 30 for December year-end)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Contemporaneous with corporate income tax return filing date
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline for submission; 12 months from fiscal year-end for those meeting BEPS thresholds; 30 days upon NTS request for others.
TPMethodPreference: Yes, CUP, resale price, cost-plus, profit-split, and TNMM are prescribed. Other methods only if these five are not applicable. Taxpayer selects the most reasonable.
LocalComparables: Yes, local comparables preferred if tested party is a Korean company.
SingleYearAnalysis: Yes
InterquartileRange: Yes, NTS has its own calculation method.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, rollforwards and update of financials are acceptable.
CompliancePenals: KRW30 million per report (Master File, Local File, CbCR) for non-furnishing-incomplete-false filing. KRW5 million per foreign related party for omitting-falsifying summary of cross-border transactions.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Underreporting penalty (approx. 10% of additional tax) and underpayment penalty (0.022% per day, 8.030% per year interest). Penalty relief possible if contemporaneous documentation supports reasonableness and is submitted within 30 days of NTS request.
TPLimitationPeriod: Generally seven years from the day after income tax return filing due date; 10 years for fraud; seven years if no tax filing by due date.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, includes an adjustment; auditors may propose less favorable alternate methods.
AdjustmentRegulations: None
AuditLikelihood: Companies with sudden drop or substantial fluctuation in profitability; companies paying high royalties abroad or receiving high management service fees-cost allocations from overseas related parties.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral, bilateral, and multilateral APAs are available.
APARollback: Yes, five-year roll-back for bilateral-multilateral APAs; three-year roll-back for unilateral APAs.
ThinCapRegulations: 2:1 debt-to-equity ratio (6:1 for financial institutions). Net interest deduction limited to 30% of adjusted taxable income for international transactions (effective Jan 1, 2019).

TaxAuthority: South Sudan Revenue Authority (Ministry of Finance and Planning)
TPLaw: Taxation Act 2009 and supplemental regulations
TPSection: Section 81 of the Taxation Act 2009 and Regulation 1. 81, Transfer Pricing
BEPS13Overview: Not adopted; CbCR, Master File, and Local File not required.
DocRequirements: Yes, prepared contemporaneously, submitted upon request. Local branches must comply. Not required annually.
MaterialityThresholds: No materiality limit or financial threshold for TP documentation, CbCR, Master File, Local File, or Economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: English language required. No safe harbor. No preference for aggregation or individual testing. No other specific disclosure.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, IFRS reporting is in use.
TaxReturnDeadline: 1 April of the year following the tax period
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Upon request, normally within seven days.
TPMethodPreference: Yes, CUP method, then resale-price or cost-plus method.
LocalComparables: Yes, local and regional comparables preferred.
SingleYearAnalysis: Yes, single-year analysis preferred.
InterquartileRange: None specified
AnnualBenchmarking: Not specific, but annual justification required.
CompliancePenals: Not applicable, as filing is not a requirement.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, additional tax, 5% late-payment penalty per month, 120% prime commercial rate interest. Interest charged on principal, 1% per month on refund. Penalty relief not directly available, but waiver application and appeal process exist.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years
MethodologyScrutiny: No, tax authorities have not started these audits.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: No, tax authorities have not started these audits.
AdjustmentRegulations: Low likelihood, as tax authorities have not started these audits.
AuditLikelihood: Low likelihood, as tax authorities have not started these audits.
APAAvailable: No
ThinCapRegulations: No thin capitalization rules exist.
PCbCRSection: Section 81 of the Taxation Act 2009 and Regulation 1. 81, Transfer Pricing
PCbCRDataSources: Section 81 of the Taxation Act 2009 and Regulation 1. 81, Transfer Pricing
PCbCRMaxPenalties: No TP specific penalties; additional tax, 5% late-payment penalty per month, 120% prime commercial rate interest.

TaxAuthority: Spanish National Tax Agency (AEAT) and General Directorate of Taxation (DGT)
TPLaw: Law 27/2014 (CITL) and Royal Decree 634/2015 (CITR)
TPSection: Article 18 of the CITL and Articles 13 and following of the CITR
BEPS13Overview: Adopted BEPS Action 13; CbCR required (EUR750m threshold, effective 2016, no material differences from OECD); Master File required (EUR45m threshold, effective 2015, minor differences from OECD); Local File required (effective 2015, some additional information beyond OECD).
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously, annually. Local branches must comply. Stand-alone reports not required for multiple entities but recommended.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation/Local File: EUR250,000 per counterparty (total quantum); exemptions for tax consolidation groups, AIEs/UTEs, public offerings. CbCR: EUR750 million consolidated revenue (previous FY). Master File: EUR45 million group income (previous FY). Economic analysis: No limit.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Spanish) preferred for audits. No safe harbor. Individual testing preferred. Other disclosure/compliance requirements exist.
TPReturn: Yes, Form 232 (Informative statement of related transactions and operations and situations related to tax havens).
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, in notes to financial statements.
TaxReturnDeadline: 25 days after a six-month period after fiscal year-end (e.g., 25 July for 31 Dec year-end).
TPReturnDeadline: Within one month after a 10-month period after fiscal year-end (e.g., 30 November for 31 Dec year-end).
MasterFileDeadline: No filing deadline; available by end of voluntary period for CIT return filing.
CbCRDeadline: 12 months following the end of the fiscal year.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Before the end of the fiscal year.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Available by the end of the voluntary period for filing the CIT return.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; 10 days upon tax authority request.
TPMethodPreference: No, all methods (CUP, cost plus, resale price, profit split, TNMM) have the same preferential level.
LocalComparables: Yes, local comparables are preferred.
SingleYearAnalysis: No, multi-year (three-year) analysis is common practice.
InterquartileRange: Yes, Excel spreadsheet quartile is preferred, and adjustment to the median is strongly opined for results outside the range.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, searches every three years, but financial data updated annually.
CompliancePenals: EUR1,000 per fact or EUR10,000 per group of facts omitted or false (if no tax adjustment). Same for Master File. Not applicable for CbCR.
PenaltiesPostAudit: 15% of gross adjustment if documentation is incomplete or non-contemporaneous. Interest charged on penalties. Penalty relief available; no penalties if documentation fully fulfilled.
TPLimitationPeriod: Four years, interrupted by tax audit or new income tax return filing.
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes, common practice and a main focus of tax authorities.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, strong opinion on adjustment to the median value of the interquartile range.
AuditLikelihood: Yes, focus on business restructurings, asset valuations (intangibles), royalty/management fees, recurrent losses, financing/cash pool structures. Loss-making companies, limited risk distributors/service providers are standard focus.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral and bilateral APAs are available.
APATenure: Valid for tax periods specified, not exceeding four tax periods following approval date.
APARollback: Yes, for previous tax periods not statute-barred and without final assessment.
MAPAvailable: Yes, available under DTTs and EU Arbitration Convention.
ThinCapRegulations: Net interest expenses exceeding 30% of EBITDA (with EUR1m minimum allowance) may be disallowed, carried forward indefinitely. Intragroup financing for acquisitions disallowed without valid business reasons. Leveraged acquisition rules limit interest deductibility to 30% of operating profit under certain conditions, with escape clauses.
PCbCRAuthority: Institute of Accounting and Auditing of Accounts
PCbCRRegulations: Law 28/2022, of 21 December, to promote the ecosystem of emerging companies
PCbCRSection: Additional Provision 11th of Law 22/2015, introduced by Final Provision 6th of Law 28/2022.
PCbCRIncomeThreshold: EUR750 million in the two previous fiscal years.
PCbCRMaterialityExemptions: Yes, based on EUR750 million consolidated revenue threshold.
PCbCR_BEPS13Alignment: No, mainly due to a six-month accessibility period vs. OECD's 12-month.
PCbCRLodgmentPossible: Yes, report made public on website and filed with Spanish Commercial Registry.
PCbCRLodgmentOtherJurisdiction: Yes, if parent company in another jurisdiction prepares a compatible report and makes it publicly available.
PCbCRLodgmentFormat: Yes, common template and machine-readable electronic format, potentially based on CbCR obligations (Form 231).

TaxAuthority: Inland Revenue Department (IRD)
TPLaw: Inland Revenue Act (IRA), transfer pricing regulations and relevant provisions of the double tax treaties
TPSection: Sections 76, 77 and 78 of the IRA
BEPS13Overview: Sri Lanka has adopted the OECD’s three-tiered documentation approach (Master File, Local File and CbCR) set out in BEPS Action 13.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation needs to be prepared annually and submitted upon request. A local branch of a foreign company needs to comply. Stand-alone reports are required for MNEs with multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: CbCR: EUR750 million (or LKR equivalent) consolidated group revenue. Master File: EUR50 million (or LKR equivalent) declared group revenue. Local File: LKR200 million aggregate controlled transactions. Economic analysis: LKR200 million for a specific category of controlled transaction.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement for international transactions (English required); Sinhalese or Tamil for domestic. No safe harbor. No preference for aggregation or individual testing. Taxpayers are required to make TP-specific disclosures in the income tax return.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, there is a requirement under the Sri Lankan Accounting Standards.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 November
MasterFileDeadline: No submission deadline, required to be submitted upon written request (within 60 days). Preparation deadline is 30 November.
CbCRDeadline: No later than 12 months after the last day of the reporting fiscal year of the MNE group.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; within 60 days upon IRD request.
LocalComparables: TP regulations neither provide clear guidance on benchmarking studies nor prohibit the use of regional comparables. Regional comparables should be acceptable, provided that the differences can be eliminated through appropriate adjustments and analyses.
SingleYearAnalysis: In general, current YA data is required. Data from up to two preceding financial years may be used if it affects transfer price determination.
InterquartileRange: Yes, use of the interquartile range is mandatory.
AnnualBenchmarking: A fresh benchmark search is required every three years. Financial data of comparables needs to be updated annually if no significant changes occurred.
BenchmarkingType: TP regulations do not contain guidance; taxpayers should apply the method that represents a proper application of the arm’s-length principle.
CompliancePenals: For not maintaining documentation: up to 1% of aggregate transaction value. For not furnishing required documents: up to LKR250,000. For nondisclosure of required information: up to 2% of aggregate transaction value. For failure to submit documents on specified date: up to LKR100,000. Concealment-furnishing inaccurate particulars-evasion: 200% of incremental tax on TP adjustment.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes (for incomplete-non-contemporaneous documentation). Interest charged: 1.5% compounded monthly for underpayments, 0.5% compounded monthly for refunds. Penalty relief available by establishing reasonable cause and good faith.
TPLimitationPeriod: 30 months from the date of filing the income tax return. Not applicable in case of fraud or willful evasion.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, high risk of adjustment and dispute process.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, if the actual price is not within the arm’s-length range, the median shall be treated as the arm’s-length price.
AuditLikelihood: No particular transaction, industry, or situation is more at risk. However, successful audits in one company may lead to targeting others in the same industry.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral, bilateral, or multilateral APAs are available.
MAPAvailable: Yes, for international transactions under double tax treaties.
ThinCapRegulations: Domestic law provides for a debt-to-equity ratio of 4:1. Excess finance costs are not deductible but can be carried forward for six years subject to conditions.

TaxAuthority: Swedish Tax Agency - STA
TPLaw: Income Tax Act (1999), Tax Procedure Act (2011), Tax Procedure Ordinance (2011), Advance Pricing Agreements Act (2009)
TPSection: Sections 14:19–20 Income Tax Act; Section 33a Tax Procedures Act; Sections 39:15–16 Tax Procedures Act; Section 9 Tax Procedure Ordinance; Advance Pricing Agreements Act
BEPS13Overview: Yes, effective for financial years starting after 31 March 2017 (CbCR from 1 Jan 2016). No material differences from OECD format for CbCR, Master File, Local File.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously on an annual basis. Local branch of foreign company must comply. Stand-alone reports not required for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Exempt if <250 employees AND (turnover <= SEK450m OR balance sheet <= SEK400m). CbCR: SEK7 billion annual global income. Economic analysis: SEK5 million per counterparty.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (Swedish, English, Norwegian, Danish accepted). No safe harbor. Aggregation of same type of transactions generally accepted.
TaxReturnDeadline: Generally 1 August (approx. six months after financial year-end)
MasterFileDeadline: Prepared by income tax return due date of group parent entity. Submitted upon request.
CbCRDeadline: Generally 31 December (within 12 months after financial year-end)
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Generally 31 December (before the end of the reporting year)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: By Swedish tax return due date of the Swedish entity.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Submitted upon request, typically 1-4 weeks.
LocalComparables: Local benchmarks preferred, but regional (Nordic) or European accepted.
SingleYearAnalysis: STA expects single-year results for tested party compared to multiyear comparable data.
InterquartileRange: Yes, interquartile range calculation is generally preferred.
AnnualBenchmarking: Annual financial updates advised, fresh benchmark analysis every third year.
CompliancePenals: No specific TP penalties. General tax penalties apply, ranging from 10% to 40% of additional tax. 40% generally imposed in TP cases.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No penalty for incomplete/non-contemporaneous documentation. Interest charged on additional tax, not penalties. Penalty relief possible (50% reduction or full relief) with timely, compliant documentation and disclosure.
TPLimitationPeriod: Six-year period after the end of the calendar year in which the relevant fiscal year ended.
AdjustmentRegulations: No
AuditLikelihood: Business restructurings and transactions involving intangible assets.
APAAvailable: Bilateral and multilateral APAs are available if Sweden has a tax treaty with the relevant jurisdiction(s). Not for simple or minor transactions.
MAPAvailable: Yes, if taxation is not in accordance with a double taxation treaty. Application within three years.
ThinCapRegulations: No formal thin capitalization rules, but substantial interest deduction restrictions apply on loans from affiliated persons.
PCbCRRegulations: Lag (2023:340) om offentliggörande av vissa stora företags inkomstskatterapporter
PCbCRSection: Lag (2023:340) om offentliggörande av vissa stora företags inkomstskatterapporter
PCbCRIncomeThreshold: SEK8 billion in two consecutive years
PCbCR_BEPS13Alignment: No, aligns with EU PCbCR directive.
PCbCRLodgmentFormat: Yes, form and format prescribed by European Commission.
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: Within 12 months after the end of the financial year covered by the report.

TaxAuthority: Cantonal tax administrations and Swiss Federal Tax Administration (SFTA)
TPLaw: Federal Direct Tax Act, Federal Law on Harmonization of Taxes, SFTA circular letter (1997), SFTA/SSK commentary (2024), SFTA Q&A guidance (2024)
TPSection: Article 58 of the Federal Direct Tax Act; Article 24 of the Federal Law on the Harmonization of Taxes
BEPS13Overview: Adopted BEPS Action 13 for CbCR exchange. CbCR required for MNEs with Swiss parent and >CHF900M turnover, effective 1 Jan 2018, no material differences from OECD format. Master File and Local File not required.
