DocRequirements: No specific TP documentation guidelines or rules, no obligation for Master File/Local File, but implicitly required to demonstrate arm's length. Local branches must comply. Not required annually.
MaterialityThresholds: No specific threshold for TP documentation. CbCR threshold: CHF900 million turnover for MNEs with Swiss parent. No thresholds for Master File, Local File, or Economic Analysis as they are not explicitly required.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement for general TP documentation (English usually accepted, CbCR in official languages or English). Safe harbors available for financing (thin cap, interest rates). Aggregation or individual testing unspecified. No other specific disclosure requirements.
TaxReturnDeadline: Varies by canton (usually six to nine months after FY close)
CbCRDeadline: 31 December (within 12 months following the end of the reporting period)
CbCRNotificationDeadline: 90 days after the end of the reporting period
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Upon tax authority request, usually within 30 days (extendable).
LocalComparables: Local comparables preferred but not mandated; pan-European comparables generally accepted due to lack of sufficient independent Swiss companies.
SingleYearAnalysis: Both accepted, multiyear more common.
InterquartileRange: Use of interquartile ranges is usually accepted.
AnnualBenchmarking: No. Annual financial updates performed; new searches typically every three years (OECD recommendation).
BenchmarkingType: Typically, simple or weighted average is applied. No preference between the two. Pooled results not common and likely challenged.
CompliancePenals: No specific TP penalties (other than CbCR). General penalty provisions apply. CbCR: CHF200 per day for late submission (capped at CHF50,000). Criminal sanctions for intentional falsification-incompleteness of CbCR (up to CHF100,000) or non-compliance with audit decision (up to CHF10,000). Constructive dividends may incur 35% withholding tax.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No penalty for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation. Interest charged on penalties. Penalty relief not available (no special provisions for reductions, but lower for ordinary negligence, higher for gross negligence).
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years after the end of the tax period (relative statute). Absolute statute of 15 years under certain conditions. Reopening for tax fraud-evasion: 10 years after the end of the tax period.
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific regulations, but in practice adjustments are often made to the median.
AuditLikelihood: High risk for transfers of intangibles, restructurings leading to base erosion (unless agreed in ruling), intercompany financing, and guarantee fees. Low risk for tangible transactions.
APAAvailable: Yes (rulings, bilateral APAs, multilateral APAs, MAPs). Common practice to clarify TP issues in advance rulings. Bilateral APAs favored for complex-high-volume transactions.
APATenure: Subject to negotiation, typically five years, longer periods possible.
APARollback: Possible, depends on countries involved. Taxpayers have the option to request roll-backs.
ThinCapRegulations: SFTA has issued a circular containing safe harbor rules for financing with regard to thin capitalization.

TaxAuthority: National Taxation Bureau
TPLaw: The Regulations Governing Assessment of Profit-Seeking Enterprise Income Tax on Non Arm’s-Length Transfer Pricing (transfer pricing guidelines)
TPSection: Article 43-1 of the Income Tax Law (ITL), Article 50 of the Financial Holding Company Law (FHCL), Article 42 of the Business Mergers and Acquisitions Law (BMAL)
BEPS13Overview: The Ministry of Finance (MOF) drew up an amendment to the transfer pricing guidelines on the basis of the BEPS Action 13 final report. The final amendment was released 13 November 2017. In line with OECD BEPS Action 13, the amendment adopts a three-tiered transfer pricing documentation requirement that includes the Master File, CbCR, and Local File or transfer pricing report. The amendment applies to profit-seeking enterprises’ income tax returns starting fiscal year 2017.
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation-Local File: Total annual revenue < TWD300 million, or TWD300-500 million with specific tax credit-loss carry-forward conditions, or no overseas controlled transactions, or total annual controlled transactions < TWD200 million. CbCR: Global consolidated revenue < TWD27 billion (preparation); Exemption if local entity revenue < TWD3 billion or cross-border controlled transactions < TWD1.5 billion. Master File: Local entity revenue < TWD3 billion or cross-border controlled transactions < TWD1.5 billion. Economic analysis: Transaction value > TWD10 million by type, or TWD5 million per transaction with one related party.
SpecificRequirements: Local language requirement for TP documentation: Yes (TP report and Master File in local language; Master File prepared in English, Chinese translation within one month of request; CbCR in local language and English). Safe harbor available: Yes. Aggregation or individual testing: Individual testing.
CbCRinTaxReturn: Notification shall be done upon filing income tax return by completing a form of the tax return (page B 6).
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 May
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: The Local File shall be submitted within one month after the receipt of a notice of examination.
LocalComparables: Asia-Pacific regional benchmarks are widely acceptable in practice.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear (three-year) analysis is required.
InterquartileRange: Interquartile range calculation using spreadsheet quartile formulas is acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: No specific requirement for a fresh benchmarking search every year. However, financials must be updated to the current year.
BenchmarkingType: The weighted average is required while testing an arm’s-length analysis.
CompliancePenals: Penalties under Article 110 of Income Tax Act for tax omission-underreporting (e.g., reported price significantly deviates from arm's-length, or adjusted taxable income exceeds thresholds). Failure to file-submit documents: TWD3,000-TWD30,000 (repeatedly) under Article 46 of Tax Collection Act. Up to 200% of tax shortfall possible.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, if documentation is deemed incomplete and an adjustment is sustained, penalties under Article 110 of the Income Tax Act may apply if specific thresholds are met. No penalty for non-contemporaneous documentation. No interest charged on penalties or payable on refund. No penalty relief available.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years
AdjustmentRegulations: To the median of the interquartile range
AuditLikelihood: Yes, audits are triggered by various factors including: profit ratios below industry average, local losses despite global profit, significant profit fluctuations, non-disclosure of related-party transactions, failure to prepare TP documents, transactions with tax havens or parties with tax incentives, and prior TP adjustments.
APAAvailable: Yes
ThinCapRegulations: Interest expense from related-party debt exceeding a 3:1 debt-to-equity ratio is not deductible for tax purposes. Companies in the financial industry are exempt.

TaxAuthority: Tanzania Revenue Authority (TRA)
TPLaw: The Tax Administration (Transfer Pricing) Regulations, 2018; Transfer Pricing Guidelines, 2020
TPSection: Sections 3 and 33 of the Income Tax Act, 2004
BEPS13Overview: Not adopted; CbCR, Master File, Local File not required in BEPS Action 13 format
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: Local File: TZS10 billion aggregate related-party transactions for submission with CIT return; otherwise, 30 days upon request.
SpecificRequirements: Documentation in English or Swahili (English in practice); individual testing preferred; annual benchmarking update and supporting documents required.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, in financial statements prepared under IFRS.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 June
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Taxpayers with aggregate related-party transactions of TZS10 billion or above: with CIT return (30 June, with possible 30-day extension). Taxpayers below TZS10 billion: within 30 days upon request.
LocalComparables: There is a preference for local comparables; however, it is not mandatory.
SingleYearAnalysis: There is a preference for multiple-year testing (preferably three years).
InterquartileRange: The applicable arm’s-length range is the 35th and 60th percentile range.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, fresh search every three years with annual financial update in practice.
BenchmarkingType: There is a preference for the weighted average for arm’s-length analysis.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Independence threshold of 25% applied; comparables with ownership above 25% should be excluded.
CompliancePenals: Minimum TZS52.5 million for non-maintenance-non-furnishing-incomplete documentation, CbCR, Master File. Other penalties minimum TZS70 million.
PenaltiesPostAudit: 100% of tax shortfall for non-compliance with arm's-length principle (incomplete-non-contemporaneous documentation). Interest (5%) on penalties-refunds, but not applied in practice. Relief possible for reasonable cause.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years from the due date of filing the final CIT return. No time limit in case of fraud, evasion, or gross or willful neglect.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, adjustment. Tax authority typically adopts methodology resulting in higher adjustments.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, TP Regulation 6(7) and TP Guidelines paragraph 8.2 state adjustment to the median point of the range if results fall outside arm's-length range and erode tax base.
AuditLikelihood: Increased focus on intragroup services (management services) and intangible transactions. General focus on MNEs with significant related-party transactions, irrespective of industry.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral, bilateral or multilateral APAs provided for, but none completed in practice.
APATenure: Three to five years, potentially longer.
ThinCapRegulations: Debt-to-equity ratio of 7:3 for 'exempt controlled resident entity'. Debt excludes non-interest-bearing, owed to resident financial institution, or nonresident bank-financial institution where tax on interest is withheld. Equity defined as paid-up share capital, share premium, and retained earnings.

TaxAuthority: Thai Revenue Department (TRD)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings, including TRC Sections 35 Ter, 71 Bis, 71 Ter, Ministerial Regulations 369, 370, and Director-General Notifications 372, 400, 407, 408, 419
TPStartDate: Accounting periods commencing on or after 1 January 2019
TPSection: TRC Sections 35 Ter, 71 Bis, 71 Ter; Ministerial Regulations 369, 370; DGN 372, 400, 407, 408, 419
BEPS13Overview: Adopted BEPS Action 13; CbCR and Local File regulations exist; Master File regulations not yet released.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist. Local File submitted upon request, CbCR when thresholds met. Local branches must comply. Annual preparation required. Stand-alone reports for each entity.
MaterialityThresholds: CbCR: THB28 billion global consolidated revenue. Local File: THB200 million annual revenue. Economic analysis: THB500 million revenue (with other conditions).
SpecificRequirements: Local File must be in Thai language (effective FY starting on or after 1 Jan 2021). No safe harbor. Aggregation of transactions preferred. Other disclosures required (TP return, related-party disclosures).
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: No (but TPDF has same due date)
RelatedPartyFinancials: Only for Public Accountable Entities (PAEs) under TFRS. Optional for Non-Public Accountable Entities (NPAEs).
TaxReturnDeadline: 150 days after accounting year-end (158 days for e-filing from 1 Feb 2024 to 31 Jan 2027)
TPReturnDeadline: 150 days after accounting year-end (158 days for e-filing from 1 Feb 2024 to 31 Jan 2027)
CbCRDeadline: 12 months after the end of the reporting accounting year (UPE); 60 days after request for subsidiary in Thailand.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: Before CbCR submission (within 12 months after accounting year-end)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: No specific deadline (prepared contemporaneously is expected)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: 60 days upon request (180 days for first-time request after TP regulations effective)
LocalComparables: In practice, local comparables are requested and preferred.
SingleYearAnalysis: No, three-year or five-year testing is commonly used.
InterquartileRange: No written regulation, but commonly used and acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, can be rolled forward for two years.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Revenue threshold, majority foreign shareholders, availability of financial data, different function or product, unqualified audited financial statements, evidence of related party transaction, consistent operating losses.
CompliancePenals: TPDF/Local File non-compliance: fine up to THB200,000. CbCR failure: THB2,000. Tax shortfall due to non-arm's length: penalty up to 200% plus 1.5% per month surcharge.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, if documentation is incomplete or non-contemporaneous. No interest on penalties. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years after the due date of filing of Corporate Income Tax return.
AdjustmentRegulations: No written regulations.
AuditLikelihood: Loss-making operations, significantly lower profit than peers, tax refund requests, business restructuring, service and intangibles related transactions.
APAAvailable: Yes, bilateral APAs considered, unilateral APAs also accepted in practice.
ThinCapRegulations: No

TaxAuthority: Office Togolaise des Recettes (Togolese Revenue Office)
TPLaw: General Tax Code and Tax Book Procedures
TPSection: Articles 105, 106, 106 Bis of the General Tax Code; Article 113 of the Tax Book Procedures
BEPS13Overview: Implemented TP documentation and return obligations, CbCR, Local File. Master File not required.
DocRequirements: Yes, prepared contemporaneously, annually, stand-alone for each entity. Applicable to local branches.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: XOF1 billion turnover/gross assets. CbCR: EUR750 million (XOF492 billion) consolidated group revenue. Master File: Not applicable. Local File: XOF1 billion (EUR1,524,490) turnover/gross assets. Economic analysis: No threshold.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (French) required. No safe harbor specified. No preference for aggregation or individual testing.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 April (or 30 May for insurance companies)
CbCRDeadline: 31 December (12 months after fiscal year end)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; 15 days upon tax authority request during audit.
LocalComparables: No specific requirement, but local or West African comparables preferred.
SingleYearAnalysis: No specific requirement
InterquartileRange: No specific requirement
AnnualBenchmarking: No specific requirement
CompliancePenals: Documentation: 0.5% of transaction amount (min XOF10 million) per year. CbCR: XOF50 million. TP return: XOF10 million.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Incomplete documentation: 0.5% of transaction amount (min XOF10 million) per year. No penalty for non-contemporaneous. No interest on penalties/refunds. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Not applicable
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific requirements
AuditLikelihood: No specific transactions
APAAvailable: No
ThinCapRegulations: Interest rate not to exceed legal rate + 3 percentage points. Share capital must be fully paid up. Interest paid to shareholders not to exceed 30% of EBITDA.

TaxAuthority: Ministry of Finance; General Directorate of Taxes (La Direction Générales des Impôts); General Directorate of Tax Studies and Legislation (DGELF).
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings, including Finance Acts 2019 and 2021, and articles from PCITC and CFRP.
TPSection: Article 48septies PCITC, Article 59 paragraph II bis PCITC, Article 38bis CFRP, Article 17ter CFRP, Article 35bis CFRP, Article 84nonies CFRP, Article 84undecies CFRP, Article 84decies CFRP, Article 94 CFRP.
BEPS13Overview: Yes, adopted and implemented effective 1 January 2020.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and need to be prepared contemporaneously and annually. Local branches must comply. Stand-alone reports are required for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP Documentation: Annual sales >= TND200 million; transaction amount >= TND100,000 per category. CbCR: Annual consolidated sales >= TND1.636 million. Master File-Local File: Annual sales >= TND200 million; transaction amount >= TND100,000 per category.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (Arabic-French preferred, English for Master File accepted). No safe harbor. No preference for aggregation or individual testing. No other disclosure.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: Yes (via the annual transfer pricing return)
RelatedPartyFinancials: No specific additional requirement beyond the annual TP return.
TaxReturnDeadline: 25 March (or 15th day following AGM, not exceeding 25 June)
MasterFileDeadline: 40 days from start of tax audit (upon formal notice)
CbCRDeadline: 31 December (within 12 months after fiscal year closing)
CbCRNotificationDeadline: 31 December (within 12 months after fiscal year closing)
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Within 40 days from the date of the administration’s formal notice of the tax audit
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Yes, within 40 days from the date of the administration’s formal notice of the tax audit.
TPMethodPreference: No, all OECD methods are recognized, and any method reflecting arm's-length principle is accepted.
LocalComparables: Not applicable
SingleYearAnalysis: Yes, single-year analysis is preferred.
InterquartileRange: Not applicable
AnnualBenchmarking: Recommended every year.
CompliancePenals: TP Documentation: 0.5% of transaction amount (min TND50,000 per year). CbCR: TND50,000 for non-filing; up to TND10,000 (TND100 per item) for missing-inaccurate info. Annual TP Return: TND10,000 for non-filing; up to TND5,000 (TND50 per item) for missing-inaccurate info. Criminal prosecution for excessive invoice amounts.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, for incomplete documentation. Yes, for non-contemporaneous documentation. No interest charged on penalties or refunds. Penalty relief can be obtained.
TPLimitationPeriod: 4 years (extendable to 6 years for certain enterprises) if compliant; 10 years if non-compliant. Administrative fines: 4 years. Criminal sentences: 20 years (crimes), 5 years (offenses), 2 years (contraventions).
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific regulation, general TP rules apply.
AuditLikelihood: No, all transactions-industries-situations may be challenged.
APAAvailable: Yes
ThinCapRegulations: Article 48 PCITC: Interest on shareholder loans deductible if amount <= 50% of paid-up share capital and interest rate <= 8%. Interest on amounts made available to shareholders must be >= 8%.

TaxAuthority: Turkish Ministry of Finance and Turkish state authorities
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings, including Corporate Tax Code No. 5520, Cabinet decrees, and Ministry of Finance communiqués
TPSection: Article 13 of the Corporate Tax Code No. 5520
BEPS13Overview: Yes, the existing documentation requirement has been expanded by Turkey’s Presidential Decision No. 2151, published in the Official Gazette dated and effective from 25 February 2020 to include OECD documentation, that is, the Master File, annual transfer pricing report and CbCR for the 2019 accounting period.
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: CbCR: EUR750 million consolidated group revenue. Master File: TRY500 million net sales and assets. No specific threshold for TP documentation or Local File.
SpecificRequirements: Local language requirement for TP documentation: Yes. Safe harbor: No. Aggregation or individual testing: No preference.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 April
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline for submission. Submitted within 15 days upon tax authority request.
LocalComparables: Local comparables are preferred.
SingleYearAnalysis: A multiyear analysis is preferred.
InterquartileRange: None specified in the local legislation.
AnnualBenchmarking: Fresh benchmarking is preferred.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: There is a preference for applying independence and unconsolidated financials criteria.
CompliancePenals: No specific transfer pricing penalties, but failure to submit, late submission or incorrect disclosures trigger a tax audit. Under the Tax Procedural Code, late filing, incomplete or inaccurate filing of reports are subject to a procedural tax penalty. A 'Penalty Protection Regime' applies where taxpayers may get a penalty reduction of 50% in the case of full and timely preparation of transfer pricing documentation.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Penalty applicable if documentation is deemed incomplete: Yes (100% of original tax amount and late payment interests). Penalty applicable if documentation is deemed non-contemporaneous: Yes. Interest charged on penalties: Yes (1.6% monthly). Penalty relief: Yes (50% penalty relief for proper documentation, settlement possible, MAP available).
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Adjustment. Strong tendency for using the CUP method. Common practice to use secret comparables (can be challenged in litigation). High possibility of annual tax audit for medium- and large-sized multinational firms.
AdjustmentRegulations: Not specified
AuditLikelihood: Intragroup charges (management fees, cost allocations), pharmaceuticals, telecommunications, banking and finance, automotive, companies subject to excise taxes.
APAAvailable: Yes
ThinCapRegulations: Ratio of borrowings from shareholders or related parties exceeding three times the shareholders' equity. Exceeding portion considered thin capital, corresponding interest not deductible. Ratio of loans from related parties to shareholders’ equity must be no more than 3:1.

TaxAuthority: Uganda Revenue Authority (URA)
TPLaw: Income Tax Regulations 2011, Sections 116 and 151 of the Income Tax Act, Cap 340
TPSection: Section 3 of the Ugandan Income Tax Act
BEPS13Overview: Only the Local File is required, Master File and CbCR may not apply.
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: For in-jurisdiction transactions between related entities, the threshold is UGX500 million in aggregate for the transaction during the year. No financial threshold for TP documentation, CbCR, Master File, Local File, or Economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (English acceptable). Safe harbor unspecified. No preference for aggregation or individual testing.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, audited financial statements would have a disclosure on related-party transactions.
OtherRequiredDocs: No. Documents must be in place prior to the due date for filing the income tax return for the relevant year, and must be in English.
TaxReturnDeadline: Within six months of year-end
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within 30 days of tax authority's request
LocalComparables: No legal requirement for local comparables; search in regions with similar economic indicators is accepted.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiple-year (three-year) analysis, as per common practice
InterquartileRange: Interquartile range calculation using spreadsheet quartile formula is acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, unless legal and economic circumstances have changed. Roll-forward of comparable companies and update of financials is acceptable.
BenchmarkingType: No reference prescribed, but in practice, a three-years weighted average is used.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: A well-laid-out search process, as provided for in the OECD Guidelines, has to be followed.
CompliancePenals: Failure to put in place documentation- imprisonment up to six months or fine up to UGX500,000 or both. Late payment- 2% per month of shortfall and 2% of gross tax liability for late return. Failure to provide records within 30 days of request- UGX50 million penalty tax (effective 1 July 2017).
PenaltiesPostAudit: If URA raises an upward TP adjustment, a 20% penalty on the shortfall if provisional tax paid is less than 90% of actual tax liability. Interest on outstanding tax is 2% per month (simple interest), capped to principal tax + penalty tax. Penalty relief possible through objection-appeal.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years, but may be open if new information is obtained.
AdjustmentRegulations: None specified. In practice, any comparability analysis within the interquartile range would be acceptable.
AuditLikelihood: Management fees and royalties. General focus on MNEs with significant related-party transactions, irrespective of sector.
APAAvailable: Yes, an APA program is available. Multilateral APAs are allowed.
APATenure: Fixed period, but exact number of years not mentioned.
ThinCapRegulations: Interest on loans from parent is deductible, subject to interest capping rule- not exceeding 30% of tax EBITDA. Excess interest can be carried forward for up to three years.

TaxAuthority: State Tax Service of Ukraine
TPLaw: Ukrainian Tax Code (TCU) Article 39 and related Decrees and Orders of the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine
TPSection: Article 39, subparagraph 14. 1. 159, paragraph 120. 3, 201. 4 of the TCU
BEPS13Overview: Includes a Master File, Local File, and Country-by-Country (CbC) report. Ukraine's implementation is aligned with the OECD's recommendations for Action 13.
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Taxpayer’s revenue exceeds UAH150 million AND volume of transactions with each counterparty exceeds UAH10 million. CbCR: EUR750 million annual global income. Master File: EUR50 million annual global income. Local File: Expected to be prepared for each separate transaction that falls under TP control. Economic analysis: Must be prepared for each separate type of controlled transactions.
SpecificRequirements: Local language requirement: Yes (Ukrainian). Safe harbor: No. Aggregation or individual testing: Aggregation. Other disclosure: Annual preparation and submission of the local transfer pricing form, the report on controlled transactions, which contains an item-by-item disclosure of all controlled transactions indicating the transfer pricing testing parameters: tested party, method, profit-level indicator and its numeric value, and the database used.
TaxReturnDeadline: 1 March
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: 30 calendar days upon tax authority request
LocalComparables: A local benchmarking study (Ukrainian comparables) must be used if the tested party is a Ukrainian entity.
SingleYearAnalysis: Both are possible. However, the best practice is to use single-year (similar to the year of the controlled transaction); the selection of multiyear analysis should be substantiated in the transfer pricing documentation file.
InterquartileRange: The interquartile range must be used.
AnnualBenchmarking: A fresh benchmarking search is required every year.
BenchmarkingType: The weighted average must be used.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Mandatory criteria: 1. Establishing comparability using activity code (NACE Rev. 2) 2. Financial criteria, no losses in more than one year in the period selected for arm’s-length calculation 3. Twenty-five-percent independence criteria
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance/non-furnishing/incomplete documentation: 3% of transaction volume (max 200 subsistence minimums per year). Failure to furnish CbCR: 10 subsistence minimums per day of delay (max 1,000 subsistence minimums per reporting year). Failure to furnish Master File: 3 subsistence minimums per day of delay (max 300 subsistence minimums per reporting year). Other violations: Report on controlled transaction, Local File, Master File, CbCR materiality lookup, MNE group notification.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Penalty applicable if documentation is deemed incomplete: Yes. Penalty applicable if documentation is deemed non-contemporaneous: Yes. Interest charged on penalties: No (but late-payment interest on tax understatement at 100%/120% of NBU discount rate). Penalty relief: Yes (for transition periods, COVID-19 measures, martial law).
TPLimitationPeriod: Seven years (2,555 days) from the last date for filing the CPT, or from the actual day the CPT return was filed if later. Suspended from 18 March 2020 to 31 July 2023.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: An adjustment is possible if application of a new methodology reveals failure to comply with the arm’s-length principle.
AdjustmentRegulations: If taxpayer adjusts, to upper/lower quartile. If tax authority adjusts, to the median of the interquartile range.
AuditLikelihood: Not applicable. Any company can be selected for transfer pricing audit based on risk analysis.
APAAvailable: Yes
APARollback: Yes, available (number of years not specified).
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization rules apply to all loans received by resident companies from nonresident persons where the debt is greater than 3.5 times the company’s equity. Deductions for interest paid on such loans is limited to 50% of profits before tax (plus financing expenses and depreciation). Nondeductible interest may be carried forward, reduced by 5% annually.

TaxAuthority: Federal Tax Authority (FTA)
TPLaw: Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022 on the Taxation of Corporations and Businesses (Corporate Tax Law), Ministerial Decisions, Transfer Pricing Guide (October 2023)
TPSection: Corporate Tax Law (Chapter 10, Articles 34, 35, 36, 55), Ministerial Decision No. 97 of 2023, Cabinet Resolution No. 44 of 2020
BEPS13Overview: Adopted BEPS Action 13; requires CbCR, Master File, and Local File.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously prepared, applicable to local branches, prepared annually, stand-alone reports for each entity.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Turnover based; CbCR: Global consolidated group revenue > AED 3.15 billion; Master File: Consolidated group revenue > AED 3.15 billion OR taxable person's revenue > AED 200 million; Local File: Consolidated group revenue > AED 3.15 billion OR taxable person's revenue > AED 200 million. QFZP always requires TP documentation.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement; safe harbor unspecified; individual testing preferred (aggregation possible if interlinked); TP disclosure form required with corporate tax return.
TPReturn: Yes, a transfer pricing disclosure form.
TaxReturnDeadline: No later than nine months from the end of the relevant tax period.
TPReturnDeadline: No later than nine months from the end of the relevant tax period (with corporate tax return).
MasterFileDeadline: Prepared prior to corporate tax return submission; submitted within 30 days of FTA request.
CbCRDeadline: No later than 12 months after the last day of the reporting fiscal year.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: No later than the last day of the reporting fiscal year.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; within 30 days of FTA request.
LocalComparables: Yes
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear analysis.
InterquartileRange: Yes, calculated based on Excel quartile.
AnnualBenchmarking: Full update every three years; annual financial update in interim years.
CompliancePenals: Master File-Local File: No specific penalties yet, but expected to align with Tax Procedures Law 2017. CbCR: AED 100,000 for failure to retain-provide info; Initial AED 1 million + AED 10,000 daily (max AED 250,000) for failure to file CbCR notification-report; AED 50,000-500,000 for incomplete-inaccurate info (total max AED 1 million).
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, for incomplete documentation (CbCR: AED 50,000-500,000); No for non-contemporaneous documentation; No interest on penalties-refunds; No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Generally five years after the end of the relevant tax period, in accordance with the Tax Procedures Law.
MethodologyScrutiny: No (too early to tell due to recent implementation).
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Adjustments to income; corresponding adjustments to counterparty's taxable income.
AdjustmentRegulations: Not specified.
AuditLikelihood: Not yet known.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral APAs available from Q4 2025.
ThinCapRegulations: Corporate Tax Law (Article 30: General Interest Deduction Limitation Rule - 30% of EBITDA; Article 31: Specific Interest Deduction Limitation Rule for related-party loans on certain transactions).

TaxAuthority: His Majesty’s Revenue and Customs (HMRC)
TPLaw: Taxation (International and Other Provisions) Act 2010 (TIOPA 2010), Transfer Pricing Records Regulations 2023, Finance Act 2015 (DPT)
TPStartDate: Basic TP rules: 1 April 1998; Documentation rules: 1 April 2023 (corporate tax), 2024-25 (income tax)
TPSection: Part 4, Taxation (International and Other Provisions) Act 2010 (TIOPA 2010)
OECDGuidelines: Largely, relying on 2022 OECD TP Guidelines via Section 164 of TIOPA 2010
BEPS13Overview: Yes, adopted for largest companies (EUR750M+ consolidated turnover) requiring Master File and Local File per OECD 2022 Guidelines (Chapter V) from 1 April 2023. CbCR also required.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously, annually, applies to local branches.
MaterialityThresholds: TP Doc: Yes, Turnover (SME exemption applies). CbCR: EUR750 million, Annual global income. Master File: EUR750 million, Annual global income. Local File: GBP1 million per category of transaction, with specific transactions always material regardless of value. Economic analysis: No specific threshold.
SpecificRequirements: No local language (English expected). Yes, safe harbors for SMEs, de minimis for some Local File transactions, and UK chargeable gains. Aggregation of transactions allowed. No other specific disclosure.
TPReturn: No, but specific checkboxes for SME exemption and compensating adjustments are required. An international dealings schedule has been proposed.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: No, but an international dealings schedule has been proposed.
RelatedPartyFinancials: As required under the applicable accounting standard.
CbCRinTaxReturn: No, CbCR notification requirements were removed from 26 July 2023.
TaxReturnDeadline: 12 months after the end of the accounting period
MasterFileDeadline: Prepared before corporate tax return submission; submitted within 30 days upon request.
CbCRDeadline: 12 months after the end of the accounting period
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Prepared before corporate income tax return submission.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; submitted within 30 days upon request.
LocalComparables: Not specified, but HMRC accepts regional comparables.
SingleYearAnalysis: Not specified, but HMRC expects single-year tested party results compared to multiyear comparable data.
InterquartileRange: Not specified in legislation, but interquartile range is accepted in practice.
AnnualBenchmarking: Not annually if operating conditions unchanged, but regular updates are required. Risk increases if same comparables used for more than three years without updated search.
BenchmarkingType: Not specified; all three options (simple, weighted, pooled) are accepted in practice.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: None specified in legislation, but extensive guidance on best practices exists.
CompliancePenals: Failure to maintain/furnish adequate records (including Master/Local File): GBP3,000 per accounting period, leading to presumption of carelessness. CbCR non-filing: GBP300 + GBP60/day, up to GBP1,000/day; inaccurate/incomplete: up to GBP3,000/day. Corporate tax return penalties: fixed penalties for late filing, tax-geared up to 100% for incorrect returns (careless 30%, deliberate 70%, deliberate concealed 100%).
PenaltiesPostAudit: Incomplete/non-contemporaneous documentation does not directly incur penalties but leads to a presumption of carelessness, increasing risk of tax-geared penalties (up to 100%) if an adjustment is made. Interest is charged on overdue tax, not penalties. Penalty relief is available.
TPLimitationPeriod: 4 years for incomplete disclosure; 6 years for careless conduct; 20 years for deliberate conduct.
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific legislation; depends on facts and circumstances.
AuditLikelihood: No specific industries, but high-risk situations include low returns with offshore IP, base-eroding payments, and specific areas like intangibles, intra-group services, target margin models, cost/sales-based rewards, franchise fees, and financial transactions.
APAAvailable: Yes, for all TP-scope transactions, including financial and PE profit attribution. Strong preference for bilateral/multilateral, but unilateral APAs possible in limited circumstances (e.g., CCAs).
APATenure: Typically up to 5 years, but unilateral CCAs may be for the duration of the CCA.
APARollback: Yes, may be available if facts/circumstances are substantially the same, and intended for CCA characterisation APAs.
ThinCapRegulations: Based on arm's-length principle (no safe harbors). HMRC considers if loan would be lent, in that amount, on those terms at arm's length. Other domestic rules may limit interest deductions. Advance Thin Capitalisation Agreements (ATCAs) are available for various financial transactions.

TaxAuthority: Internal Revenue Service (IRS)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Acts and rulings, including Treasury Regulations, Revenue Procedures, the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 (TCJA) with provisions like BEAT, FDII, GILTI, and expanded intangibles definition, and IRS administrative guidance.
TPSection: Not applicable
BEPS13Overview: The US has adopted BEPS Action 13 (limited to CbCR) in local regulations. No Master File or Local File requirements. CbCR is required with a threshold of USD850 million, effective 30 June 2017, with no material differences from OECD format.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation needs to be prepared contemporaneously and annually. Local branches of foreign companies must comply. No stand-alone reports for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: No; CbCR: USD850 million annual global income; Master File: Not applicable; Local File: Not applicable; Economic analysis: No.
SpecificRequirements: English is the accepted language. Safe harbor available for intercompany loans and advances using applicable federal interest rates (AFRs). Individual testing of transactions is preferred.
OtherRequiredDocs: Form 8975 and Schedule A (Form 8975) for US MNE groups on a country-by-country basis.
TaxReturnDeadline: 15 April (15th day of the fourth month following the end of the corporation’s tax year; six-month extension generally available).
CbCRDeadline: With tax return for the respective year
LocalFilePrepDeadline: By tax return lodgment date (must be in existence by the filing date of a timely filed US tax return for penalty protection).
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; within 30 days of examiner’s request.
LocalComparables: No such requirement; foreign and regional comparables are generally acceptable.
SingleYearAnalysis: Ordinarily compared with results in the taxable year under review, but multiyear data may be considered depending on method, transactions, data availability, business cycles, and product-intangible life cycles.
InterquartileRange: Yes, interquartile range is acceptable (25th to 75th percentile).
AnnualBenchmarking: No legal requirement; roll-forward and financial updates acceptable for up to two to three years if fact pattern unchanged.
BenchmarkingType: No stipulated requirement; depends on facts, circumstances, and comparability.
CompliancePenals: For documentation, 20% or 40% penalty for underpayment of tax attributable to a substantial or gross valuation misstatement (IRC § 6662). No penalty for failure to provide documentation, but it helps avoid penalties. For CbCR-Master File, Not applicable.
PenaltiesPostAudit: For incomplete-non-contemporaneous documentation, no penalty, but may not provide penalty protection. Interest is charged on penalties using AFRs. Penalty relief can be obtained by establishing reasonable cause and good faith.
TPLimitationPeriod: Three years from later of tax return due date or filing date; six years for substantial understatements; no limit for fraud. Most treaties allow IRS access to closed years for MAP.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, an adjustment is likely, and a Notice of Proposed Adjustment should be expected.
AdjustmentRegulations: Adjustment to arm’s-length result; if interquartile range used, generally to the median.
AuditLikelihood: Cost sharing and other IP migration transactions; other high-risk transactions (OECD BEPS Action Plan).
APAAvailable: Yes
ThinCapRegulations: Earnings stripping rules under IRC § 163(j).
PCbCRLodgmentDeadline: Forty percent of the underpayment of tax caused by a gross valuation misstatement.

TaxAuthority: General Taxation Directorate (Dirección General Impositiva - DGI)
TPLaw: Various Laws, Decrees, and DGI Resolutions (e.g., Law No. 18.803, Decree No. 56/009, DGI Resolution No. 2.084/009)
TPSection: Presidential Decree No. 353/018, DGI Resolution No. 084/009, DGI Resolution No. 094/2019
BEPS13Overview: Adopted BEPS Action 13; requires CbCR, Master File, and Local File. CbCR effective 1 January 2017. Master File and Local File added to regime requirements on 5 January 2017.
DocRequirements: Yes, guidelines exist; documentation must be prepared contemporaneously and annually for each entity, including local branches.
MaterialityThresholds: TP Documentation: Preparation required for all related-party transactions. Submission required if total intercompany transactions >= 50 million indexed units (approx. USD7.1M). CbCR: EUR750 million consolidated revenue. Master File: No specific threshold, applicable to MNE group entities. Local File: No threshold, required for any related-party transaction.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Spanish) required. Individual testing of transactions preferred. Safe harbor unspecified.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: Yes, TP study, audited financial statements (for "great taxpayers"), and annual transfer pricing return Form 3001 (if threshold met).
RelatedPartyFinancials: No specific requirements under Uruguayan TP rules, but Uruguayan GAAP require certain disclosures for related-party transactions.
TaxReturnDeadline: Four months after the fiscal year-end.
TPReturnDeadline: Nine months after the fiscal year-end.
MasterFileDeadline: Not specified (no regulation for annual filings, but requested during audits).
CbCRDeadline: 12 months after the end of the reporting FY of the group.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: By the end of the reporting FY of the group.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Nine months after the fiscal year-end (preliminary analysis due four months after FYE).
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Yes, nine months after fiscal year-end if threshold exceeded. Otherwise, approximately 5-10 days upon tax authority request.
TPMethodPreference: Yes, CUP for imports-exports of goods with well-known prices, financial transactions, royalties, and services. Mandatory CUP for agro-commodities.
LocalComparables: Local comparables preferred but rarely used due to insufficient data. Latin American comparables prioritized. Court Decision No. 597-021 states preference for local comparables.
SingleYearAnalysis: Single-year testing preferred for taxpayer; multiyear analysis for comparables (three-year averaging) is best practice but no formal guidance.
InterquartileRange: Yes, local regulations include use of interquartile range with specific calculation rules (median -/+ 5% adjustment for quartiles).
AnnualBenchmarking: Recommended every year, but searches every three years with annual financial updates have been accepted (no formal guidance).
CompliancePenals: Maximum fine of approx. USD290,000 for formal breaches (e.g., non-filing of TP report, CbCR, Master File). Tax omission fine (5-20% + surcharges) for underpayment. Suspension of tax certificate for non-filing of TP study or CbCR.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No direct penalty for incomplete-non-contemporaneous documentation, but can lead to adjustments. Interest charged on penalties (5-20% for delays). No penalty relief available.
TPLimitationPeriod: General regime applies: five years after accounting period ends, extended to 10 years for fraudulent or negligent conduct.
MethodologyScrutiny: Yes, common practice, especially for "great taxpayers" (audited at least every five years). High possibility of challenge.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, high possibility of an adjustment.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, if adjustment is necessary, it should be calculated using the median decreased-increased (according to the situation) by 5%.
AuditLikelihood: No specific industries, but focus on "great taxpayers". Scrutiny areas include functional analysis, segmentation, comparable selection (local preference), and financial information comparison. Observations include comparability adjustments, rejection of comparables, and continuous losses.
APAAvailable: Yes, APA regime exists, but no specific procedures defined. Few unilateral APA cases announced, not public.
APATenure: No specific term set in local regulation.
MAPAvailable: None specified. For bilateral APAs, MAP provisions in bilateral tax treaties may be applied.
ThinCapRegulations: None specified.

TaxAuthority: National Integrated Service for the Administration of Customs Duties and Tax (Servicio Nacional Integrado de Administración Aduanera y Tributaria - SENIAT)
TPLaw: Administrative Order No. SNAT/ 2010/ 0090; Income Tax Law (ITL) and thin capitalization rules
TPSection: Venezuelan ITL, Articles 109 to 168
BEPS13Overview: Venezuela has not formally adopted or implemented BEPS Action 13. However, Article 113 of the ITL establishes that for everything not foreseen in the law, the provisions of the OECD Guidelines will apply. Does not require CbCR, Master File, or Local File.
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: No
SpecificRequirements: Local language requirement: Yes (Spanish). Individual testing of transactions preferred. Other disclosure: Transfer pricing informative return (Form PT- 99).
OtherRequiredDocs: All information that supports transfer pricing calculations, in accordance with the provisions of Article 167 of the ITL
TaxReturnDeadline: Three months after the company’s fiscal year-end.
TPReturnDeadline: Six months after the end of the taxpayer’s fiscal year.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Yes, usually two to five workdays after the tax authorities require it.
LocalComparables: Regional comparable companies are accepted. Tax administration prefers comparables located in the United States and Canada.
SingleYearAnalysis: There is a preference for both single-year and multiyear analysis. Tax administration prefers the use of multiple years. Comparison is between a single year of the company against three of the comparable set.
InterquartileRange: Yes, interquartile range calculation using spreadsheet quartile formulas is acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: It can be both. Usually, an update of the financial information of previous comparable companies is used.
BenchmarkingType: There is a preference for a weighted average for arm’s-length analysis.
CompliancePenals: Filing incomplete PT- 99: 100 times highest exchange rate. Failure to file PT- 99: 150 times highest exchange rate and company closure for 10 days. Failure to submit documentation upon request: 1,000 times highest exchange rate and company closure for 10 days. Fine ranging from 100% to 300% of omitted tax. Pecuniary sanctions for formal duties increased by 200% for special subjects.
PenaltiesPostAudit: If documentation is deemed incomplete: No. If documentation is deemed non-contemporaneous: No. Interest charged only for late payment. Penalty relief: No, but applying a legally sanctioned method could be a mitigating circumstance.
TPLimitationPeriod: Six years from the date of filing the return and 10 years if the taxpayer fails to comply with the filing of any tax return.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes, adjustments must be made to the median of the interquartile range.
AuditLikelihood: No, audits have been conducted on taxpayers irrespective of industry. Evaluation criteria include inconsistencies, non-updated financial info, PLIs below range, lower operating margins, late filing.
APAAvailable: Unilateral and bilateral APAs are available to the extent that they are carried out with nations that have concluded double taxation treaties with Venezuela. Nonetheless, there are no APAs in Venezuela.
APATenure: All specifications and terms for APAs are in Articles 141 to 165 of the ITL.
ThinCapRegulations: Interest paid directly or indirectly to related parties is deductible only if total debt (related and unrelated) does not exceed net equity. Rules published in Official Gazette No. 38. 628, apply as of FY 2008.

TaxAuthority: Department of Taxation (CucThue - DT)
TPLaw: Decree 132/2020/ND-CP, Decree 20/2025/ND-CP, Law on Tax Administration No. 38/2019/QH 14, Decree 126/2020/ND-CP
TPSection: Article 5 of Decree 132, Article 1 of Decree 20/2025/ND-CP, Point 21, Article 3 of Law on Tax Administration 38
BEPS13Overview: Yes, CbCR, Master File, and Local File are required.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and must be prepared contemporaneously and annually. Local branches and MNE entities (stand-alone reports) must comply.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Revenue < VND50 billion AND related-party transactions < VND30 billion; or simple functions with sales < VND200 billion and specific profit margins (Distribution: 5%+, Manufacturing: 10%+, Processing: 15%+); or only domestic related-party transactions with same CIT rate and no incentives; or covered by APA. CbCR: Global consolidated income VND18,000 billion. Master File/Local File: Not specified.
SpecificRequirements: Local language required. No safe harbor. No preference for aggregation/individual testing. Appendices I, II, III, IV must be submitted with annual CIT return.
TPReturn: Yes (in the form of appendices to the CIT return)
TaxReturnDeadline: No later than the last day of the third month from the end of financial year.
TPReturnDeadline: No later than the last day of the third month from the end of financial year.
MasterFileDeadline: Upon request of the tax authority.
CbCRDeadline: No later than 12 months from the fiscal year end of the UPE.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: No later than the fiscal year end of the UPE (for CbCR submission appointment).
LocalFilePrepDeadline: By the time of lodging the final CIT return.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; within 30 working days (with possible 15-day extension) upon written request during consultation phase; timely upon request during audit.
LocalComparables: Yes, legally required. Foreign comparables acceptable if no local ones.
SingleYearAnalysis: Yes, single-year testing is required and preferred in audits.
InterquartileRange: Yes, 35th to 75th percentile range, with median at 50th percentile.
AnnualBenchmarking: No specific requirement for fresh search, but annual comparability review and financial update are needed.
BenchmarkingType: Single-year testing is required, using 35th to 75th percentile range.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Comparable companies must have three consecutive years of financial data; local comparables prioritized.
CompliancePenals: Late submission of CIT return (including TP forms): VND2-25 million. Not submitting TP disclosure forms: VND8-15 million. Tax authority can deem adjustments for non-compliance/incomplete info. Post-audit adjustment: 20% of additional tax for incorrect declaration; up to 3x outstanding tax for evasion/fraud; 0.03% per day interest on outstanding tax.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Penalty for incomplete documentation: Yes. Penalty for non-contemporaneous: No. Interest on penalties/refunds: No (but late-payment interest of 0.03% per day on outstanding tax due from adjustment). Penalty relief: No (but timely disclosure may reduce penalties).
TPLimitationPeriod: 10 years from the date tax offenses are found. No limitation if taxpayer did not register for tax.
AdjustmentRegulations: Yes. If below arm's length range, taxpayer must adjust to an appropriate value within the range. Downward adjustments reducing tax liability are prohibited. Tax authority's deemed adjustment is to the median.
AuditLikelihood: Yes. Focus on loss-making/low profit companies, large enterprises, companies with long periods without inspection, those with tax incentives, highly fluctuated financial results. Various industries. High-value/high-risk transactions (royalties, loans, intragroup services).
APAAvailable: Yes (unilateral, bilateral, multilateral).
ThinCapRegulations: No specific tax-driven thin capitalization rules.

TaxAuthority: Zambia Revenue Authority (ZRA)
TPLaw: Income Tax Act, Section 97A Draft Regulations, and 2018 amendments adopting OECD TP Guidelines
TPSection: Sections 97A to 97D
OECDGuidelines: Largely, but local regulations prevail in case of inconsistencies.
BEPS13Overview: Not explicitly adopted for documentation, but some elements are present. CbCR is required, Master File and Local File are not.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneous, annual, stand-alone for each entity, applies to local branches.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Local entities >= ZMW50 million turnover; all MNEs. CbCR: ZMW4,795 million annual global income. No specific thresholds for Master File, Local File, or Economic analysis.
SpecificRequirements: English language preferred; translation required if not. Safe harbor of cost plus 5% for low-value-added services. Individual testing of transactions preferred.
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: Yes, all related-party transactions in annual return; new related companies disclosed within a month.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Companies are required to disclose related-party transactions under the related-party notes to the financial statements.
CbCRinTaxReturn: Yes, the disclosure is added as part of the income tax return.
TaxReturnDeadline: 21 June (for FY 2022)
CbCRDeadline: Within 12 months following the reporting fiscal year-end of the MNE group
CbCRNotificationDeadline: By or before the reporting fiscal year-end of the MNE group
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline; must be in place by 21 June. Submitted within 30 days upon ZRA request.
TPMethodPreference: No. Approved methods include CUP, Resale price, Cost-plus, TNMM, Transactional profit-split.
LocalComparables: There is no legal requirement; local comparables are rarely used because of the challenge in finding information locally.
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear analysis
InterquartileRange: Yes, interquartile range calculation using spreadsheet quartile formulas is acceptable.
AnnualBenchmarking: As a practice, a fresh benchmarking search is not required every year.
BenchmarkingType: A weighted average is preferred, as per common practice.
CompliancePenals: Up to ZMW32 million for non-maintenance/non-furnishing/incomplete documentation or other noncompliance.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, if documentation is incomplete or non-contemporaneous. Interest charged per ITA. Penalty relief available.
TPLimitationPeriod: 10 years
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, adjustment will be made. Taxpayer can object and appeal.
AdjustmentRegulations: There is none specified.
AuditLikelihood: At the time of this publication, there was no specific industry which was more likely to undergo an audit as all industries were receiving audit requests for information.
APAAvailable: Zambia does not have a formal APA program.
ThinCapRegulations: Interest exceeding 30% of tax EBITDA disallowed, with exceptions for financial sector.

TaxAuthority: Zimbabwe Revenue Authority (ZIMRA)
TPLaw: Income Tax Act and Transfer Pricing Documentation Regulations
TPSection: Income Tax Act Section 98B and 35th Schedule- SI 109 of 2019
BEPS13Overview: BEPS Action 13 not adopted. CbCR and Master File not required. Local File required from 2016, no material differences from OECD format.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously prepared annually for each entity, available within 7 days upon request. Applies to local branches.
MaterialityThresholds: No specific financial thresholds for TP documentation, Local File, or economic analysis. CbCR and Master File not applicable.
SpecificRequirements: English language required. No safe harbor. Individual testing preferred, aggregation allowed if closely linked. Additional information may be requested during audit.
OtherRequiredDocs: None except specifically requested by the Revenue Authority
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 April for taxpayers with December year-ends. Within three months after approved year-end for others.
LocalFilePrepDeadline: Should be available by the CIT filing date and be provided within seven days upon request
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within seven days from date of request by the Revenue Authority
TPMethodPreference: Yes, CUP, Cost-plus, TNMM in that order.
LocalComparables: Yes
SingleYearAnalysis: Multiyear
InterquartileRange: Yes
AnnualBenchmarking: No, adopts OECD Guidelines approach.
CompliancePenals: 10% of shortfall tax liability if documentation prepared per regulations- 30% if documentation does not meet regulations and guidelines- 100% if evidence of tax evasion. CbCR-Master File penalties not applicable.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Penalty for incomplete documentation. No penalty for non-contemporaneous documentation. No interest on penalties. Penalty relief available through negotiation.
TPLimitationPeriod: Six years from the relevant year of the assessment, except where there is evidence of fraud, then the six-year limit can be set aside.
AdjustmentRegulations: To the median
AuditLikelihood: Transactions- management fees, license fees, intercompany loans, use of intangible assets. Industries- mining, tobacco, tourism, retail. Situations- perpetual losses, management fees based on percentage of turnover, groups with members in low-tax jurisdictions (e.g., Mauritius), restructuring.
APAAvailable: No legislation in place
MAPAvailable: Available to countries with which double tax agreements are in place.
ThinCapRegulations: Interest expense disallowed if debt-to-equity ratio exceeds 3:1. Exemption for local financial institutions not associated with taxpayer. Equity defined as issued and paid-up capital, unappropriated profits, reserves, realized reserves, and interest-free loans from shareholders.

TaxAuthority: Income Tax Department under the Central Board of Direct Taxes (Department of Revenue of the Ministry of Finance)
TPLaw: Chapter X of the Income Tax Act, 1961 and Income Tax Rules, 1962
TPSection: Various Income Tax Act Sections and Income Tax Rules
BEPS13Overview: India has not formally adopted BEPS Action 13 Local File template, but has contemporaneous documentation requirements largely in line with OECD. Master File and CbCR introduced from FY 2016–17.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneous, annually, for each entity, and applicable to local branches of foreign companies.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: INR10 million for international transactions, INR200 million for SDTs. CbCR: INR64 billion annual global income. Master File: INR5 billion annual global income AND (INR500 million international transactions OR INR100 million IP transactions). Local File: INR10 million for international transactions, INR200 million for SDTs.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (English accepted). Safe harbor available. No preference for aggregation or individual testing. Form 3CEB filing required for international transactions (all quantum) and SDTs (over INR200 million).
RelatedPartyFinancials: Disclosure as per the Indian GAAP
OtherRequiredDocs: Master File (Form 3CEAA), Master File notification (Form 3CEAB), CbCR filing (Form 3CEAD), CbCR designation (Form 3CEAE).
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 November following the relevant financial year
TPReturnDeadline: 31 October of the following financial year
CbCRDeadline: 12 months from the end of the preceding reporting accounting year (or 6 months from intimation of systemic failure for secondary filing).
CbCRNotificationDeadline: At least two months prior to the CbCR furnishing due date
LocalFilePrepDeadline: 31 October of the following fiscal year
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Maintained by 31 October of the following fiscal year; submitted within 10-30 days upon tax authority request.
LocalComparables: Yes, local comparables are preferred, especially if the tested party is Indian. Foreign comparables are generally not accepted unless the tested party is overseas.
SingleYearAnalysis: No, multiyear analysis (three years including current) is preferred.
InterquartileRange: Interquartile range is not recognized. 35th to 65th percentile applied for 6+ comparables; arithmetic mean otherwise.
AnnualBenchmarking: Yes, a fresh benchmarking is required every year.
OtherBenchmarkingCriteria: Qualitative and quantitative filters are followed.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance-non-furnishing-incomplete documentation: 2% of transaction value; INR100,000 for failure to furnish accountant's report. CbCR failure: INR5,000-day (first month), INR15,000-day (beyond one month), INR50,000-day (after notice). Master File failure: INR500,000. Other: INR500,000 for inaccurate CbCR; CbCR query response failure: INR5,000-day (up to order), INR50,000-day (beyond order); Post-inquiry adjustment: 50% of tax on adjustment (no documentation), 200% (not reporting transaction).
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, for incomplete or non-contemporaneous documentation. Interest not charged on penalties, but payable on refunds. Penalty relief can be obtained.
TPLimitationPeriod: 36 months from the close of the relevant financial year for tax audit; TP assessment order 60 days before this limit.
AdjustmentRegulations: No specific regulations on adjustments to median or interquartile range.
AuditLikelihood: Royalty and management fees, marketing intangibles, contract R&D centers, excess outstanding receivables, notional-pass-through costs, financial transactions, procurement structures, and aggregation vs. transaction-by-transaction approach.
APAAvailable: Yes, unilateral, bilateral, or multilateral APAs are available.
APATenure: Up to five years (plus four years roll-back, total nine years).
APARollback: Yes, up to four consecutive years.
ThinCapRegulations: No prescribed debt-to-equity ratio or thin capitalization rule. Interest limitation rule introduced by Finance Act 2017, limiting interest deduction to lower of 30% of EBITDA or interest paid-payable to AE, for interest exceeding INR10 million from AE debt.

TaxAuthority: Maldives Inland Revenue Authority (MIRA)
TPLaw: Maldives Income Tax Act (Law No. 25/ 2019), Transfer Pricing Regulations 2020/R- 43, Country-by-Country Reporting Regulation 2021/R- 9, TP documentation guidelines, TP guide on arm's-length principle
TPSection: Section 68 of the Income Tax Act, Transfer Pricing Regulations 2020/R- 43
DomesticTPObligations: No, except for loan transactions if both associate parties are taxed at the same rate
BEPS13Overview: Adopted for Master File, Local File, and CbCR. CbCR effective 2021 (recommenced 2024), Master File effective 2020, Local File effective 2020. No material differences from OECD format for any.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously (by tax return due date, 30 June); submitted within 30 days of MIRA request. Applicable to local branches. Annual preparation required, but qualifying past TPD can be used for two years. Stand-alone reports for multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Yes, based on turnover (exemptions in Section 7 of TP Regulations). CbCR: Consolidated group revenue > EUR750 million (annual global income). Master File: Not specified, MIRA has not adopted separate Master File/Local File concepts. Local File: Not specified, MIRA has not adopted separate Master File/Local File concepts. Economic analysis: No threshold specified.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement (English or Dhivehi accepted). Safe harbor unspecified. No preference for aggregation or individual testing. Yes, Schedule-04 for international transactions with associates if annual income > MVR20 million (USD1.2 million).
RelatedPartyTaxReturn: Yes, Schedule-04 is part of the CIT return.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, in notes to audited financial statements.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 June of the following tax year
TPReturnDeadline: 30 June of the following tax year (for Schedule-04)
MasterFileDeadline: Prepared by 30 June; submitted within 30 days of MIRA request.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: 31 December (last day of reporting fiscal year)
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within 30 days of MIRA request
LocalComparables: Not specified, benchmarking analysis only for arm's-length interest rate.
SingleYearAnalysis: Not specified
InterquartileRange: Not specified
AnnualBenchmarking: Not specified
CompliancePenals: No TP-specific penalties; general fines and penalties apply.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No TP-specific penalties; general fines and penalties apply. No interest charged on penalties or payable on refund. No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: 2 years from return filing/amendment date; no limit if return not filed. 3 years for fraud/tax evasion.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: MIRA shall tax based on OECD Guidelines.
AdjustmentRegulations: Not specified
AuditLikelihood: Not specified
APAAvailable: Not specified
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization rules introduced 2018, amended 2018, applicable from 2018. Interest deduction limited to 30% of EBITDA (earnings before interest, tax, and capital allowances). Disallowed interest can be carried forward for 10 years. Not applicable to MMA-licensed banks, housing finance, leasing finance, and insurance businesses.

TaxAuthority: General Tax Authority (GTA)
TPLaw: Income Tax Law No. 24 of 2018 and its Executive Regulations (amended 2023)
TPSection: Article 52 of the Income Tax Law and its Executive Regulations
BEPS13Overview: Adopted BEPS Action 13; requires CbCR, Master File, and Local File.
DocRequirements: Yes, contemporaneously, annually, for each entity, and for local branches.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: QAR50M+ revenue/assets; CbCR: QAR3B+ global revenue; Master File: QAR50M+ revenue/assets & offshore related party; Local File: QAR50M+ revenue/assets & offshore related party; Economic analysis: QAR200k+ international related-party transactions.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement; safe harbor for interest deductibility (3x equity); no preference for aggregation/individual testing; TP form required with CIT return under certain thresholds.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Yes, in notes to audited financial statements.
TaxReturnDeadline: Within four months of the end of the accounting period
MasterFileDeadline: Within 60 days after the corporate tax return filing deadline
CbCRDeadline: Within 12 months from the end of the reporting fiscal year
CbCRNotificationDeadline: No later than the last day of the reporting fiscal year
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within 60 days of the tax return filing deadline (if thresholds met); within 30 days upon request (if thresholds not met).
LocalComparables: Yes, local and MENA region comparables preferred.
SingleYearAnalysis: No, multiyear analysis is performed.
InterquartileRange: Yes, interquartile range is used.
AnnualBenchmarking: No, roll forwards and updates acceptable if search is not more than two years old.
CompliancePenals: Late submission of TP documentation: QAR500/day (max QAR180,000); Late filing of tax return (if TP form causes delay): QAR500/day (max QAR180,000); Incorrect CbCR information: QAR500,000.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, for incomplete documentation (interest at 1.5% per month on deficiency); No for non-contemporaneous; Yes, interest charged on additional tax due; No penalty relief.
TPLimitationPeriod: Five years following the year of tax return submission.
AuditLikelihood: Management fees, head office cost allocations, intragroup services, intercompany loans, thin capitalization.
APAAvailable: No formal APA program for State tax regime, but expected. Available for QFC tax regime.
ThinCapRegulations: Interest expense on related party loans should not exceed three times the equity.

TaxAuthority: General Directorate of Taxes (Drejtoria e Përgjithshme e Tatimeve - GDT)
TPLaw: Law no. 29/2023 “On income tax,” as amended (Income Tax Law); Law no. 9920 on tax procedures in the Republic of Albania (Tax Procedures Law); Instruction no. 29, 16 November 2023, “On transfer pricing and Advance Pricing Agreements” (Transfer Pricing Instruction); Double taxation treaties enacted by Albania
TPSection: Article 3, paragraph 13, of Income Tax Law; Paragraphs 3.2 and 3.3 of the Transfer Pricing Instruction
BEPS13Overview: Albania joined the Inclusive Framework on BEPS in August 2019. CbCR applies for fiscal years commencing on or after 1 January 2024, in accordance with OECD's XML schema. Master File and Local File are not required.
DocRequirements: Yes
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Turnover threshold of ALL50 million. CbCR: MNE groups with total consolidated group revenue more than ALL105 billion (approx. EUR 1,050 million) during the fiscal year preceding the reporting fiscal year. No specific thresholds for Master File, Local File, or Economic Analysis.
SpecificRequirements: No local language requirement, but English documentation requires notarized Albanian translation within 45 days of tax authorities' request. Safe harbor unspecified. No preference for aggregation or individual testing, both allowed.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Related-party disclosures are included in the financial statements of the taxpayer pursuant to IFRS requirements.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 March
CbCRDeadline: No later than 12 months after the last day of the reporting fiscal year of the MNE Group.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: No later than the last day of the reporting fiscal year of the MNE Group.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: No statutory deadline. Must be made available to tax authorities within 30 days from their request.
TPMethodPreference: Yes, preference is given to the best method providing the most reliable results. OECD methods (CUP, resale price, cost-plus, TNMM, profit-split) are acceptable. Other appropriate methods allowed if approved ones cannot be reasonably applied.
LocalComparables: Preference is given to local comparables. If not available, regional comparables (Balkans, Eastern Europe, EU) can be used with adjustments.
SingleYearAnalysis: Preference for uncontrolled comparables from the same year as the controlled transaction. Immediate previous-year comparables can be used if comparability criteria met. EY practice uses multiyear analysis.
InterquartileRange: Rules define market range but do not specifically provide for interquartile range. Stipulate adjustment to the median. EY practice uses interquartile range (Q1 to Q3).
AnnualBenchmarking: No general provision. EY practice performs fresh benchmarking search every three to five years, with annual financial updates. Taxpayers with turnover less than ALL50 million can use same data for three consecutive fiscal years if no material changes.
BenchmarkingType: Rules do not provide specific provision. Examples in Instruction use simple average. EY practice uses both weighted average and simple average.
CompliancePenals: Incomplete documentation: No penalty relief for adjustments. Failure to furnish CbCR: ALL10,000 per month delay (up to 12 months), then additional fixed penalty of ALL200,000. Failure to file annual controlled transaction notice: ALL10,000 per month delay.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes
TPLimitationPeriod: No
AdjustmentRegulations: Five years from the date the related CIT return is filed.
AuditLikelihood: Yes
APAAvailable: No. Tax administration is unlikely to challenge the methodology applied; should use the same transfer pricing method applied by the taxpayer if it is the most appropriate one.
APATenure: Rules stipulate adjustment to the median in case of tax authorities' adjustments. No differences among transactions, industries, situations.
APARollback: No differences among transactions, industries and situations.
MAPAvailable: Yes, unilateral, bilateral, and multilateral APAs are available. Requests considered if controlled transactions exceed EUR30 million or involve complexity and high commercial/economic impact for Albania.
ThinCapRegulations: Maximum proposed period is five years, unless bound to a governmental agreement ratified by law.
PCbCRApplies: No, taxpayers may not request a roll-back. However, if the APA is signed and finalized after the first fiscal year of the proposed APA, that year will be considered covered.
PCbCRRegulations: Thin capitalization rules apply if debt-to-equity ratio exceeds 4:1 (for all debts, related and unrelated, except banks/insurance/leasing). For related-party loans, net interest expense balance exceeding 30% of EBITDA is non-deductible, but can be carried forward (subject to 50% ownership change rule).

TaxAuthority: Directorate General of Taxes (Direction Générale des Impôts - DGI)
TPLaw: Complementary Finance Act for 2023, Ministry of Finance Order of 15 February 2024, and various articles of the Algerian Tax Procedure Code and Direct Tax Code.
TPSection: Complementary Finance Act for 2023, Ministry of Finance Order of 15 February 2024, Article 169 bis and 20 ter of the Algerian Tax Procedure Code, Article 141 bis and 192-3 of the Algerian Direct Tax Code.
BEPS13Overview: Has not adopted BEPS Action 13. Does not require CbCR or Master File. Requires Local File.
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and must be prepared contemporaneously and annually. Local branches and MNE entities (stand-alone reports) must comply.
MaterialityThresholds: For TP documentation (including Local File): Annual turnover (excluding taxes) or gross assets of at least DZD1 billion, OR holding/being held by a company with such turnover/assets (50% share capital or 40% voting rights). No specific threshold for economic analysis. CbCR and Master File are not applicable.
SpecificRequirements: Local language (Arabic or French, French in practice) required. No safe harbor. No preference for aggregation or individual testing. Analytical accounting information must be provided upon request during an audit.
TaxReturnDeadline: 30 April of the next fiscal year.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Within 15 days of tax authority's formal notice upon request.
LocalComparables: Yes, local comparables are preferred.
SingleYearAnalysis: Not specified
InterquartileRange: Not specified
AnnualBenchmarking: Not specified
CompliancePenals: DZD15 million for failure to submit online TP declaration or providing insufficient/incorrect info. For failure to provide TP documentation upon request within 15 days: 2% of covered transactions, minimum DZD10 million per audited fiscal year.
PenaltiesPostAudit: Yes, penalties for incomplete/non-contemporaneous documentation (2% of transactions, min DZD10 million if not provided upon request). Interest charged on penalties (capped at 25% of reassessed amount). General penalty relief may be available.
TPLimitationPeriod: Four years following the year for which the tax is due.
MethodologyChallengeConsequences: Yes, an adjustment is theoretically possible.
AdjustmentRegulations: Not provided by local regulation.
AuditLikelihood: Oil and gas, pharmaceutical, information and communication technology industries, and companies making large payments to foreign related parties.
APAAvailable: No specific APA procedure, but a binding tax ruling procedure exists.
ThinCapRegulations: Thin capitalization rules are not applicable. However, the 2019 Finance Act limits interest deductibility for payments to shareholders (to average effective interest rate, capital fully paid, amount not exceeding 50% of capital) and to related parties (to average effective interest rates).

TaxAuthority: Tax Administration Service (Servicio de Administración Tributaria - SAT)
TPLaw: Various Income Tax Law (ITL) articles, Federal Fiscal Code (FFC) articles, Miscellaneous Tax Resolution (MTR) rules, General Foreign Trade Regulations, Nonbinding criteria, and Hydrocarbons Revenue Law (HRL) articles.
TPSection: ITL, Article 179 (related party definition)
BEPS13Overview: BEPS Action 13 adopted for TP documentation, effective 1 Jan 2016. Requires CbCR (MNEs >= MXN12bn, effective FY 2016, OECD aligned), Master File (certain taxpayers, effective FY 2016, some differences from OECD), and Local File (certain taxpayers, effective FY 2016, material differences from OECD).
DocRequirements: Yes, documentation guidelines exist and need to be prepared contemporaneously. A local branch of a foreign company needs to comply. Documentation must be prepared annually. Stand-alone reports are required for each entity of an MNE with multiple entities.
MaterialityThresholds: TP documentation: Yes, turnover. MXN13 million for regular business activities or MXN3 million for professional services (prior-year income). CbCR: MXN12,000 million annual global income. Master File: MXN1,016,759,000 accruable income in previous FY. Local File: MXN1,016,759,000 accruable income in previous FY. Economic analysis: No financial threshold, arm's-length applies to all transactions.
SpecificRequirements: Local language: Yes, Spanish for submission (Master File can be English-Spanish, Local File Spanish). Safe harbor: Yes, for maquiladoras (6.5% return over costs or 6.9% over assets). Aggregation or individual testing: Individual testing preferred. Other disclosure: Yes, reportable transactions (BEPS Action 12) covering various complex or tax-beneficial arrangements with related parties or cross-border elements.
RelatedPartyFinancials: Usually, information of type of intercompany transactions, amount and name of the related party is included in the audited financial statements.
OtherRequiredDocs: As part of ISSIF and Tax Report, the tax ID of the individual who prepared the TP documentation or BEPS Local File must be disclosed. Reportable transactions also require disclosure.
TaxReturnDeadline: 31 March
TPReturnDeadline: TP exhibits-questionnaires (ISSIF): 31 March. Exhibit 9 (DIM): 15 May. TP exhibits-questionnaires (Tax Report): 15 May. Local File: 15 May. DIEMSE: 30 June. Master File: 31 December. Formato 76: within 3 months of transaction. All deadlines are of the following fiscal year.
CbCRNotificationDeadline: No later than 31 December of the following fiscal year after the last day of the reporting fiscal year of the MNE group (for surrogate Mexican parent entities whose holding company’s or reporting entity’s fiscal year ends between June and November). Disclosure in Tax Report-ISSIF.
LocalFileSubmissionDeadline: Statutory deadline for submission: No formal statutory deadline for contemporaneous TP documentation, but information disclosed in ISSIF (31 March), Tax Report (15 May), and Exhibit 9 (15 May). BEPS Local File usually filed by 15 May. Time period for submission upon tax authority request: Visita Domiciliaria: immediate to 6 working days. Gabinete: 15 working days (plus 10-day extension). Tax Report audits: 6-15 working days.
LocalComparables: In principle, preference for regional comparables (Canadian, US, Latin-American companies accepted with adjustments). No legal requirement for local jurisdiction comparables.
SingleYearAnalysis: Further arguments are required to support multiyear analysis, applicable only when the business cycle of the Mexican taxpayer is more than one year and properly demonstrated.
InterquartileRange: Yes, interquartile range is calculated according to Article 302 of the Regulations of the ITL. As of FY 2022, ITL states the use of the interquartile range as the only statistical method for any TP methods.
AnnualBenchmarking: Yes
BenchmarkingType: Preference for the weighted average for TP analysis, applicable when multiyear analysis can be supported.
CompliancePenals: Non-maintenance-non-furnishing-incomplete furnishing: MXN99,590-MXN199,190. Failure to furnish CbCR-Master File-Local File: MXN199,6300-MXN284,220, plus disqualification from public sector contracts and registry cancellation. Other penalties: Same consequences. Self-correction before audit has no penalties; reduced penalties during audit. Specific rules for deductibility of ex-ante-ex-post adjustments.
PenaltiesPostAudit: No
TPLimitationPeriod: Yes
AdjustmentRegulations: Five years from the date of filing the tax return. Affected by amended returns and suspended by an audit. SAT has two years to complete a TP audit.
AuditLikelihood: Yes
APAAvailable: Yes
APARollback: Yes. High audit risk on business restructuring (limited risk structures, migration of intangibles, centralization of functions-risks), highly leveraged structures, client segregated accounts (CSAs), pro rata-based charges (management fees), foreign payments (royalties, interest expenses). Industries: hydrocarbons, life science, automotive.
MAPAvailable: Yes, unilateral and bilateral APAs are available. Unilateral APAs cover the fiscal year of application, three subsequent fiscal years, and a one-year roll-back. Maquiladoras can no longer apply for APAs.
ThinCapRegulations: Unilateral APAs: fiscal year of application, three subsequent fiscal years, and a one-year roll-back. Bilateral APAs: could include more than five years.
PCbCRAuthority: Yes, MAPs could be requested based on the relevant double tax treaty.
PCbCRRegulations: Thin capitalization: Interest on debts > 3x shareholders' equity from foreign-resident related parties is nondeductible. Interest expense deduction limitation: Net interest expense deduction up to 30% of 'adjusted taxable income' for taxpayers with interest expense > MXN20 million. Non-deductible interest carried forward 10 years. Exceptions for financial institutions and specific infrastructure-energy projects.
PCbCRCriminalRisk: Not applicable / Not applicable / Not applicable / Not applicable
